name: Magic: The Gathering – Prophecy
description:
Violent winds of Keldon prophecy threaten to bring about the end of Dominara, but the mana-rich lands of Jamuraa are far from defenseless. As powerful factions clash, giant Avatars fight by your side, and Rhystic spells give you more than you pay for …

This 143-card set includes randomly inserted foil premium cards and features new mechanics like Wind spells, giant Avatars, and Rhystic spells.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Terraforming Mars: Ares Expedition – Private Investor Beach Promo Card
description:
Originally available in pack A of the Dice Tower 2022 Kickstarter campaign. This promo is also part of the Terraforming Mars: Ares Expedition Discovery expansion with a different artwork as card (A)[D19].

8 cost event
requires a milestone
instant: flip an ocean

name: Town Center: Beaune / Turku
description:
Beaune/Turku is the newest addition to the Town Center line, which started with Alban Viard's brain-burning, elegant city-building sim game.

As Beaune is a walled town surrounded by vineyards, there are no suburbs. Also, the "elevator" black cubes must be built in the center. We're guessing that's because in many medieval towns, no building was allowed to be taller than the church, but who knows, the designer works in mysterious ways!

The Turku map has two seasons, summer and winter, alternating between odd- and even-numbered turns. During the summer, the two halves are considered separate, and during the winter, when the Aura river freezes, the two parts are considered one city - which allows for some clever play, such as building green cubes "next" to green cubes in the summer, when they are not considered adjacent, only for them to be joined in the winter.

name: Jenga: Philadelphia Eagles Collector's Edition
description:
As the tower builds, so does the difficulty…and so does the fun!

This classic tower building game features 54 green and grey hard wood blocks decked out with the Eagles logo and TWO ways to play. Build your Eagles-themed Jenga tower the traditional way or play a new and even more challenging game with custom Eagles rules and an Eagles-themed dice. Either way you play you are guaranteed edge-of-your-seat excitement!

name: Flames of War: Firestorm Campaign – Operation Market Garden
description:
From the Publishers Website:

In four weeks time the largest airborne operation in history will begin once more. An entire airborne army will attempt to seize key bridges leading into the heartland of the Reich. Thirty British Corps will follow on from this attack, driving up the road to Arnhem and into the heartland of German. Can you end the war before Christmas or will it be a bridge too far?

Firestorm Market Garden is a campaign system for Flames of War.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Discover Your Lover
description:
The goal of Discover Your Lover is to activate and stimulate a couple’s sexual energy and heighten their attention for each other. The game is specifically designed to bring a couple closer together and will show players surprising sides of themselves and their partner! Discover Your Lover is disarming, exciting, direct and daring. It can also be hilarious at times but never disrespectful. Players strive to reach the finish as quickly as possible by answering questions and performing tasks. They are faced with questions that test erotic knowledge in general as well as their understanding of their partner’s sexuality. The player to cross the finish first wins their ultimate desire! The tasks are on three levels, from tender and playful to more passionate and challenging. The variety makes this game one that couples can revisit again and again.

Includes:
20" x 20" game board, 240 question cards, 240 task cards, 1 die, 2 pawns, 2 hour glasses and rules of the game.

name: Milky Way Express
description:
Milky Way Express is a Free Print-and-Play space trading and exploration game.

Game Summary
You start the game with a credit of $10 and your aim is to earn enough money throughout the game to pay back this loan when the game ends.
You will take turns moving your Spaceship on cards laid out as a chart of the Milky Way Galaxy, discovering new Planets as you go. You will throw dice to determine what goods will be on offer at each planet. Available goods will vary from turn to turn, so buy low and sell high while the market is friendly to you. But if luck abandons you, you may be driven to Bankruptcy by greedy Pirates and zealous Customs controls (if you dare to smuggle any illegal goods).
The game ends when you turn over the last unexplored card on the Galactic Chart, or when you run out of money.

This game is released under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported License - that means you can use and modify the game for free, but you can't sell it or claim it as your own.
categories: Dice, Exploration, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Trading

name: Hexica
description:
Hexica is a 2-4 player capture the flag/fleet combat game set in space. At the start of each player's turn, a flag spawns on a random spot. After three rounds, flags run out and players are forced into combat to steal each others flags. Aside from the specialized six ships that compose each fleet in the game, players also have access to twenty Advanced Systems cards. Each player starts with two of these cards and more can be purchased throughout the game. These cards temporarily affect four aspects of the game: the economy, movement, attack, and defense of each player's fleet.

At the start of a game, players secure an economic foothold using carefully placed Harvesters to earn money. During the second round, players begin building an army to defend their Motherships and capture flags. During a player's turn, all of his or her ships can move and attack.

The six ships used in the game are: (1) The Mothership, the slow but hardy flagship of every fleet. (2) Harvesters, which harvest materials in space and earn money. (3) Salvagers, which collect the wreckage of destroyed ships for a money reward and pick up and carry flags. (4) F13s, cheap, fast, and weak fighters meant for quick skirmishes and surprise attacks. (5) F35s, expensive, slow, and strong fighters used for heavy assaults. (6) Bandits, used to steal enemy ships.

Mastering Hexica requires an understanding of the strengths and weaknesses of the ships used in the game, a familiarity with the Advanced Systems cards, creative thinking, and skill in successfully distracting and misleading the enemy.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Mage Wars: Sersiryx, Imp Familiar Promo Card
description:
This promo card is given as a reward for participating on Organized play. This is part of the Allegiance in Blood story arc.

Sersiryx, Imp Familiar

Creature, Legendary, Familiar, Flame -2, Warlock only.

Cost 12 Mana
Health 9
Armor 2
Gain 1 mana per round.

Quick Attack: Melee, 2 Dice, Fire Damage, Burn 7+, Defrost.

Sersiryx can cast only Level 1-2 Fire Attack Spells or Level 1-2 curse enchatments.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Tsair Deng
description:
Tsair Deng (Slant nail) is similar to One Arm Joe, except that it is played with Chinese dominoes instead of a standard double six set. Also similar to the Korean game of Dancing Dragons, which is essentially the same game played with two open ends instead of one.

If four people play, each is dealt 8 tiles. If three people play, each is dealt 10 tiles and the remaining two are not played. If two people play, each is dealt 16 tiles.

For the first tile laid, the leader must declare which half is 'open'. Then all dominoes are connected to the only open half of the boneyard, in a straight line. Once the boneyard counts a multiple of eight dominoes, the dominoes are stacked backward upon the previous row. The boneyard can therefore count up to four rows.

Whenever a player is unable to play, he must discard a tile from his hand facedown.

When all the players' hands are empty, the round is scored. Each players counts the pips on his tiles, and must pay to his opponents with lesser scores the difference in points. If a player manages to play all his tiles, this scoring difference is doubled.

name: Mechana Rising
description: Mechana Rising is set in a sci-fi comic book universe in which factions fight for control of the world using giant mechs.

name: On Your Mark!
description:
On Your Mark!: The Art of Sketching and Guessing Card Game

On your mark, get set, draw! Whether you’re great at drawing or not, you’ll sketch your way to laughter in this creative party game! Start by sketching a secret word or phrase on your canvas card. The twist is that your card already has a mark on it that must be incorporated into your drawing. Score points by guessing other players’ secret words. The player with the most correct guesses wins. It’s hours of fun and might even be your 15 minutes of fame.

Card game includes: 150 TITLE Cards, 150 CANVAS Cards, 8 dry erase markers, 8 card stands, 8 score sheets, 2 erasers and an instruction sheet.
For ages 10+.
For 2-8 players.
Game lasts approximately 30 minutes.
9.5" W x 2.75" H x 4.5" D

name: Vossa Excelência: O Jogo Político
description: Vossa Excelência: O Jogo Político (Your Excellency: The Political Game) is a card game about dirty politics. Players are elected office holders and have four years to consolidate their power to ensure re-election. They have to abuse their power to get enough votes and silence the opposition.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That

name: Saboteur: Veto
description:
Saboteur: Veto is a single card expansion for Saboteur distributed during the 2019 Saboteur Championship. This card can be played with the base game of Saboteur and Saboteur: The Duel.

When playing the "Veto" card, you will cancel the card just played by an opponent.

Additional Clarification:


You must play the “Veto” card during the turn of an opponent. This means after that player has played his card, but also before he/she draws a replacement card.
When you play that card on the previous player, this means that you play twice a card in a row: once out of your turn and once in your turn.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Take That, Team-Based Game, Traitor Game

name: Porte Saint Denis
description:
サン・ドニ (San Doni) Porte Saint-Denis is a worker placement game set in Paris. The game is designed for four players only. Players send their workers into four triumphal gates to gain or convert resources during action phase, then they spend resources to construct buildings and ramparts during construction phase.

The distinctive features are variable cost and worker availability.

Each gate has six action spots. Five of these spots enable you to gain or convert resources. From the leftmost spot to right, its effect becomes greater.

The cost to send a worker is randomly determined by cost card. There are six spots which corresponds to action spots. From the leftmost spot to right, it becomes more costly. You may place a worker on any vacant spot, but doing so makes all spots rightward cheaper.

You should note that workers you sent to a gate don't return until someone send a worker to the rightmost spot of the gate, in which case the rightmost worker contributes to the gate's influence, earning its owner income per round, and all other workers on the gate return. Then a new cost card is placed.

During building phase, you may spend resources to gain coins, and construct a building and ramparts. Each building has its unique ability, and ramparts grants you victory points. The first player who has passed, takes these actions as many as they desire. Except for coins, all unspent resources are lost at the end of this phase, so you must plan ahead how many resources you need this round and where you should send your workers.

At the end of the game, the highest scorer wins the game.
user summary

フランスの市門ににワーカーを派遣して影響力を獲得し、建物や城壁を建築するゲームです。ワーカープレイスメントですが、資源の持ち越しはできず、毎ラウンドでアクションをパスした順に建築を行うのが特徴です。
publisher's summary

name: Peaky Blinders: Birmingham Domain
description:
Peaky Blinders: Birmingham Domain is a card game published directly by a Brazilian company, set in the scene of the famous TV series.

Players embody the top five gangs from the series Peaky Blinders in a fierce battle for hegemony in the Birmingham region. Therefore, it is not enough to expand their territories and open pubs. You will need to use your own gang's special skill wisely, create a working network for your (illicit) activities to thrive, get the most out of the characters and use the best moment to attack (or defend against) your opponents. Mechanics and themes were matured by the expertise of designer Marcos Macri and his long creative process. The result is an exciting, fun and balanced card game. You don't need to know or like the show to enjoy this game, but fans will delight in the elegance of the artwork and character reincarnation.

In his turn, the player has three options: expand his region or open a new business, laying down cards in his table; or receive profits from the table itself. It's also possible to use the effect of different characters to optimize actions and improve gang development.

After the endgame is triggered (the pubs cards or the territory cards have run out), the leader who scores more points wins and achieves supremacy over rival gangs.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Income, Move Through Deck, Solo / Solitaire Game, Take That, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Seastead: Promo Pack #1
description:
Numbered as Promo 01-04
Promo01 Buccaneer (dive or build): Choose a location that has one of your opponent's ships and resolve the location effect
Promo02 Pillager (dive or build): Take any 2 resources from the supply
Promo03 Taskmaster (build): After you complete a build action, take another build action immediately
Promo04 Freebooter (build): When you take the build action, resolve the locations effect a second time

All of the these cards also say: Do not exhaust after use. Give it to your opponent instead.

name: Aqua
description:
You and your fellow player are curators who want to create the best set-up for a new water-themed exhibit at your art museum. One of you believes very strongly in the power of vertical alignment, while the other argues that the focus should be on horizontal structure. You each take turns placing the paintings in the exhibit, and once you've finished, you earn presentation points for the horizontal or vertical groupings of the artwork. When the exhibition ends, the curator with the most points wins!

In more detail, in Aqua, players take turns placing painting cards in the museum, with cards being placed face down when they're adjacent to face-up cards, and vice versa. When a face-down card is surrounded, flip it face up. When someone plays a face-up boat, each player moves a visitor token up to three spaces from that card, with each visitor token adding 1 point to the card on which it stands. Players score points by strategically aligning cards with matching icons and numbers in each row or column, with one player scoring the columns at game's end and the other scoring the rows — but these lines score only if they're valued from 10-20 points, so don't concentrate too much artistic power in one line!
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Think Like A Shrink
description:
Think Like a Shrink is not just a game, it's an experience that will have you laughing and learning at the same time. Created by two best friends - a psychologist and psychiatrist - who served together in the military, this adult party/conversation game is designed to help players connect.

Here are some key features and benefits of the game:


Quick to learn. Always entertaining, Within five minutes, you'll be diving into the engaging world of "Think Like a Shrink". A party game designed for 2 to 6 players with infinite card combinations, ensuring that boredom never makes an appearance.



Race around the clock-shaped game board to be named "top shrink" by correctly predicting the thoughts, emotions, and experiences of other players thru associating random photos with intriguing phrases… throw in some “feelings cards…” because we’re shrinks after all. Who knew fake therapy could be so much fun!



Enjoy hilarious moments and "Ah Hah" insights that will leave you feeling closer to your friends and family.


—description from the publisher

name: Fog of Love: Guessing Games Promo Card
description:
Originally available as part of the Man vs. Meeple Season 4 Kickstarter.

Promo card: [PLAYER], choose which game you think your partner is thinking of. [OTHER], choose which game you are actually thinking of?

name: Bisque
description:
A trick-taking game for 3 players for the Decktet.

Three chefs in one kitchen, that can’t be good. They all want to make soup, even though there’s only one kettle available. Stubborn as they are they all start to work on the same soup. To make things worse, all chefs have a very personal taste. During the process each chef tries to squeeze in as much of their own preferences as they possibly can. After the soup is done, the personal taste of each chef is revealed and it is evaluated which chef has managed to add his own flair and ingredients the most.

In Bisque every player secretly selects a goal card from his hand to declare which suits he wants to end up in the soup pot. With the rest of the cards tricks are played and the winner of each tricks decides which card will end up in the soup pot. After all the tricks the suits in the soup pot are scored. The goal cards are revealed and the winner of the round is declared.

name: Handsket
description:
It's the New Basketball Dexterity Game that have never been before . The idea for the game is gained from the coin basketball.

You can dribble, pass, shoot and put the ball through the rim. Score 21 points to win with strategic and efficient arrangement!

"The more you practice, the better you will become."

name: Beatdown: Streets of Justice
description:
"Plan your combo. Save the city together. — A fun, cooperative, strategic crime-fighting card game."

Beatdown is a 1-4 player fully cooperative card game. Players team up to defeat waves of comic-book criminal and eventually go toe-to-toe with a crime-boss that threatens their city. The group wins if they are able to reach and defeat the boss and lose if all players are simultaneously reduced to 0 hitpoints.

The core fighting mechanic revolves around building combos by using a mixture of attack cards in hand and from the shared "Attack" deck. Between each attack players must roll a 10-sided combo die to see if they can continue their attack. Each added attack increases the difficulty rating of this roll. A failed combo roll leaves an opening for enemies to attack.

At the start of the game each player chooses a hero with a unique stat-line and ability. Heroes tend to have roles for group play such as tanky wrestlers or fragile high-damage boxers. Planning the right team to bring can be crucial for defeating the foes that await.
—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Push Your Luck

name: Heat of Battle: FireFights! 2
description:
The ‘FireFights!’ system continues with FF2. The scenarios are small, intense actions compatible with the ASL game system or other tactical level wargames. Variety and re-playability are key components of FireFights 2. The fog of war and variety remains high with variable reinforcement groups. Each scenario also comes with its own historically based map which also serves as a half board overlay. The half board overlays are compatible with boards 1, 14, 19, 26-31, 33. Designed for those that love a great game that can be played in one week- night setting, while they pit the opposing forces against each other and against time as the FireFight! Series has only 4-5 game turns per scenario.

FF-10 Near Bicske, Hungary, 4 January 1945 - A small group of SS troopers and tanks from the 5th SS Wiking Division have been ordered to fight a rear guard action. In an ancient castle they take their stand against Russian heavy metal... the feared IS-2 heavy tanks.

FF-11 Tug Argan Pass, British Somaliland, 11 August 1940 - The Italian army in Ethiopia needed a way out of the country. The only way was through the Tug Argan Pass... Only the Indian troops of the British Empire stood in their way.

FF-12 Ste. Marie du Mont, France, 6 June 1944 - Scattered far and wide the US paratroopers of the 506th Parachute Infantry, have come down in the wrong place... directly into a German occupied French village. Now, all they have to do is GET OUT!

FF-13 Mt. Cochen, Agordat, Eritrea, 29 January 1941 - The British want the Italians out of Eritrea and send the 11th Indian Brigade to roust them out. But on this lonely mountain, the Italians wanted to fight! After 2 days the Italians were counter-attacking and the Indians were in retreat.

FF-14 Bodange, Belgium, 10 May 1940 - War has come to western Europe! On 10 May 1940, the German XIX Korps crossed into the Belgian Ardennes. What to stop them? Nothing!, But stiff resistance by the Belgian Chasseurs could sure slow them down.

FF-15 Haut le Wastia, France, 14 May 1940 - French units of the 5th Motorized Division, in a desperate attempt to stem the German tide, counter-attacked the German 7th Panzer Division near the small hamlet of Haut le Wastia. Surprising the Germans, French were able to reoccupy the hamlet for awhile.

Expands:

Advanced Squad Leader
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: What the Food?! Special Edition Expansion
description:
What the Food?! Special Edition Expansion introduces all new flavors to your classic food fight! Pick on the new kids - 5 bonus characters join the fray, each with their own unique abilities. Pile on the humiliation points with many more foods, toppings and conditions, and discover all new actions and events for a cafeteria battle you won’t forget!

Note: Requires copy of What the Food?! to play!

Contains: 38 cards.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor
mechanics: Action Queue, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: High Heavens: Terrain Expansion
description:
Change the very landscape that the gods traverse with the High Heavens: Terrain set. Players can bring passive and active terrain features to the board for all new tactical play. Ymir’s Bones create two impenetrable zones while the two monsters, Scylla and Charybdis wreak havoc with those gods foolish enough to approach them.

High Heavens: Terrain includes:


Rules
4 Plastic terrain figures
2 terrain cards
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Mythology, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Grid Movement, Hand Management

name: Back of House
description:
Solo dice placement in a restaurant kitchen. Roll dice to determine your crew for the turn. Fulfil orders and manage kitchen events. Make it through your shift (order deck) while maintaining tidiness and morale and you win.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Rauha: Syntyma
description:
Two modules to add to your Rauha universe:

- Discover the Shaman cards that open up new possibilities. Vary your games and your strategies with 7 new Divine Entity tiles.

- Tiny Creatures lurking in the shadows or at the bottom of lakes are appearing. New cults are emerging, related to the Biomes and the recently occurring fauna.
mechanics: Layering, Pattern Building, Simultaneous Action Selection, Square Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: DC Comics Deck-Building Game: Clayface Promo Card
description:
This DC Deck-Building Game Promo Card was included with early orders of DC Deck-Building Game: Dark Nights: Metal ordered directly from Cryptozoic and some retailers.

Villain
Reveal the top 3 cards of your deck, then discard all cards with the highest cost revealed this way. Draw the rest.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Player Powers

name: Evolution: Claws
description:
Promo card for pre-order Russian copy of Evolution: Flight on the Boomstarter

"Claws"
Play this card on your ground Predator during the card draw phase after opening the card properties.
The predator immediately attacks, ignoring one protective property of the victim.
Take a new card.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Educational, Environmental, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Prehistoric
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That
publishers: NorthStar Game Studio, Rightgames RBG SIA

name: Brook City: Velocity Expansion
description:
A mad bomber has caused mayhem all over town, blowing up landmarks and government institutions. While she has yet to harm anyone in the process, the damage she's causing to the city is nigh catastrophic. With all this chaos and destruction going on in Brook City, the BCPD can use any help it can get. Chance Mitchell has taken this opportunity to get some hands on experience with law enforcement for his upcoming cop movie. That’s right, Chance is a famous actor doing research for a new film, but gets caught up in real world cop work in the mean streets of Brook City.

In Velocity, the cops face a new criminal in the form of Leeta Wix, a street orphan from nearby Ransom City with an explosive attitude. Her crimes are focused on evacuating important buildings in Brook City so she can blow them to the ashes, proving to the Syndicate that she's a much better asset to their organization than a liability. Meanwhile, the cops have to solve a new dangerous case. Someone has strapped a civilian bus with enough explosives to send it into the atmosphere. What's worse? If the bus stops, it blows! So the cops have to carefully navigate a speeding bus, represented on the board by a detailed plastic miniature, along the streets of Brook City while preventing collateral damage from spelling their destruction.

The Velocity Expansion introduces a new modular element to Brook City in the form of wrecks. While these plastic wreck markers can be used in any game, they are specifically designed to augment the included "Velocity" case. With the wreck deck, any time a cop is forced to lose their vehicle, it crashes and causes a wreck. Wrecks block the streets and cause additional stress to cops; meaning if they don't clean up the streets, they'll get fired in no time!

Components: 1 bus miniature, 1 cop miniature, 12 crew miniatures, 12 wrecks, 82 cards (25 cop cards, 22 criminal cards, 21 case cards, 14 wreck cards)
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Eridanos
description:
In the competitive card game Eridanos, your goal is to sink your opponent's ships by choosing the best combination of attacks at just the right moment.

In more detail, players take control of a fleet of ships, engaging in head-to-head combat. Each round, four cards are played into the foray face down, after which players take turns attacking and withdrawing with their vessels until one side has surrendered.

Each card has a specific strength or weakness, winning or losing only to the exact cards listed on it. To win, you need to enter your opponent's mind to determine which cards they have and outmaneuver them to victory.

name: Graphos
description:
A Brazilian adaptation of Tryce, a game by 3M.

This card game is played in seven dealings, divided in three phases. To win a dealing a player has to use all his cards to complete a number (ever increasing) of three types of matches: groups (three or more cards of the same number or color), sequences (four or more number-ordered cards of the same color) or words (four or more cards forming a word). The 4th and the last dealings are called "direct": only words can be formed (no groups or sequences), and the winner must get rid of his last card without discarding it. After each dealing points are awarded based on the matches made (cards with "hard" letters give are worth more).

It's a fun game for families or groups of friends who enjoy word games.

From the back of the box:

GRAPHOS is an intriguing game that combines letters, colors and numbers. With a little luck and a lot of thought, players seek to build groups, sequences and words that are required for each dealing.
Gradually, dealings become more defiant, requiring increasing mental agility for envisioning that combination.
Evah nuf, that is, have fun!

name: Sherwood Bandits: The 5th Player
description:
Components for adding a fifth player to Sherwood Bandits:

1 Gang Leader
4 Bandits
4 Dice
3 New Wagons
3D Chest

name: Magic: The Gathering – Throne of Eldraine
description:
Welcome to Eldraine—a storybook land of castles and cauldrons, of chivalrous knights and trickster faeries. But like the devious creatures and beguiling magic that lurk among the shadows, this world is not all that it seems. Join the five courts of the Realm on an epic adventure for honor and glory, or venture a darker path into the mysterious wilds. Which path will you choose?

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Income, Interrupts, Take That

name: Tanks, but no thanks!
description:
Tanks, But No Thanks! is set on the gridded battlefield where each player controls a tank battalion, targeting the tanks and bases of other players. The last battalion standing wins. Moving tanks or firing at enemies utilize dice.

Each player is given a secret early-victory mission card and a secret one-time-use bonus power card at the start of each game. Each turn, players choose between aiming and firing at enemies or strategically positioning their tanks to infiltrate enemy territory while defending their home bases. The winner is either the player who has the last battalion standing or the first player to complete their early victory mission, whichever happens first.

What is your approach? Do you aggressively charge into enemy territory? Watch out! Another opponent may take out your bases while you are away. Think you don’t have a chance with only one tank remaining? If you’re cunning and have luck on your side, you may still turn the tables!

Tanks, But No Thanks! will bring you hours of fun, whether you are a fan of tank battles or love out-smarting your opponents. All you need is the right strategy and maybe a little bit of luck.
categories: Wargame, World War I, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Mediterranean Empires: The Struggle for the Middle Sea, 1281-1350 AD
description:
Mediterranean Empires is a low- to intermediate-complexity, two-player, strategic-level wargame simulating the fight for the Western and Central Mediterranean during the turn of the 13th-14th centuries. From the War of the Sicilian Vespers (1282-1302) to the Venetian-Genoese Wars of the 14th Century. Aragonese, Angevins, French, the Papacy, Genoese, Venetians and Sicilians fight each other for the mastery of the Mediterranean.

There are 7 game turns. Every game turn represents c. 10 years of conquest, pillage and backstabbing.

Published in issue #330 of Strategy & Tactics Magazine

-description from publisher

name: Star Fleet Battles Reinforcements
description:
Star Fleet Battles Reinforcements provided 432 additional 1/2" counters to the Star Fleet Battles Commander's Edition.

It included alternate color Kzinti, Lyran, and Orion Pirate counters for use with alteranate clans.

The back cover of Star Fleet Battles Reinforcements included Five (5) full color planets that could be cut out
and placed on the standard 30x42 hex map. Planets included:


Eleven (11) hex planet (Gas Giant about the size of Saturn)
Seven (7) hex planet (Gas Giant)
Five (5) hex planet (Gas Giant about the size of Uranus)
Three (3) hex planet
Three (3) hex planet
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Cibola
description:
Cibola is a head-to-head race to find the Seven Cities of Gold. In Cibola, players seek to collect and place the five required keys to unlock each of the seven gold statues. Players can use various tools and cunning to hinder their opponent.

There are also Silver (wild) statues for players to unlock. However, these will cause players to decrease their hand limit by one card, making their journey all that much harder.

The game ends once one of the two players has unlocked all seven statues.

name: Tranquility Base: SovietMoon
description:
SovietMoon is an AI game system that expands Tranquility Base into an exciting and true Soviet vs. US Space Race.

SovietMoon pits the US players against the Soviets as each try to achieve the first manned lunar landing. The game can be considered semi-cooperative but it is still a race to be the first to land on the moon. The SovietMoon deck provides an AI opponent that is challenging and difficult to beat. Players may find opportunities to cooperate for overall success, but superior game-play and completion of multiple missions in a single turn will benefit players the most.

—description from the publisher
publishers: History In Action Game (The Galactic Attic), Worthington Publishing, LLC

name: Anno Domini: Maschinen
description:
Each Anno Domini game consists of 340 cards, with a description of a historical event on one side of the card and the year (and sometimes specific date) in which it happened on the other. Like all Anno Domini sets, this game can be played as a standalone or mixed with some or even all editions.

In Anno Domini: Maschinen, each player receives nine cards (or fewer, if you want the game to be shorter) and may look only at the descriptions. In turn, players place a card on the table, trying to place their card in chronological order to those already present. Instead of adding a card, a player may claim that the order in which the cards have been placed is incorrect. In this case all cards are turned over and the correct years revealed.

If the order is correct, then the doubting player receives two cards and skips a turn. If the order is incorrect, then the previous player – who accepted the order as correct or made it incorrect through her own placement – receives three cards. The first player with no cards remaining in hand wins.

Part of the Anno Domini series
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Party Game, Trivia

name: Crime Story: London
description:
At the famous Shakespeare Festival at the London Globe, the lead actor of Hamlet, Calvin Redgrave, has disappeared without a trace - hours before the most important performance of the year! What has happened? Who is involved? And most importantly, where is Calvin?

In 60 minutes, the players try to find out together what happened and who committed the crime. They decide which traces they want to follow and which they do not want to consider. Clues must be interpreted correctly and secrets must be uncovered.

name: Ultimate Treehouse
description:
You are the crew leader of a critter-based construction crew responsible for building your personal, fully-customized treehouse.

Play Action cards from your hand to accumulate the resources (Wood, Metal, Fasteners, Fabric, and Rope) required to build any or all of the fourteen different treehouse elements in your quest to build the Ultimate Treehouse.

But think strategically and build smart! Your friends are managing their own critter crew and looking to build their even more Ultimate Treehouse!

Your task begins in the town of Mapleleaf and is played over a series of days (each a round), helped or hindered by weather conditions. When all rounds have been played, the player with the most victory points wins!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That, Tile Placement, Variable Set-up

name: Tracer 2
description:
Translated from the game rule:

Welcome to the world of Tracer. In this game you and your opponent play the roles of highly intelligent Tracers. Your mission is to mine for hidden treasures in four mountains swifter than your competitor. During the process you will test each other's memory, judgment, luck, as well as the calmness of discovering a vein of mineral. Only the sliest will prevail.

Game Content (54 Cards):

43 Action Cards (12 kinds)
4 Legendary Tracers
7 Mineral Vines (Including Archaeological Treasure)

Re-implemented by:

Montanara

name: Barring the Gate
description:
Viewed as an easy capture by Napoleon on the morning of Waterloo, the stout defense of Château d'Hougoumont ended up diverting and absorbing an entire French corps of troops! The prolonged action throughout the day completely derailed Napoleon's plans to quickly shatter the Anglo-Allied forces before the Prussians arrived. The gate is barred; can you break through?

The 27th game in the Pocket Battle Games series.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Empires of the Dragon: The Far East at War – Field of Glory Gaming Companion
description:
From the web
"If you know the enemy and know yourself, your victory will not stand in doubt; if you know Heaven and know Earth, you may make your victory complete" (Sun Tzu, The Art of War). Empires of the Dragon, the new companion book for Field of Glory, reveals the secrets of the armies of Asia, from the samurai of Japan and the forces of the Qin to the elephant hordes of India and Thailand. With historical overviews, maps and artwork, and details for hundreds of new troop types, generals now have everything they need to know to command or crush the empires of the Far East.
Empires of the Dragon: The Far East at War ARMY LISTS

Introduction
Erlitou-Shang Chinese
Early Zhou Chinese
Yayoi Japanese
Early Horse Nomad

Warring States to Western Han Chinese
Qiang and Di

Three Kingdoms, Western Jin and Southern Dynasties Chinese

Northern Dynasties Chinese

Later Hindu South Indian
Central Asian City States

Later Horse Nomad
Tibetan
Parhae Korean
Late Tang to Five Dynasties Chinese
Khmer or Champa
Nanzhao
Koryo Korean

Pagan Burmese
Liao
Song Chinese
Xi Xia
Ghurid Afghan
Jin
Late Heian to Muromachi Japanese
Mongol Conquest
Muslim Indian Sultanates
Medieval Indonesian or Malay
Yuan Chinese
Medieval Burmese
Ming Chinese
Yi Korean
categories: Ancient, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: Forces of Hordes: Skorne
description:
Publishers Blurb

Enslave and Subjugate
From the blasted stormlands of Immoren march the vicious armies of the Skorne Empire set on the conquest of the Iron Kingdoms. Disciplined ranks of praetorians, elite cataphracts, and malicious paingivers fight alongside fearsome titans and other great warbeasts under the cruel watch of their mighty warlords. Warriors to the core, the skorne employ the dark art of mortitheurgy to push their bodies past normal limits and to fight on past death.

Lead the merciless skorne in their domination of the Iron Kingdoms with Forces of HORDES: Skorne, featuring:

• Complete faction rules and profiles for using all current Skorne models in HORDES Mk II.
• New troops to bring to the fight, plus the all-new warlock Dominar Rasheth.
• An in-depth look at the history and structure of the Skorne Empire’s military.
• A painting and modeling guide to help ready your forces for battle.
• Skorne Theme Force lists and rules, which allow you to create armies based on specialized forces from the Skorne Empire.

Go Forth and Bend All of Immoren to Your Will!

name: Legend: History of 1000 Miglia – 1933 Alfa Romeo 1750 GS Gasogeno Promo Car
description: An additional car for Legend: History of 1000 Miglia; comes with the automobile data sheet, a pawn and a short history.

name: High Heavens: Bloodied Expansion
description:
Alter your decks with the all-new High Heavens: Bloodied pack expansion. Replace all of your god cards or use these cards to deck-build a custom set up. These Greek and Norse cards contain the original line-up of Norse and Greek gods but present the gods as battle-worn with new art and modified stats.

High Heavens: Bloodied includes:


Rules for deck building
12 Greek god Bloodied cards
12 Norse god Bloodied cards
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Mythology, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Grid Movement, Hand Management

name: Runewars Miniatures Game: Heavy Crossbowmen – Unit Expansion
description:
Description from the publisher:

The Heavy Crossbowmen – Unit Expansion for Runewars Miniatures Game comes with eight Heavy Crossbowmen plastic figures and two plastic infantry movement trays, allowing players to add a two-tray unit to their Daqan Lords forces in battles for Terrinoth. Additional tokens and five upgrade cards allow you to expand your Runewars Miniatures Game collection while customizing your armies!

name: Castle Panic: Tower Promo 2019 Tabletop Day
description: New promotional tower for International Tabletop Day 2019. It reads, "Move all Monsters in this arc back to the Forest when this Tower is destroyed."
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Trading

name: Nibble
description:
Nibble is a strategy game for two players by Jared McComb, inspired by the works of Dieter Stein (SEVN) and Reiner Knizia. In Nibble, two players take turns taking pieces of nine colors trying to claim majorities in those colors, but can also win the game instantly in two different ways.

COMPONENTS


81 discs in 9 colours (9 each)
Board


RULES OVERVIEW (Please refer to rulebook)

Randomly place the 81 discs on the board such that no two of the same color are orthogonally adjacent (diagonally adjacent is OK).

Players alternate turns taking discs from the board according to the following rules:

1) Discs may only be taken if they have at least two adjacent exposed sides.

2) A player must always take at least one disc on their turn (that is, players may not pass) and may take as many additional discs as they like on a turn, as long as all of those discs are the same color as the first one. They are not required to take all of the available discs of that color and may opt to leave one or more behind.

3) A disc may not be taken if it would divide the remaining discs into two separate groups (counting orthogonal connections only).

When a player takes discs, they should place them in a row on the table behind the correspondingly colored triangle on the board.

If a player takes their 5th, 7th, or 9th disc of a color, they should place it on the corresponding circle on their side of the board to make it clear how close they are to reaching one of the three win conditions.

WINNING THE GAME

A player wins the game immediately if they achieve either of the following:


Collect all 9 discs of one color
Collect at least 7 discs each of three adjacent colors in a row.


If neither player is able to accomplish either of these, continue play until all the discs have been taken. The winner is the player with the majority of majorities (5 or more discs in each of 5 or more colors).

—description from the publisher

name: Alice's Nightmare in Wonderland
description:
Several years after the events of Alice's Adventures in Wonderland and Through the Looking Glass, Alice finds herself back in Wonderland and called upon to save the world of playing cards and talking animals from the increasingly deranged Queen of Hearts. But all is not as it first appears in the fluctuating dream world and soon Alice is battling to save herself from the nightmare that is rapidly overtaking the realm.

Have you ever wondered what would have happened if Alice hadn't drunk from the bottle labelled 'Drink Me', or if she hadn't joined the Hatter, the March Hare, and the Dormouse for tea? Well now you can find out. In this game, YOU decide which route Alice should take, which perils to risk, and which of Wonderland's strange denizens to fight. But be warned - whether Alice succeeds in her quest or meets a dire end as the nightmare escalates will be down to the choices YOU make. Are you ready to go back down the rabbit-hole?

This gamebook containts 3 modes to play and few different endings to discover.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game
publishers: ACE Gamebooks, Alkonost, El Dragón Azul, Jambô Editora, Mantikore-Verlag, Muduko, Mytago

name: Arachnoir
description:
The bug city of Basin Quarter has been infested by pests from the "Hive" syndicate. Players are spider detectives moving through the city to capture these pests.

Each round, dice are rolled to generate a small pool of movement options. Players simultaneously move their spiders on the board, drawing threads along their path. When an area is bounded by threads, it becomes a webbed area that can be used to catch pests.

Each pest requires a specific condition to be caught, such as web size or spider position. Players must plan their paths carefully, and decide what targets to pursue or abandon.

Victory points are gained through the capture of these pests, as well as a varied number of side objectives. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Puzzle, Territory Building
mechanics: Grid Coverage, Grid Movement, Network and Route Building, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building, Roll / Spin and Move, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Anomia 2.0
description:
If you're a fan of the original Anomia, then get ready to level up with Anomia 2.0!

Anomia 2.0 joins the Anomia family bringing 184 new brain busting categories that will have you on the edge of your seat. Anomia has sold over one million copies worldwide - combine with 2.0 for the ultimate experience!

—description from the back of the box
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Real-time, Trivia

name: Magic: The Gathering – Torment
description:
Centered around the Cabal's Dementia Summoners, Torment introduces new Madness and Nightmare mechanics designed to drive your opponents utterly insane. Wield such dark power as the Faceless Butcher and Sengir Vampire in this blackest of black sets.

This 143-card set includes two new game mechanics (Madness and Nightmares) as well as additional cards for the Flashback and Threshold mechanics of Odyssey.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Armata Strigoi: Resurrection – By Expansion
description:
Enhance the experience of Armata Strigoi (an Adventure with Powerwolf) with this expansion which includes new enemy miniatures and 3D towers! Not only werewolf vs vampires, now a new deadly enemy is going to resurrect thanks to an evil ritual!

From the Publisher:

“The Strigoi are nearing extinction. The Master and his Apprentice, locked up in the fortress of Tismana, are besieged by the Powerwolf and play their last card, hoping to complete an ancient sacrificial rite that leads to the rebirth of the Deus Diabolus Tempter — the Cobra King! To complete the rite, the maidens imprisoned in the fortress towers must be turned into succubi, but the Cobra King's will and ferocity is uncontrollable even for the Strigoi, to the point that it may manifest itself ahead of time! Will the Powerwolf succeed in getting the maidens to safety to prevent the rise of the Cobra King?

This is far from an easy adventure, suitable only for the real Powerwolf!”

-description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Modular Board, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Room Share
description:
The great savings boom has arrived!
Many people want to share a room in order to live on cheap rent.
The player acts as an intermediary for room sharing,
We will introduce rooms that can be shared with our customers.

However, the apartments we introduce can only accommodate up to three people in each room.
If you share a room with more than 4 people, the landlord will find you and you will be kicked out of the room.
Establish a room share for 3 people who can save the most rent more than other players,
Let's aim for the position of No1 intermediary!

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Fighting, Party Game, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Chaining

name: Pirates!
description: In this strategy game, the players are pirates who have to put their pieces one a at a time on the board. Players win a treasure by placing the 3 pieces shown on one of their treasure maps in a row. The winner is the player with the most number of precious stones.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Children's Game, Dice, Pirates
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Pattern Recognition

name: DC Deck-Building Game: Forager Promo
description:
Promotional card given out starting at Origins 2018 for the New God Expansion.

Card description: Hero Cost 3 1 VP

New Genesis Protector: 2

+ 1 Power

Destroy a card in the Line-up and replace it. If you have 9+ Power, gain a card from the destroyed pile.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game

name: Terra: 221B Baker Street / Carcassonne Promo Card
description:
"Where is Carcassonne located and how many Sherlock Holmes short stories exist?
This SPECIAL CARD for the ... quiz game TERRA ... brings new guessing material into play!"

A promo card from Spielbox #07/2014 [B12247] featuring the city of Carcassonne on one side and Sherlock Holmes' residence 221B Baker Street in London on the other side.

This is a bonus question card just like the regular ones.
publishers: 999 Games, HUCH!, W. Nostheide Verlag GmbH

name: XenoShyft: Onslaught – R.O.D. "Ravage Or Detonate"
description:
A promotional card given out during the 2014 Watch It Played Indiegogo campaign.

The promo card is a Heroic Paratrooper, like the Heroic unit types introduced in the Kickstarter Packs. He can, like the Paratrooper be deployed at any time and furthermore, if he is killed he deals 3 damage to the first enemy in your lane.

He does 6 damage and has 3 life.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team – Killzone: Sector Munitorum Environment Expansion
description:
The immense supply districts known as Sectors Munitorum can be found across the Imperium of Mankind. They house the resources needed to power Humanity ‘s vast armies; millions of tonnes of munitions, equipment, weapons and fuel. Such priceless stockpiles draw the eyes of avaricious raiders, leading to brutal, close-quarter battles amidst looming canyons of rusted containers.

The Sector Munitorum Killzone Environment is an expansion for Kill Team – in the packed box, you’ll find a gameboard, scenery, and exclusive rules that use the unique nature of Sector Munitorum terrain to introduce dangerous new missions and powerful effects to your games. Included:

- A double-sided Kill Team gameboard measuring 22” x 30”, printed on heavy, durable card stock. 1 side depicts a Zone Munitorum, a large storage facility perfect for arrangements of Munitorum scenery; and the other an Imperial Sector, an area of war-torn city;
- 12 Sector Munitorum Tactics cards – these can be used by any Kill Team faction, with 6 cards providing interactions with the Sector Munitorum scenery and 6 being used specifically by Heavy, Medic, Comms, or Demolitions Specialists;
- A Sector Munitorum Environment card, which provides 6 different rules allowing interaction – positive and negative – with the scenery;
- 4 Sector Munitorum Mission cards – designed to be used in conjunction with the gameboard and scenery, this is a set of 2 Matched Play missions and 2 Narrative Play missions, which are split between attacker and defender;
- 2 sets of 3 Munitorum Armoured Containers – each of these includes 9 promethium barrels and 12 supply crates, with the option to equip the Containers with watchful storm bolters, ready to annihilate Kill Teams looking to raid them. Also in the box is a set of Galvanic Servohaulers – these are 2 tracked vehicles with powerful engines, designed to haul around industrial equipment such as the included crane, a skeletal metal structure featuring a 3-clawed grabber;
- An 8-page booklet describing the Sectors Munitorum, with an example of a fully-painted scenery set.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Arsuf: Lionheart vs. Saladin
description:
Lionheart vs. Saladin

As the Third Crusade drags on, the Crusaders can make no headway to reach the Levantine interior against Saladin’s highly mobile Arab army; but Saladin cannot generate enough power to break the Crusaders and recapture coastal cities. In the summer of 1191, Richard the Lionheart leads a Crusader army south along the coast, intending eventually to turn east toward Jerusalem. Saladin, hoping to catch the Crusaders strung out on the march — as he had done four years earlier at Hattin — prepares to launch a strike near the ruined city of Jaffa. But, Richard, anticipating the attack, musters his army in a tight formation but continues to march nonetheless. On the morning of 7 September, Saladin strikes.

Arsuf uses the new Battles of the Medieval World system, a variation on the venerable Battles of the Ancient World system. The battle is dominated by masses of heavy cavalry and disciplined lines of heavily-armed and armored men-at-arms. Swirling around these forces are masses of foot- and horse-archers, whose purpose is to disrupt the heavy formations to make them easy prey for their counterparts. Using the classic Combat Results Table, the fighting is close and bloody until the morale of one side weakens. Once a line breaks, the victor must pursue ruthlessly to prevent a rally. Leaders enhance combat power and restore broken formations.

Arsuf is a contest of nimble Arab archers against stout Crusader men-at-arms, backed by the cream of European chivalry. Victory will go to the player who deploys to best utilize his strengths and take advantage of enemy weaknesses.

Game Contents:
• 17 x 22” map
• 100 die-cut counters
• One Standard Rules booklet for this series
• One Exclusive Rules booklet for this title

(source: Decision games website)

name: Strategy
description:
This game is a game of World War II vintage, which was first published in Australia in May 1940 by G.N.Raymond Ltd Pty (Collingwood, Vic), and soon also released in New Zealand, with Williamson Jeffery Ltd acting as agents. While the Australian patent application failed, the New Zealand Application succeeded. The game can be found in Australian advertisements from May 1940 to January 1945. Four versions of the game are known exist and have been reviewed and published by Dirk H.R. Spenneman (2013)

1) first Australian version, with Bakelite counters (G.N.Raymond 1940)

2) Second Australian version, with cardboard counters as a war-time austerity measure (G.N.Raymond ~1942)

3) Third Australian version, with pressed metal counters. as a war-time austerity measure

4) New Zealand version, with wooden counters (Williamson Jeffery Ltd 1940 or 1941)

The game board consists of a mirror-image painted land and sea terrain with an overlay of circles connected with diagonal lines to indicate movement possibilities between circles. Each side, Redland and Greenland, has 8 army division counters, 6 battleship counters and 4 aircraft counters which are placed in their respective labeled circles at opposite ends of the board. The troops can only move on land and can only get to the island in the center of the board with the aid of either aircraft or naval counters. The navy can only move on the sea and the aircraft can move anywhere on the board.

The object is to be the first player who 'captures' forces by jumping them diagonally (like chequers) or the first player to gain possession of the island.

Reference: Spenneman, D. (2013) 'Strategy: An Australian World War II-Era Map-Based Board Game', Journal of The Australian and New Zealand Map Society Inc, The Globe,(73), pp 1-16
mechanics: Area Movement, Point to Point Movement

name: Crypt of the Sorcerer
description: According to Sid Sackson's "A Gamut of Games": Similar to Caverns of Doom, but smaller. The two can be combined for a giant adventure.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Lie Your Face Off!
description:
Players are siblings whose parents have accused them of wacky wrongdoings. To appease them, players must create stories out of lies and embellishments, making them crazier and crazier by placing ever-encreasingly valued lies on top of each other, until there are sufficient lies on the story to consider it completed, at which point it comes out of play and is scored at the end of the game. Some lies allow players to draw or place more cards, allowing for powerful action chains. Players are only allowed to keep seven cards in hand at the end of their turn. Other players have some ability to damage opponents' stories, preventing the most outrageous ones from completing.

As soon as a player has completed enough stories, or the deck runs out, the game ends. The top lies from completed stories are scored for their lie value, and any remaining lies and embellishments add or subtract points from each player's score, with the highest score winning.
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Quizzomat Junior
description:
Ferdi Fuchs tests the knowledge of all the children! It is important to answer exciting, somewhat tricky, but also fun questions: When can you see a rainbow? Which worms can fly? And what are French ​​fries made from?

In Quizzomat Junior, players try to answer these questions by choosing one of the possible answers, then placing their token in the proper hole on the board. Someone then spins the Quizzomat wheel and tokens placed in the wrong holes disappear into the box. Only tokens left in hand count in the end, and whoever has the most tokens wins!

name: Aucteraden
description:
A Decktet game in which you are a trader in the land of Aucteraden taking goods from market to the different clans within the province. Your object is to acquire goods at a fair price to create trade routes. You must be frugal and plan your routes well to amass your wealth and expand your influence.

In this solitaire game you take cards from a draw, or market area at the top of the playing board. Chips can be spent to draw certain cards to place in a tableau. Scoring consists of ascending/descending sequences of cards (1, 2, 4, 5). At the end of the game each suit's longest sequence is tallied for a final score. If this score is greater than or equal to 40 then you have won the game.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Economic, Print & Play

name: HIKTORUNE
description: HIKTORUNE is a cooperative dexterity game in which you try to pull out magic cards one by one from the bundle in order to trigger their effects, clear the quest, and appease the dragon.

name: Robin Hood and the Merry Men: Promo Cards
description:
A set of two promo cards (King Richards Task Cards).

King Richard Cards can give you points at the end of the game. These two give points for Merry Men you have at the end of the game and for sets of resources.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Medieval
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Ardennes 2024
description: "Ardennes 2024" is an alternative history wargame in which German attack on the Western Europe takes place not in 1940, but in the 2024.

name: Ecosystem
description:
A cooperative ecology-themed board game for having fun with friends and relatives and learning to respect the environment!

The aim of the game is to clean up the earth and help to safeguard its natural beauty: by extinguishing fires, reducing smog and pollution in our cities and clearing waste from the oceans.

The game relies on cooperative rules to remind the family about the importance to take care of our planet all together.

The aim of games of the Play for Future range is to help everyone understand the importance of sustainability and respect for the environment through play.

Conceived, designed and developed in Italy.

name: Grand Chess
description:
Grand Chess is a variant played on a 10x10 board with two additional pieces; the Marshall (which combines the movement powers of the rook and knight, it's also called Chancellor) and the Cardinal (which combines the movement powers of the bishop and knight, it's also called Archbishop).

The setup has most of the pieces moved forward one rank from their "normal" position, with an empty rank behind that allows more freedom for the rooks and maneuvering of pieces.

name: GreenGreenerGreenest
description:
Green, Greener and Greenest are three games that use the same set of components.

Green is the first game of the Green-Greener-Greenest set. Green is a game for 3 players derived from The House of the Flying Blades and brother game of RED and BLUE, by the same designer, that uses a non-transitive capturing mechanism.

Depending on the set, you’d have:

Basic: a 6×6 board, 15 black pyramids, 20 green pyramids, 15 white pyramids.

Advanced: a 6×9 – 9×9 board (using one or both pads), 30 black pyramids, 45 green pyramids, 30 white pyramids.

Gameplay overview:

The board starts full of pyramids. Players in turn capture (mandatory) other pyramids or stacks of pyramids orthogonally so that:

- Black can only capture Green
- Green can only capture White
- White can only capture Black

The game ends when all players pass in succession. The player with the highest combined height of controlled stacks wins the game.

Please refer to the rulebook for detailed rules.


Greener is the second game of the Green-Greener-Greenest set. Green, Greener and Greenest are three games that use the same set of components.

Greener is a capturing game for 2 players, where both must capture the same colour.

Depending on the set, you’d have:

Basic: a 6×6 board, 15 black pyramids, 20 green pyramids, 15 white pyramids.

Advanced: a 6×9 – 9×9 board (using one or both pads), 30 black pyramids, 45 green pyramids, 30 white pyramids.

Gameplay overview:

The board starts full of pyramids. Players take turns capturing pyramids or stacks of any colour orthogonally.

The game ends when all players pass in succession. The player with the most green pyramids captured (being part of stacks they control) wins the game. In case of a tie, the player with the highest stack wins. If the tie persists, play again.

Please refer to the rulebook for detailed rules.


Greenest is the third game of the Green-Greener-Greenest set. Green, Greener and Greenest are three games that use the same set of components.

Greenest is a solo game.

Setup the board as in Green. The goal of the game is to end up with a single stack, by making captures also as in Green (Black can only capture Green and so on), but in any order. This is, you can capture several times with the same colour, or reverse the order.

Whether all initial configurations are solvable or not still remains an open question. Your feedback on this will be greatly appreciated.

name: Stop Press
description:
An Australian game produced in the 1980s, Stop press involves rolling a colored die to determine one fo three them,e decks from which to draw a theme card (Good News/Bad News, Scandal or Crime). On the card is a short apocryphal theme like "celebrity found dead in strange circumstances". Each player has a set of words on cardboard chits and is given one of four newspapers (a cardboard front page with slots to put the words into). The aim is to write, with your words, on you newspaper, a headline which captures the theme. All players then place their headlines into the center of the board, face down, after which they are all revealed and each player votes for the best headline (not allowed to vote for their own). You move one space forwards in the progression from paperboy to media magnate for every vote your headline gets. Along the way there are some random even cards (Stop press cards) helping to promote or demote you as chance would have it.

All told a very amusing game, but suffers a little form the zillions of fiddly bits (word chits) that need to be managed and the restricted vocab those same word chits provide. The vocab is Also very '80s, including Thatcher and Gobachev, but it's still a very entertaining game.

name: Περσικοί Πόλεμοι Μολών Λαβέ
description:
Περσικοί Πόλεμοι is a game depicting the war between the Persian Empire and Ancient Greece. The players take the roles of the Persian and Greek armies and fight for the control of key areas in a map depicting Greece during that period.

The game includes 4 scenarios for the players to play, each of them based on actual historic events. Each scenario lasts 14 rounds with each round representing a year between 492 BC and 479 BC. Most of the scenarios require one of the two sides to have control of some specific areas at the end of the last round.

The game also includes an educational leaflet with a brief description of the actual events that took place during that period and on which the scenarios are based.

Components:

1 Gameboard 52x46cm (Ancient Greece - Minor Asia)
9 Cards of yearly event
1 Notepad (Chronology 492-479bc)
92 Plastic pawns
12 Plastic flags
1 Special 6sided dice (0,1,1,2,2,3)
Historical and educational leaflet
Rulles


Description in Greek, taken from the game's back cover:
Στο απόγειο της δόξας της, η Περσική Αυτοκρατορία ήταν η μεγαλύτερη που είχε δει η ανθρωπότητα μέχρι τότε. Τα 2/3 του παγκόσμιου πληθυσμού, του τότε γνωστού κόσμου, ζούσε και πέθαινε, υπό την εξουσία της δυναστείας των Αχαιμενιδών. Βαβυλώνιοι, Αιγύπτιοι, Φοίνικες, Ινδοί και δεκάδες άλλοι λάοι, έδωσαν στους Πέρσες "γη και ύδωρ", κάποιοι όμως τους είπαν ΜΟΛΩΝ ΛΑΒΕ !!!

Οι Περσικοί Πόλεμοι ακόμα και σήμερα προκαλούν δέος, ενώ οι μάχες του Μαραθώνα, των Θερμοπυλών, της Σαλαμίνας και των Πλαταιών, καθόρισαν το μέλλον της ανθρωπότητας.

Ζήστε τώρα το έπος των προγόνων μας, μέσα από ένα επιτραπέζιο παιχνίδι στρατηγικής, και γράψτε τη δική σας ιστορία !!!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Team-Based Game

name: Smolensk 20
description:
Designer Alan Emrich offers a fascinating Expansion Kit for Borodino 20, placing you in command of the the French and Russian armies along the great Minsk-Moscow Highway where the near-trap was sprung at Smolensk. Although the Russians ultimately withdrew from the field of battle, it was a close-run engagement as the Czar and Russian Generals argued to stand and fight their decisive battle there along the Dniepr river.

Complexity: 4 on a 9 scale.

Solitaire Suitability: 5 on a 9 scale.

Scale: Each unit is 1 corps, each hex is about 1000 meters, and each turn is roughly 3.5 day hours (or 10 night hours).

name: Drizzit: il gioco di carte – Lame premurose e pozioni misteriose
description:
Second expansion for Drizzit: il gioco di carte.
It includes:
3 new Adventure sets,
2 new Characters,
3 new sets of Enemies,
8 Muses

And the rules to play up to 6 players!
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Fantasy, Humor
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game

name: The World Game: Board Game
description:
Race around the world, pass famous landmarks, learn about countries, recognize flags and find locations on the map. Spend quality time with your family and friends.

Answer questions like:
Can you recognize the flag of Chile?
What is the capital of India?
Can you show Sweden on the map?

Steal cards with a pirate attack, send players back with a tsunami, freeze them with a snow storm and so much more! Packed with action, knowledge and endless fun!

GAMEPLAY:

The game's objective is to be the first player to finish the race around the world and cross the finish line. You move forward by winning with strong country facts or by answering geography challenges correctly.

Every turn each player draws a card from the country card pile. When it’s your turn, roll one dice. Then you have to choose between 2 options. Calling out a fact or a challenge.

FACT
Pick a fact you believe is the strongest one and try to beat other players. But be careful, if you lose someone else will move forward.

CHALLENGE
Yell challenge! The player to your left will challenge you with recognizing the flag, or finding a country on the map. If you decide on the hard challenge, you can even guess the capital city of a country. If you are playing with kids, they can guess the continent of a country. If you answer wrong, the next player gets a chance. If everyone answers wrong, the challenger moves forward.

name: Little Round Top: Flank Attack at Gettysburg 2 July 1863
description: Hex and counter wargame covering part of the action on the second day of the Battle of Gettysburg.

name: Shenanigrams
description:
Shenanigrams is a word game filled to the brim with sneakiness, shenanigans & anagrams!

Players battle head-to-head in a nail-biting race to build and steal as many words as possible from their opponents by using stealth, strategy and wordy wickedness.

It’s easy to learn, quick to play and the perfect grab-and-go game to keep everyone entertained for hours. You don’t need to like word games to LOVE this one. Kids, teens and adults will be hooked!

HOW TO PLAY: Players take turns playing one letter tile, gradually forming a word grid everyone is playing on. When a player completes a word, they tag it! But watch out…players can also use their turn to steal opponents’ tagged words by adding, inserting or replacing a letter tile. Be the first to use all your tags and shout "SHENANIGRAMS” to win!

Let the Shenanigrams commence...

—description from the publisher

name: Fidchell: Celtic Chess
description: Played on a polar grid with variable numbers of positions on each circumference. One piece-type only (stones), each player starts with 27 stones, 8 placed at specific starting positions, 19 off board. Two game phases : placement and then movement. Play usually alternates between players. Custodian capture applies during each phase, successful capture allows a second move. The two players have asymmetric goals, however: white must build a continuous line of pieces from center to circumference, black must prevent this from happening.
mechanics: Line Drawing, Point to Point Movement

name: The Grimm Forest: Brothers Grimm Promo Card
description:
The English version of this promo card was available from the Man Vs Meeple Kickstarter campaign in 2018.

Card text:

End of Gather Phase: If you share a location with another player, discard the Brothers Grimm and search the Friend deck for any friend card and put it into play.
mechanics: Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That
publishers: Druid City Games, Last Level, Lucky Duck Games, Mirakulus

name: The Kokoda Campaign: Jungle Battles in New Guinea – A Panzer Grenadier Game
description:
From the publisher's website:

Japanese troops landed in northeastern New Guinea in July 1942, and quickly began a march over the forbidding Owen Stanley Mountains toward the vital anchorage and airfield at Port Moresby on the southern coast. They ran into Australian infantrymen of the 39th Militia Battalion, starting a three-month campaign waged in some of the world's most forbidding terrain.

An Australian militia brigade went up the trail to face the Japanese, who poured in reinforcements of their own. Next the veteran Australian 7th Infantry Division, the heroes of Tobruk, plunged into the jungles and finally stopped the Japanese attacks. While Australian soldiers fought on despite rampant malaria, Japanese troops hauled artillery shells over the mountains by hand and resorted to eating Australian prisoners of war. Finally in September 1942 the Japanese withdrew from one of the war's most brutal campaigns.

The Kokoda Campaign is a complete boxed game in the Panzer Grenadier series. Based on these battles, it includes the two maps that appeared in our old Kokoda Trail book and 242 playing pieces that originally appeared in our out-of-print Guadalcanal and Afrika Korps games. It has 30 scenarios originally designed by Dave Cheever and re-worked by Matt Ward and Daniel Rouleau, plus a campaign game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Sucesos Argentinos: Volumen 3 – Ciencia y Cultura
description:
Sucesos Argentinos Vol. 3 is a card game where argentinian history knowledge is tested. Players must organize a chain of historical events chronologically ordered.

Each game can have from 2 to 4 players and lasts 15 to 20 minutes. It can be combined with other volumes to play up to 6 players.

This game box contains 75 unique double-sided cards depicting notable events in Argentina's history. On the front of each card are the name by which the historical event is known and an image, and on the back a description of the event and the year in which it occurred.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Sucesos Argentinos es un juego de cartas donde se pone a prueba el conocimiento de historia argentina de los jugadores organizando una cadena de sucesos en orden cronológico.

Cada partida puede tener de 2 a 4 jugadores y tiene una duración de 15 a 20 minutos. Puede combinarse con otros volúmenes para permitir hasta 6 jugadores.

La caja del juego contiene 75 cartas únicas de doble cara que representan sucesos notables de la historia argentina. En el frente de cada carta encontramos el nombre por el cual se conoce al hecho histórico y una imagen orientativa, y al dorso una descripción del suceso y el año en que ocurrió.

—description from the publisher (Spanish)

name: Mondrian
description:
Piet Mondrian was one of the greatest modern painters, his abstract works influenced architecture and design as few artists have managed to do in history, players are invited to build works of art inspired by this undoubtedly one of the greatest plastic artists of all time.

In this game players need to create retangular areas with some tiles, the white areas make points to buy more tiles, and the colorful areas make victory points.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Enclosure, Modular Board, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: Dice Settlers: Married Bliss Promo Card
description:
Promo card that was given for free as part of the Pocket Dragon Kickstarter-campaign.

Setup: Place this card amongst the Technology cards, as an additional available one. It does not count towards any of the categories.

Gameplay: Married Bliss can be acquired like any other Technology, for 3 research icons. At the end of the game (besides its printed 3 VP) it scores 1 point for every pair of tents the player has on a tile. Houses do not count, and two tents on two different tiles do not count as a pair. (Four tents on a single tile however count as two pairs.)

When playing against the Diceoneer solo opponent, it acquires Married Bliss like any other Technology card (but only scores the printed VP, same as always).
categories: American West, Civilization, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Tile Placement

name: Munchkin Magical Mess
description:
Moop is back in Munchkin Magical Mess with more magical messed-up mayhem in his menagerie! Murder more monsters for much merriment!

—description from the publisher

name: Dead Panic: Bullet Bookmark
description: Dead Panic: Bullet Bookmark is a small expansion for Dead Panic that can be used once per game to allow a player to reload one pistol, shotgun, or rifle with one bullet.
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: OMNIA
description:
Leonardo's life, travel and works. In cards.

OMNIA is an opportunity to dive into the magical Italian Renaissance, seen through the eyes of one of the greatest geniuses of all times.

In the first phase of the match, create your deck according to the strategy you think is best. Challenge the other players to collect more works and inventions by Leonardo, getting help from the famous characters of the time. Always keep an eye on the places of the journey! To collect points you must reach the objectives activated in the match.

The game develops in 6 rounds. During each round each player will have to play an Action card (the seventh card will not be played).

Each Action card provides for a maximum of two sequential actions, indicated by their respective symbols.

Possible actions are: activate a City card picking it from the deck; take a Work, Invention or Character card among the ones on the table; take coins from the bank.

Perform the actions provided for by the action card.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Renaissance, Travel

name: Guerilla
description:
Guerilla is an abstract strategy game played on a triangular lattice. Players place pieces to form groups, which can move, larger groups being able to move farther than smaller ones (movement is by jumping).

An unusual feature is that if an enemy piece is captured by "overkill" (pieces are captured by neighboring pieces which are stronger, strength being measured by the number of adjacent friendly pieces), a red "massacre" token is placed on its space, which becomes impassable for the rest of the game.
publishers: Ariel Productions Ltd, Bütehorn Spiele (Buchholz Verlag)

name: La Foi et le Glaive
description:
This game was designed by the French club, Vortigern, to be played by correspondence and was later picked up by Azure Wish Edition to be sold as a commercial boardgame. It is a game for six players which combines diplomatic negotiation, warfare, and religious strife. Each player represents one of the primary religions of the seventh century AD: Western Christianity, Eastern Christianity (or the Monophysites), Islam, Zoroastrianism, Norse paganism and Shamanism. As such, one has at one's disposal missionaries to convert others. However, one also controls the temporal power behind these faiths--the Shamanist player controls the Avars, the Franks belong to the Western Christian player, and so on.
