So if you read Bravo Two Zero or where just intrigued by the TV coverage of combined US Special Forces-Peshmerga operations in Northern Iraq, here's Scudbusters II: Return to Iraq...

Written by Matthew Hartley, this new edition of the popular Scudbuster rules expands beyond the original game, which covered SAS operations in the Gulf War, to include all Allied Special Forces and their activities in the 2003 Iraq War. The rulebook also includes options to extend to operations in Afghanistan and even hypothetical actions in "Axis of Evil" countries such as North Korea.

In the game the player takes control of the Special Forces units and operate in an increasingly challenging environment as fatigue and casualties take their toll the longer your troops are in the field. The Iraqi forces are controlled by reaction tables and can be as unpredictable as in real life.

Scudbusters II contains AFV rules, ambush tables and strategic level rules that allow gamers to link missions together as they happened in the war.

Reaction tables for Iraqi regulars, Baathist fanatics and Fedayeen Saddam are also included in the rulebook as well as rules to include Kurdish Peshmergas operating on the side of US Special Forces.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hidden Victory Points, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Strange Grogge
description:
From the publisher:

Strange Grogge is a set of black powder fantasy skirmish rules, designed for 28mm scale battles between orcs, dwarves, elves and other popular fantasy races.

Written by Mike Baumann, Matthew Hartley and Steve Blease Strange Grogge is set in Wessex Games� fantasy realm of The Land, centering around the pirate infested region known as The Barbarous Coaste.

In the game the player creates and takes control of either a band of pirates or government troops and fights out any of the frequent skirmishes that take place in the towns, jungles, lagoons and islands that make up the Barbarous Coaste.

The rulebook also contains optional role-playing rules to provide even more detail for players, especially those who have a hankering to be the infamous Dwarf pirate Shortbeard or other famous personalities.

Strange Grogge contains numerous weapons options, a swashbuckling melee system, four different types of magic (from gastronomic to singing sea shanties) and a campaign system .

name: Strange Tydes: Fantasy Age of Sails Naval Wargame Rules
description:
From the Publisher:

Written by Matthew Hartley and Steve Blease, Strange Tydes is a fun and simple game to play of fantasy age of sail naval warfare. Use ships based on historical equivalents of the eighteenth and nineteenth centuries, the way only an Orc or Dark Elf can. Pit the wooden walled men o'war against the erratic ironclads of the Dwarven principalities. Encounter sea monsters and face strange magick on the oceans of The Land. Play the only game we know of where you can kill the opposing vessel's ship's parrot!!

All you need to play Strange Tydes is a copy of the rulebook, a selection of models (though cardboard counters can be used), some dice and a flat area on which to play.

The Strange Tydes rule book contains:

Complete tabletop rules for naval battles between the various races of The Land, including Ironclads, Fortifications, Fire Ships and Magick.

Full background details including a map of the treacherous region known to all as The Barbarous Coaste.

Details of all the races of The Land fighting on the seas of the Barbarous Coaste during the Wars of Dwarven Succession.

Naval Lists of the various fleets involved in the Wars of Dwarven Succession with full details of crew and vessel availability.

Three introductory scenarios set on the legendary Barbarous Coaste.
categories: Book, Fantasy, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame

name: A Fist Full of Throttle
description: Warning: A Fist Full of Throttle is the Ultimate, 100% knock down drag em' out Rock & Roll, boogie woogie till' ya puke, adult, biker lifestyle board game. Play "A Fist Full Of Throttle"........ And remember Keep The Shiny Side Up And Rock On!!!!
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Memory, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Murder Mystery Party: Murder at Tall Oaks
description:
Solve a Murder in an Evening With Friends! The Setting -- A festive birthday party at a stately country manor in New England on a crisp autumn evening. With no warning, a violent storm sweeps the grounds of the estate, but that's not the only violence afoot! After the storm subsided, self-made multi-millionaire Reginald Arcain went for a stroll to admire his sweeping grounds and check for damage. His body was later found near the grove of tall oaks that gives the manor its name. Who did him in? The successful publisher, the local physician, the beautiful maid, or someone else? By the time the evening's over, you'll know the truth!

Contents: Invitation, name tags, a map, clue booklets, the police report, complete instructions (and the solution to the crime), along with an optional CD-ROM

name: Those Ragged Bloody Heroes. The Australian 7th Division at Gona: November 29-December 10, 1942
description: THOSE RAGGED BLOODY HEROES depicts the bloody Pacific Island fighting on the northern coast of New Guinea. Here the Australian 7th Division has pushed the Japanese invader north in the long and bloody Kokoda Trail campaign. During the weeks prior to the battle for Gona, General Horii's defenders toiled long and hard to prepare a defensive ‘death-trap’ that awaited the oncoming—and unsuspecting Australian soldiers. Cleared fire-lanes, log bunkers and Japanese snipers await your men of the Australian 7th Division as you re-fight this tragic and controversial battle.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Hunch
description: Take Chinese Checkers, sprinkle with penalty features, "stay put" handicaps, and a blind color selector and you have Hunch! Like its name, your success depends on how right your hunches are. You stay still, go forward, or go backward depending on the colors underneath the marbles, which the players select themselves using the Hunch Dial.

name: Don't Bug Me
description: The object is to get as many matches as possible. You ask other players for bugs that match yours. If they don't have a matching card, they get to shout "Don't Bug Me!". Bug facts are included. Fun and educational game for the kids! Includes 52 game cards.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational

name: 武田騎馬軍団 (Takeda Kiba Gundan)
description:
Takeda Kiba Gundan (Takeda Cavalry Corps) is a Japanese tactical Sengoku era battle game.

This is a kind of experimental game not an exact historical one.
Players RANDOMLY picks up his initial force and setup them blindly.

name: Rufus
description:
This is the original version of Doctor Faust. It is themed as a Schnitzel hunt, or 'paper-chase' around an oval track. The animals chase after a wooden 'fox and cooking pot' piece. Each turn you have 7 points to use for placing a card, moving the fox and moving one of your own two pieces. Cards are placed face down next to the track and another player landing on one must end his turn, reveal the card and move the indicated number of spaces (1,3,5,7 or 9 spaces back, 2,4,6 or 8 spaces forward).
If the fox reaches any player's piece or a player moves his piece up to the fox, a score card is taken. One is also taken each time the fox is moved over one of the two 'fox' spaces on the track. The game ends when the last score card is taken.

name: Ax Your Tax
description: Endorsed by Howard Jarvis, author of California's "Proposition 13" tax code change in the late 1970s. Object of the game is to "become a TAX LOOPHOLE EXPERT" and thus gain the most money.

name: Hunt the Hole
description:
A fast memory game for 2 or more players.

The goal is to stick rods into empty holes of a wooden block.

Each player takes his turn to stick one of the rods in a hole not yet taken. When he hits a hole already taken, he must put back the rod and is disqualified. Winner is the player who succeeds to find an empty hole in the end.

To make the game more challenging each player may turn the board in any direction after having completed his move.

name: Doppia Coppia
description:
Doppia Coppia appears to be a game in a series, TuttiGiochi, published by Dal Negro. The 1987 F. X. Schmid copyright implies it may have been publisehd by that company too. Other games in the TuttiGiochi series (listed in the rules leaflet) are 'Micio-Gatto', 'Gioco Dei Nomi', 'Roulette Scozzese', 'La Torre Di Babele' and 'Sole, Luna E Stelle'.

Doppia Coppia means 'two pairs' in Italian, and reflects the objective of the game - to form a square using two pairs of pieces in two different colours. This simple abstract game for two players consists of a 5-by-5 square board, 5 red pieces and 5 yellow pieces. Pieces of the same colour start in a row at opposite ends of the board and players take turns to move a piece of their colour one square at a time orthogonally. A piece may also jump over one other piece as a move. The central square on the board is occupied by a four-leaf clover and pieces may not enter this square nor jump over it. A player wins when he or she makes a move that completes a square (I interpret this to be a 2-by-2 square) containing 2 red and 2 yellow pieces (the two colours may be side-by-side or crossing diagonally).
mechanics: Pattern Building, Point to Point Movement

name: Die Eroberung von Morundir
description: In ‘Conquest for Morundir’ two players fight it out on a hex-tiled game board and steer their pawns (three dukes and six knights) to victory. First player to conquer castle Morundir (the hex field in the middle of the board) with one of their dukes or to eliminate the other player’s three dukes wins the game.

name: Flames of War: Desert Rats – Intelligence Handbook on British Armored Forces
description:
Subtitled 'Intelligence Handbook on British Armored Forces', this is a supplement for Flames of War the World War II Miniatures game.

The book has complete organization and equipment for British Armored, Motor and Armored Car forces in North Africa and Italy, variants for the Death or Glory Boys, history of the Desert Rats, the 7th Armored Division, new anti-tank gun rules, tactics guide, painting guide, new missions and new warriors.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Flames of War: Old Ironsides – Intelligence Handbook on US Armored Forces
description:
Subtitled 'Intelligence Handbook on US Armored Forces', this is a supplement for Flames of War the World War II Miniatures game.

The book has complete organization and equipment for US Armored forces in North Africa and the Mediterranean, variants for early war Tank companies, Armored Recon and Truck-borne companies, history of the 1st Old Ironsides' Armored Division, new reconnaissance rules, tactics guide, painting guide, new missions and new warriors.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Gorilla Warfare
description:
From the White Mask Productions website:

Gorilla Warfare is a primal game of explosive jungle combat. Every player controls a team of four gorillas; armed with bulging muscles, bad tempers, and explosive Banana Grenades. The object? To be the king of the jungle, of course.

"Gorilla Warfare is here and ready to play! The entire game took only 24 hours to create, but I tell you this; it almost ranks up there with Empires in playable fun. I always like moving my Gorillas around like a S.W.A.T. Team. No one can sneak up on you, and if anyone gets too close, all four Gorilla's are just about in equal throwing distance to fry the primate. Of course, this is a bad idea if an enemy has a Class 5 Banana Grenade, as the explosion can wipe out a good part of the play field..."

Outdated link:
View the rules, FAq, etc at http://www.whitemask.com/gorilla/

name: Special Forces: Modern Infantry Skirmish Rules
description: Special Forces recreates small infantry actions of section strength (8 to 10 men) in all theaters of war using 25mm figures and vehicles. The use of artillery, mortars and ground attack aircraft have been excluded, however helicopters have been covered. Data tables for most weapons and AFV's used in modern combat have been included. The game also covers a section where the figures earn skill advancement according to the experience gained per battle.
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Events, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Riot: Revolting People from Watt Tyler to Watts
description:
From the introduction:

Riot is a slightly tongue-in-cheek game about urban violence between unruly mobs and 'security forces' through the ages. It can be played either multi-player or solo, with the mobs being controlled by the game system and the players taking the role of either the forces of law and order quelling the rioters or journalists recording the event and reporting scenes of police brutality.

This game has been written purely with fun in mind and it is not an attempt at a simulation of urban violence per se. The rules have been written for 1:300 scale, but can be easily adjusted for 15mm or 25mm.

name: Missão Estratégica
description:
Two islands somewhere on the Pacific Ocean try to obtain the full power, conquering the other.

Each island has 3 bays and one airport. The first player who conquers one bay and the airport of the enemy and keeps the situation the next movement from the other player is the winner.

The most interesting: There's no dice, no cards, no luck at all. Each type of piece has a diagram, a kind of stencil, that shows all the alternative movements and if will hit or not. It's just strategy thinking and tactical movements.

The board is beautiful, made of plastic. The pieces are made of a type of rubber that adhere to the board, so you can store the game to play again some other game. And believe me : it's necessary.

A pity that this company made 2 games with the same mechanics and pieces and then, disappeared.
mechanics: King of the Hill, Movement Template

name: Where the Iron Crosses Grow
description:
Subtitled 'Eastern Front Scenarios for Spearhead WW-II Rules', there are 21 scenarios covering three major periods of the war in the East.

Although designed primarily for Spearhead rules, these scenarios are playable with any set of WW-II rules that provides Divisional organizations and uses the Platoon as the smallest combat element.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Meander Expansion Set
description:
The Meander Expansion set contains four extra tiles, four marker marbles (two red, two green), and a die. A (very) small booklet gives some variations on the original rules and suggestions to use the components of the expansion set. The four extra pieces (one of each of the basic pieces) can be used to make the tile draw a bit more uncertain. The marbles are used to indicate pockets that count as double or nothing and the die is used before each turn to give you extra actions (or make you lose your turn).

Expands:

Meander
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, Expansion for Base-game

name: Kung Fu
description:
"Kung Fu: Chess the Yin/Yang Way

Object of the game

The object of the game is for each opposing force to reunite Yin and Yang. The Yin forces try to capture the Yang, and vice versa. Having captured the opposing force, the winner has achieved fulfillment, and the game ends."

Kung Fu, made in Singapore in the 1970's, is a chess-like game. Instead of a king or general, each player has a Yin/Yang monad and takes on the role of Yin or Yang, controlling a team of Kung Fu fighters (who are dressed in Karategi). The pieces are supposed to represent movements made during the performance of martial arts and have names like Front Kick (Eagle's Onslaught), Hook Kick (Whip of the Dragon's Tail) and Forward Punch (Fist of Fury). Probably influenced by Chinese Chess, each monad is restricted to their own temple of six squares and may not face each other directly in the same file. Unlike Chinese Chess, there is a Guardian piece which stands in front of the monad and which is not restricted to just the temple. However, within the temple, it has the unusual power that when captured within it's own temple, both the Guardian and attacker are removed from the board.

Kung Fu is a curiosity from the heyday of Shaw Brothers films.

name: United Kingdom Trivia Game
description:
In UK trivia you have 400 cards with 2400 questions from six categories : Miscellaneous, History, Sport, Culture, Nature and Geography. All questions concern the UK only. Collect a token from each category to win.
Well at least it only takes 30 minutes to play.

Recommended Ages 12 and up

name: Island
description:
From Tom Jolly's website:

The idea is simple; you represent the survivors of one ship that smacked into another at sea. Both sunk. The other player is the survivors of the other ship. Of course, if you have more players, more ships might have been involved in the collision! Anyway, there's this little teeny rock of an island, and only enough space for about 10 people to stand there. The first player to have 7 of his or her own survivors standing on the ISLAND wins!

Rules and construction instructions here:
http://www.silcom.com/~tomjolly/island.htm

name: Law & Order
description:
LAW & ORDER is a board game concerned with all aspects of the (British) law from employment, marriage, divorce, criminal law, civil liberties, police powers, motoring offenses, children and the law, and consumer legislation.

Players start the game with 50 points and progress round the board moving in accordance with the number thrown on a D6. Most of the squares result in points being won or lost, or a player missing a turn. 20 points are also awarded for completing one circuit of the board.

On certain squares players will be invited to "Answer a Question in Court". Dependant on where the player is on the board the questions are drawn from one of four packs (a total of 168 cards) of "Court" cards (named after Judges Snooty, Boil, Grimface and Wagfinger). The questions may be multiple choice in nature or require a specific response. The answer(s) given will result in points being won or lost.

The aim of the game is to score 300 points. This should take 2 to 3 hours, though game duration can be reduced by reducing the score required.

name: Fantastic Encounters
description: "A new and different type of fantasy boardgame that requires only one player to play. Included are easy to understand rules for various weapons, magic and fantastic creatures, along with a colorful map and counters."
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Variable Set-up

name: Par: 5
description: The playing material consists of 60 double-hex tiles - 42 have one yellow and one green hex, and the other 18 are single-colored and reserved for the player whose color they are. Players play one tile a turn in an effort to get five hexes in a row of their color without also creating such a row for their opponent.

name: Craze
description:
According to Sid Sacksons "A Gamut of Games":

All possible numbers that can be reached arithmetically with three dice (1 low and 216 high) are entered into spaces. Players throw three dice and cross off a space. Score one point for each adjacent crossed off space. Wipe off for a new game.

name: LEGO Wars
description:
Lego Wars was the first of the "brick powered" wargames. It is the ancestor of Brikwars and inspiration for many of the other Lego wargames out there.

An excellent game if you have a lot of Legos lying around. Easy to customize your own army.

Lego Pirate Wars—written by Stephen W. Gabriel—had it's rules published as magazine articles in 1995/1996.

"Legoland Pirate Wars" – Shadis (Issue 19 - May 1995), pages 43–52
"Lego Pirate Wars: Optional Rules" – Shadis (Issue 24 - Feb 1996), pages 20–23
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Australian Menagerie: Tropical Rainforest Habitat
description:
This is the Tropical Rainforest Habitat add on for Australian Menagerie. The animal cards included included are 4 Cairns Birdwing Butterfly, 4 Cassorwary, 4 Crocodile and 4 Striped Possum.

Each animal card is unique, it has *different* information about the animal on each, as with all Australian Menagerie animal cards.

Environmental Threat: Feral Pigs
Management Strategy: Feral Pigs

There are also 3 Habitat place mats included with a tropical rain forest illustration.

Expands:

Australian Menagerie
categories: Animals, Card Game, Educational, Environmental, Expansion for Base-game

name: Filmjakten
description:
Children´s trivia game themed on the movies of Astrid Lindgren. The deck of movie cards is shuffled and one card is turned face up. Players roll the die and move their pawn on the board. This is divided into several squares, each with a picture from a movie based on a book by Astrid Lindgren. If your pawn lands on a square containing the same picture as the one on the card, then you get that card. The next card is turned face up, and so on. Players may either just move according to the die, or they may try to land on one of the squares with a question mark. If they do, one of the other players picks up the top quiz card and reads the question with the same number as the number on the die. So, if you roll a five and land on a question mark, you will have to answer question number five. The questions are all about movies based on the books of Astrid Lindgren. One side of the die is marked with an arrow, and if you roll the arrow you just pick up the current card.

Each card equals one victory point, and three cards of the same movie will earn you bonus points. The player with the most points when all cards are taken is the winner.

Contents:

Gameboard
430 questions on 86 cards
24 movie cards
4 pawns
1 die

Also released in a Norwegian edition with 350 questions on 75 cards, and 16 additional puzzle cards.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Firefly
description:
WW2 miniatures rules from the publishers of the similar "ultra-modern" Challenger rules.

For 1/300th and 1/200th.
Includes comprehensive vehicle data, 45 army lists, competition rules, and air operations

name: Game Design: Theory and Practice
description: 8-1/2" x 11" Booklet, paperback. Various articles on game design.

name: Outwords
description:
OUTWORDS is a simple word game for 2 - 6 players aged 10 and over. The box contains pads, pencils, a die, and a pack of over 250 cards each of which has 6 words of between 5 and 10 letters long on it.

Players take it in turns to be the caller. The caller takes a card and rolls the dice to see which word is going to be played (the words are numbered from 1 to 6). The caller then announces the number of letters in the word and a letter from the middle of the word (i.e. not the first or last letter of the word). The other players mark this information down on their score pad.

Going clockwise round the table players may ask for a letter to be added to either the immediate right or the immediate left of the starting letter (or chain of letters as the word develops). The word therefore grows outwards from the original starting letter.

At any time from the giving of the first letter any player may try to guess the word by calling it out aloud. If the guess is correct then the player scores 1 point for every letter as yet unexposed. If incorrect the player loses 1 point from his score.

The first player to score 20 points or more is the winner.
publishers: Dragon New Age Games, Perfect Games

name: Postman Pat: Race Game
description:
Simple roll-die-and-move race game featuring Postman Pat, a British Broadcasting Corporation animation character.

In the game, players follow Pat on his rounds to deliver the mail in the idyllic village of Greendale, traveling on a track of squares, some of which will have various chance actions like moving forward, back or missing turns.

You must help Pat to deliver his packages and get home. Along the way you will meet all his friends such as Mrs Goggins, Mrs Hubbard, Alf Thompson, Dr Sylvia etc..
Some will help you but some will keep you talking, like the Reverend Peter Timms who must tell you about the Village Fete.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing
publishers: BHS Games, Damm / Egmont, Falcon Games (I)

name: Blueprint
description: Blueprint is the obscure boardgame version of the only somewhat less obscure video-game from the early 1980s. Movement is determined by flicking a disc along a track, and moving based upon it's final position. Players must collect the pieces to build a machine, while disposing of any bombs they happen upon. Once the machine is built, it fires one shot at a time at the monster until someone hits it. Overall, a reasonable attempt to convert the arcade game into a boardgame, but other than for some memory elements and the disc flicking, there's not a lot of skill to the game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Maze, Video Game Theme

name: Napenaltowaktsche
description:
From the Introduction: "Napenaltowaksche is the skirmish level portion of the Flintlocks and Tomahawks system. The setting is mid 18th-century New England, New France and the Old Northwest. Where a choice had to be made between playability and realism, the choice was made toward ease of play so that the result is closer to a caricature rather than a historical simulation."

The game name is spelled both Napenaltowaktsche and Napenaltowaksche by the designer throughout the booklet. It's Lenni Lenape (Delaware Indian) for "They will be scalping each other," and I don't think the Lenni Lenape much care how you spell it so long as you pronounce it correctly.

It's a skirmish level miniatures wargame, where one figure represents one person. The game was sold either simply as the rules alone (with basic character cards and player aids to photocopy), or as a full kit with felt and wood terrain, eight painted miniatures (4 Indians, 4 colonists), chits, character cards, player aid cards, movement stick, etc.

The mechanics contain a fair bit of randomness. A chit for each figure in the game is put into a cup along with three "end of turn" chits - draw a chit to see who moves next. The player owning the active figure rolls a d6 and adds its current Competence (which starts at 6 and drops as you take wounds) to get a number of action points available for a turn. Moving one cm takes 1 AP, while loading your flintlock takes 12 AP, tracked on your character card in groups of 4 AP.

If a figure is fired at and the shot comes reasonably close, they must make a reaction check to see what they do. This can range from running away to holding your ground to firing wildly to charging into melee - the more wounded you become, the more likely you are to run away.

Rules are given for aiming and firing, melee, line of sight through the dense woodland, other terrain, etc. This is overall a lighter set of rules rather than a true simulation.
mechanics: Action Points, Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling

name: The Rules According to Ral
description:
These are simple rules for Medieval combat using miniatures. Ral Partha was a miniatures manufacturer (now owned by Iron Wind), and they gave these rules away for free in an attempt to sell more miniatures. The rules are 4 pages long with an additional 1 page player aid sheet.

Fairly standard medieval miniatures rules for large armies. 12 infantry to a stand to represent a large unit, or 6 cavalry. Leaders are individually based. The rules cover morale, bow combat, melee, movement, individual combat between leaders, and point cost for building armies.

Iron Wind has an adaptation of these rules for free on its web site, minus the player aid sheet. They even kept the same artwork, but added fantasy armies, which are lacking in the Ral Partha original.

name: Piquet: Archon II
description:
Refight 3000 years of history covered by Archon 2nd Edition. Can you decisively change history by defeating Alexander the Great, Caesar, or Hannibal? Will the Greeks throw back the Persians or will Xerxes reign supreme? Fight through the centuries of East Asian warfare, or try your hand at the mysterious armies of Central America. Archon 2nd edition has been re-worked and re-tooled including extensive Campaign Musters. Be a leader, not a follower, and take charge of history!

Expands:

Piquet: Master Rules for Wargaming
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Hunker Down: The Hurricane Game
description:
From the publisher:

HunkerDown© is a fun fast paced board game designed to take 2-6 players through a full hurricane season. Each turn is filled with the opportunity to prepare, or HunkerDown© for the approaching hurricane. BEWARE… before the hurricane always comes a feeder band, which can impose on you a series of outrageous events.

The good news is… after every hurricane there is relief that will offer aid while trying to deal with the aftermath of the storm. The player that survives the season first is the winner.

name: Strategic Command
description:
Strategic Command uses a vertical board between the players, where each player moves his pieces on his side of the board and cannot see the other player's pieces. Each piece has a magnet on it, which will repel off the board (most of the time to the tray in the base) any piece in the exact same space on the other player's side. A spinner in the base gives you 1 to 4 movement points. The first player to repel the other player's star piece (which cannot move) by moving onto its space, which is known, wins the game. There are tanks which can only move on land, ships which can only move on water, and jets which can move on either.


Another similar but officially unrelated game was released in the 1980s: Zomax.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hidden Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Napoleonic Scenarios 1
description: The first volume of historical Napoleonic scenarios for any system but mainly for the more manageable refights that General de Brigade is becoming renowned for.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Napoleonic Scenarios 2
description:
The second volume of historical Napoleonic scenarios for any system but mainly for the more manageable refights that General de Brigade is becoming renowned for.

It contains the following ten scenarios:


Elchingen 1805
Saalfeld 1806
Maida 1806
Teugen-Hausen 1809
Essling 1809
Brunswick 1809
Sabugal 1811
Arroyo Molinos 1811
Dolitz & Probstheyda – Leipzig 1813
Plancenoit 1815.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame

name: And Continually Wear the Blue
description: Sub-titled "A Short Guide to the U.S. Army & the 'Indian Wars' 1850-90." This rules booklet extensively details the unit organizations for the U.S. Army forces during the period covered, as well as some of the opposing Native American contingents. There are several scenarios included, with even a mini-campaign, for those inclined to conduct such. It is 64 pages in length.

name: Murder à la carte: Un-Happy Hour
description:
The Mystery:
When the lights go out on Disco Fever, it's lights out for Dexter Doyle, too. A gun shot shatters the fun, the dance floor clears and there's poor Dex, not dead on his feet but dead on the floor. So who's spoiling all the fun in this Chicago bar, the greedy bartender, a mysterious barfly, or is it really you who's been doing the hustle?

The Suspects:
Phil Muggs
Marshall Hartz
Ginny Tonick
Dolores Delgato
Marlena
Willy Krash

Contents:
- Party Planner Booklet with menu and recipes suggestions, along with music and decorating ideas
- Character Booklets for all six suspects, includes their roles and background information
- Eight Place Cards
- Eight Party Invitations and Envelopes
- Six Secret Clues
- Cassette Tape with an introduction, summary of events and the solution to the crime

name: Pax Romana
description: This is a Japanese card based game on Roman Empire Politics. Players play factions within the Roman Empire who try to take over.

name: Grandma's Treasure
description:
This is a deck of cards that can be used to facilitate a treasure hunt around your house. The game consists of a deck of 26 cards; 1 Treasure card and 25 cards with images of objects that you would typically find around your home: Blue cards: shoe, dresser, clock, bed; Orange cards: tissue, window, vacuum; Green cards: couch, tv, table, lamp, books, chair; Yellow cards: bottle, milk, pot, spoon, salt, refrigerator; Red cards: door, ball, pencil, key, phone, plant.

The hunt organizer (Grandma?) selects one of the cards and holds it in reserve. She then places a second card at or near the object/location shown on the reserve card. Another card is placed at or near the object/location shown on the second card. The organizer proceeds in this fashion, placing as many cards as she chooses, and placing the Treasure Card last. The participant(s) are handed the reserve card and follow the trail of cards throughout the house to the Treasure card. The participant(s) them redeem the Treasure Card for a prize.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Disney Group Photo
description:
The objective of this game is to be the first player to match all of the characters on your character card with the playing cards in your hand. You draw either the top card of the draw pile or the top card of the discard pile and then discard a card.

Each character card has 6 Disney characters on it. The deck of cards contains two normal and one "ID" version of each character. The "ID" version of the card contains biography information for each character and in order to win the game, two of the six cards in your hand must be "ID" cards.

In addition, there are:

"Red Eye" cards, which let you get any card out of the discard pile
"Overexposed" cards, which force any player of your choice to get a new randomly chosen character card
"Photo Shy" cards, which are a wild card substitute for a character card
"Say Cheese" cards, which are a wild card substitute for a character card OR an "ID" card

The characters in the game include:

Ariel
Baloo
Bambi
Belle
Cinderella
Genie
Lady
Mickey Mouse
Mulan
Peter Pan
Pinocchio
Pluto
Scar
Simba
Sleeping Beauty
Snow White
The Beast
Tigger
Tramp
Ursula
Winnie the Pooh
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: The That's Life! Mating Game
description:
The object of the game is to be the first to get to your dream date in the center of the board. To get there, you need to prove you are worthy by scoring romance points in the outer ring and then collecting romantic gifts in the inner ring.

You'll find yourself answering tricky questions, playing footsies and giving other players Eskimo kisses - just to win the points and gifts you need to be the first to get to your dream date!

This is a tie-in game for the Australian magazine "That's Life!"

name: World War III: Asian Front – 1989
description:
From the website:

"With the capture of Ulan-Ude by American-led UN Forces, Novosibirsk sues for peace. Now, led by the legendary general, Douglas Freeman, American forces seek to maintain a cease-fire between China and the new 'Republic of Sibir' (Siberia). The truce collapses, and China and the United States, the post-Cold War's two superpowers, are at war. From Korea to Mongolia, the battle rages, challenging and changing everyone in its path. Based on the 6th and 7th novels, WW III: Asian Front and WW III: Force of Arms, of the WW III saga by Ian Slater."

For this, you'll be provided with the game's mapsheets, rules, charts, etc., while you will utilize the components from Axis & Allies or related games.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Indoor Scavenger Hunt for Kids
description: To play, players each take 5 cards and try to find as many things as they can around the house. Players might have to find a a hat, a coin, something that begins with the letter B and many more. The player who completes the most tasks successfully wins.

name: The Guess Picture Trivia: Movie Edition
description: Picture trivia book presents 150 pages of classic Hollywood movies. Answer all the questions to score points and then go a step further and answer the bonus questions to score additional points. Good interaction party game that can be as short or long as desired.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Operation Overlord: Upgrade Vehicle Supplement
description:
Supplement for Operation Overlord: Normandy 1944 giving expanded rules for:
Gun Calibers
Flame Throwers
Smoke launchers
Merged units
Full army lists for German, American and British tank and mechanized infantry.
3 scenarios based on historical battles

Expands:

Operation Overlord: Normandy 1944
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Gamonal 1808
description:
Alea Magazine issue 27, along with Balaguer 1938.

Simulates the engagement on 10 November 1808 between the French under Soult and Spanish forces under Belveder in northern Spain. Uses the Shadow of the Eagle system (rules available in English), which reproduces simple formation and facing. The game includes 60 double-sided counters which need to be mounted, and a small, 26x26cm map.

Game System:
- scale = 250m/hex;
- time = 20 min/GT;
- strength = battaillons (inf), regiments (cav), batteries (art).

name: Oil Rush
description:
I spot this game as a published one in about 1980 under the name "Naftowa Gorączka" (Polish: "Oil Rush"), but then I used to play it using only pencil, paper and 2 six-sided dice.

Players act as oil companies. The board is 8x8 for 2 players, 9x9 for three ones and 10x10 for four players. Each player has 6 money units at the beginning.

TURN ORDER:

1) The active player points at a spot on a map and puts the bid he wishes to pay for it (often it's just 0). The players in clockwise order may overbid each other. When the high bid stands - the winner loses the declared amount of money and becomes the active player since then. (It is possible to take a few turns in a row if one has enough money!)

2) Dice are rolled to determine if oil is present. A sum of 9 or more is required. But if there is some oil on any of the fields with a common border line with the one the check is performed for, the number is reduced by 1 for each such field. If the oil is present on the fields with common corner with the chosen one, 1 is subtracted from the required number for each 2 such fields. Thus to find oil on a field completely surrounded by other oil fields (very rare situation!) a player needs only to throw 3 or more.

3) If the oil is not present, the field is marked as an empty one. If it is peresent it is marked as an oil field belonging to the active player, and the active player receives 1 money unit for each point he rolled over the required minimum. Thus if there was 1 fileld nearby, and a sum of 8 was required but 10 was rolled, the active player receives 2 money units. Note that it is possible to find oil and get no instant reward!

4) The clokwise neighbor of the active player becomes one. Go to 1. :-) Game ends when all the fields are checked.

5) Each player receives 10 points for each oil field he owns and one point for each money unit he has got at the end of the game. The player with most points wins. (It is possible to end in a draw).
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Economic, Exploration, Territory Building
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Tile Placement, Variable Phase Order

name: Parfumaster
description: Play with your nose, your eyes and your memory. Will you be able to identify a scent from 16 different samples, or make your adversary guess a smell? This games exists in three versions: House, Country and Fruits & Vegetables. Each one will allow you to play against your friends or solitaire!

name: Golum Arena
description:
From back of rule book:

In a future save from the destruction of the past, war no longer exists, but formal combat remains.

Join the ranks of the Warrior Elite, piloting huge Meca called "Golems" within a dedicated battle facility known as The Arena.

Play is fast and deadly, with speed and defense just as important as raw firepower.

Number of players is limited only by availability of components.

Comments:

A similar concept to Battletech. The game contains one rule book, one map (plain white with a hex grid), one sheet of counters (use your scissors to cut them out) and a deck of 36 cards (very thin and flimsy).

name: The Battle for Iwo Jima
description:
This is a Japanese wargame on the battle of Iwo Jima, 1945. Published in Game Journal #16.

Uses an area movement system similar to the one used in Storm over Arnhem with heavy modifications.

Game translated in English with new map and counters as Iwo Jima: Rage Against the Marines.

name: SAD... The Game of Depression
description:
Welcome to Depression... that lonely isolated room locked up in the back of your mind. Well somehow you're locked in it now and the only way out is by reaching the end of the tunnel. However, its not as easy as walking around. As you go through the tunnel you must collect mind tokens because in the end, only the one with the most mind tokens gets out.

Depression is the first boardgame to be released by MC Comics and can be downloaded for free here at BGG. All you need to do is download and print a single 8.5 by 11 file that contains both the board and the rules. Then all you need to get is a D6, D4, three pawns, and a few items like pennies to represent mind tokens. Once you have that you'll be ready to escape DEPRESSION...
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Turning Point: The Battle of Freeman's Farm
description:
Published in 2005 by BSO Games (DTP), the description is from the GMT website, when it was on their p500 list.

It's Turning Point, a game covering the pivotal battle of Freeman's Farm, at Saratoga. It features all the units, from Morgan's Rifles to the British grenadiers, and all the dense, wooded terrain you would normally expect, but in a way you've probably not seen before.

The game uses two decks of cards, one deck for each player to drive the game. Each player gets a certain number of his cards each turn, never his full deck, and his allotment is usually different (in terms of number and type) from his opponent. The cards are used to determine movement, combat, and special items, such as Indian Stealth, Counter-Attack, Rifle Fire, and Rapid Movement, among others. Players may play as many cards as they wish when it's their turn, using each card for only one of the possible three purposes. Play passes back and forth between players, until both players have used all their cards … and the Turn is over.

Turning Point is thus a game of card play and management, which unfolds on the map of Freeman's Farm, which uses squares, rather than hexes,. You're still moving units, trying to outflank, attacking with what you hope are better odds (since you don't know what cards your opponent will play, if any, and you never know what his final strength will be), and using your cards, and wits, to outplay your opponent.

Turning Point was a nominee in the Charles S. Roberts awards for Best DTP-Produced Boardgame (Charles S. Roberts Awards) for 2005.

name: Jumping to Conclusions
description:
Object of the game: Place the cards face down and the counters in the center of the players. It is useful to play the game in sessions, by breaking the pack into two or three roughly equal parts. Keep the bottom card last.
The first player reads the clues on the first card to the other players, starting with the points at the top. The other players may try to answer at any time, without awaiting turns, but each player is allowed only one answer per clue. Where two or more players give the same answer together only the first is counted. Players may pass instead of answering that clue.
a correct answer wins the points indicated for that clue. Players pick up counters for their points. An incorrect answer loses five points.
Players take turns round to read the clues. Highest score after the last card is the winner.

name: Egypt to Canaan No.1 The Plagues of Egypt
description:
This is the first in a series of 4 games in the Egypt to Canaan Hebron series of bible games published by Good Reading Limited in the 1970s.

Like the other games in the series it is a roll-and-move game and uses a D8 which it calls a 'Pyragon'.

From the rules:
"These exciting games have been carefully planned so as to give a constructive idea of the history of Israel from Bible, from the time of the captivity in Egypt up till the time of the settlement in the land God had promised them."

name: Egypt to Canaan No.2 The Wilderness Wandering
description:
This is the second in a series of 4 games in the Egypt to Canaan Hebron series of bible games published by Good Reading Limited.

Like the other games in the series it is a roll-and-move game and uses a D8 which it calls a 'Pyragon'.

Players try to get their Cloud and Israel markers to Sinai.

From the rules:
"These exciting games have been carefully planned so as to give a constructive idea of the history of Israel from Bible, from the time of the captivity in Egypt up till the time of the settlement in the land God had promised them."
publishers: Good Reading Limited, Leuchter Verlag, Otto Maier Verlag

name: Logol
description:
From rules:
Forms words that have a complete sense, making the letter fall within the grid.

Contents:
One plastic grid.
Two plastic pedestals.
56 "literal" tiles.
One sand glass.
One score-card.
One rules booklet.

name: We Can Be Heroes
description:
We Can Be Heroes

A heroic multi-genre miniature wargame. A quick skirmish between heroes and their sidekicks in a hassle free, fast play design. The spirit of the rules is much like a Hollywood movie or television show that does not bog down in detail.

From Chapter 1; Edited

http://www.taskforceproductions.com
categories: Fighting, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction, Vietnam War, Wargame, World War II

name: Beer Smarts: Tap Your Knowledge
description:
This game features 60 question cards about the culture, history, brewing, and favorite ways to drink beer in four categories:

Cheers - Favorite brews
Wild Card - Bushels of beer facts
Beer Basics - From barley to beer
Beer Culture - Beer through the ages

This game can be used alone as flash cards or as a party game by a group.

name: Crazy Golf
description:
"Tee Off in the Comfort of Your Living Room"

The Golf Course (gameboard) is printed in the magazine along with a sample scorecard. There are only 4 'holes' on the golf course; however, you can play 9 holes by using different combinations of tee-off locations and holes. The sample scorecard has the 'par' for each hole. Other equipment needed: a golf ball (marker) of a distinct color for each player, 2 D6 and paper and pencil to keep score (you can make or copy a scorecard for each player instead of using a plain piece of paper for scoring).

When a new hole is started, each player tees-off in turn. Until everyone finishes the hole, order of play is determined by whoever is farthest from the current hole. Whoever is farthest takes the next swing. On your turn, while you are on the fairway or rough, roll both dice. You must move your ball in a straight line (horizontally, vertically or diagonally) as follows: (1) the total of both dice (2) the number on either die (3) the difference between the two dice.

Playing from a sand trap has a potential penalty. Play the stroke as usual, but then roll one die again. If it is a 1, there's no penalty. A 2, 3 or 4 adds one penalty stroke. A 5 or 6 adds two strokes.

Landing in a water trap incurs a two-stroke penalty, and you take your next swing from the last space you passed before landing in the water.

When you make it onto the proper green, you must decide whether you will (1) continue to use the movement method using 2 dice or (2) use a 'putter' (move the ball one square in any direction for each putt). You must continue to use this method for the rest of the hole.

There are a few more obstacles: (1) You may not hit onto or directly over an opponent's ball (2) You may not hit onto or directly over trees (3) You may not hit your ball onto a green other than the one around the hole you are playing.

Keep track of the number of strokes it takes you to complete a hole and write it onto your scorecard. Lowest total wins.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Square Grid

name: Arnhem
description: There are 120 of the 1/2" counters, map sheet with hex grid, rules, charts. Turns represent half-day turns from AM Sept. 17 - AM Sept. 29, 1944. Features airborne units and air bombardment, artillery and engineers rules. Allies get 3 victory points (VP's) per turn for control of the Arnhem Bridge and 2 VP's per turn for the pontoon bridge near Arnhem (if it’s not blown). XXX Corps units that leave the north end of the map in supply get 2 VP's per factor. The Germans get 4 VP's for each turn they hold Arnhem Bridge plus 2 VP's per factor for destroying Allied airborne units while only 1 VP for other Allied units, per factor destroyed. Isolated units (including airborne) can still attack for two turns after that they can only defend. Side with most VP's wins. Allies have secret drop zones at the start of the game that they must commit to irregardless of German units present in the hex with only the Polish brigade being able to alter their landing zone. A rare game to find as it was published in Panzerfaust as a mini-game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: BidWiz
description:
BidWiz is a trick-taking card game based on the ideas behind the popular bidding card games "Oh Hell" and "Wizard." What makes BidWiz unique, is that each player chooses his own hand by taking turns to select one of the top two cards of the draw pile, until the draw pile is exhausted. Each player must then bid how many tricks he thinks he can win, and must make his bid exactly to be rewwarded with points. Trumps alternate between each suit, with the last hand being a no-trump hand worth double points.

Step 1: Build Your Hand - Build the best hand possible, one card at a time.
Step 2: Bid Your Hand - Bid the highest number of tricks your hand will win, without over-bidding.
Step 3: Play Your Hand - Play your hand to match your bid and if possible block your opponent(s) from getting their bid.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Trick-taking

name: Cosmic Flunsh
description:
Players explore and colonize Planets to gain enough power to fight against the ever expanding cosmic flunsh.
Players have to trade with raw material and fight against the natives on some planets they explore.

name: Woody Foot
description:
It's a dexterity soccer Game playing on a wooden board with the painted lines of a soccer field on it. Players try to score by finger-flicking their players (wooden discs) and pushing the ball into the opponent's goal.
The rules are similar to soccer.

There exist three versions which differ in the size of the game board and the number of wooden players.

name: Space Orx
description:
Space Orx is the second supplement for Injurius Games. The Orx are rude, crude, and easy to field. They are faster than Humans and have powerful weapons and lots of hit points. Orx almost never lack for Command Points, and their size and strength make them naturals in melee. These guys are off the wall, as reflected in their skilz and equipment. For example, who else would eat Brain Candy (a potent combat stim) or drink G.I. Coffee (gain extra actions but suffer extra damage as a result)? And only Orx have the Tag Team skill (gang up on a hapless opponent in melee!) and Athletics (Orx make physical fitness their priority).

Space Orx is not a stand-alone product. You need a copy of Injurius Games to play Space Orx.

Expands:

Injurius Games
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: Polywumpus
description:
From the publisher:

Tactical Duck Combat! Just what you always wanted from Tri Tac Games.

The back woods in central Pennsylvania and a quack in the night start the nightmare of the opening days of what mankind would later call "the Duck Wars". They've come from the swamps to prey on Campers and Cub Scouts. This is a crazy board game that is kind of like an RPG. Fun for the whole family as you attempt to stop the duckbilled horror.

Join the Scouts as they revenge the death of their Scout Master at the Beak of the Giant Mutated Duck. Contains 6" X 9" Hex grid, 40 paper counters, lots of fun (beer, pretzels and other embellishments not included).

No. 1 in the Duck Trilogy
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Paper-and-Pencil, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up
publishers: Tri Tac Games LLC (Tri Tac Talents)

name: Colorado Railroads Game
description:
From the Introduction in the rules:

On May 10, 1869, the Union Pacific and the Central Pacific met at Promontory Summit to establish the first transcontinental railroad for the United States. The route taken by the Union Pacific just grazed the tip of Colorado at Julesberg and headed west through Wyoming. Colorado, however, wanted railroads and soon got them.

In the Colorado Railroads Game, players assume the roles of the big financiers who put together the rails that roamed the Rockies. Somewhat in the tradition of Heartland Trefoil's 1829, and Avalon Hill's 1830, players buy shares of stock in various railroads, take control of them, and build track from city to city, and city to mine. The railroads earn money by operating trains between stations. Player money is earned through dividends to stockholders. Unlike the above mentioned games, the rails are drawn right on the map, and owned by the railroads who built them (As in Mayfair's Empire Builder system.) The economic conditions change varying from boom times to depression, and mines appear and disappear at random throughout the game.
mechanics: Line Drawing, Pick-up and Deliver, Stock Holding

name: The Comic Strip Card Game
description: Collect all four frames of Peanuts comic strips to score points.

name: Words
description: A Canadian variation of the free game Dictionary, more popularly marketed as Balderdash. "Words" has cards with real words and their definitions, which must be read by one player. Other players must try to guess the meaning, or else make up a plausible-sounding definition, after which all players vote on which definition they believe is the correct one. This Canadian edition was published in 1983 and comes with a large box of word cards with definitions.

name: Mt. Everest
description:
Players each climb a different face on the pyramid shaped, "3-D" mountain, rolling the die in a race to the summit. The climbers have magnets in their boots (base), so they stick to the metalicized mountain as they advance. A roll of six causes an avalanche (lose a turn). There are a couple of shortcuts available on each route, but it takes a exact dice roll to cross them.

The game comes with a 16 page booklet that contains photographs and information about Everest, including the successful summit by Edmund Hillary and sherpa Norkay Tensing just two years prior to the game's publication
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Einparken bis zum Abwinken
description:
This uses a similar idea to the popular 'parking' puzzles but in a strategy game. Each player has 5 vehicles - 3 normal cars (2x1 spaces), a bus (3x1 spaces) and a Smart car (1x1). On your turn you have 3 choices: 1) Place a vehicle face down, 2) Turn one of your vehicles face up and choose its direction of travel without altering its position (so the larger vehicles can choose two directions, the Smart can choose four), 3) Move one of your vehicles one space in its direction of travel.
The aim is to be the last player to be able to move. Even if one cannot move at some stage of the game if your way is subsequently cleared you can still move then.

name: Tic-Tac-Subtract
description: Here's a basic subtraction activity using a competitive tic-tac-toe format. Three levels of difficulty cover subtraction problems from 1 to 20. Great for home use or in learning centers.

name: Strudel
description: Strudel (Eddies) is essentially Parchisi in reverse; players try not to be the first to lose all four pieces to the eddies. Every turn, players roll two dice, advance any pieces from their start area if possible, and then use any remaining dice to move their own pieces or even whole rings of currents.

name: Adjugé
description:
Become the richest collector!
Six rare objects are for sale at the auction, no one knows their real value.

name: Conservation
description:
Players are attempting to gain "tricks" of three bird cards: a male, female and young of the same species. The game uses a deck of cards, comprising: 75 bird cards (3 of each species), 6 Hazards, 6 Protection cards and 1 Appeal card.

6 cards are dealt to each player at the start of the game. The players then pick a card from the deck (or discard pile) and then play. Sets of species are built (Male, then Female, then Young) and a completed set forms a trick and is put to one side. Sets are built up in the spaces along the edge of the board facing the player; the species has to go in the appropriate habitat (as indicated on the card).

Partial sets can be protected by Protection cards and destroyed by Hazard cards. The Appeal card allows you to take one card from another player, in return for the Appeal card, which can then be used again by its new owner. Some of the species are "Rare Species". Completing these sets gains the player the appropriate counter.

To end the game you have to get a certain number of sets of species, with the rare ones counting for 2 or 3, depending on the value on the counter. Points are then totaled, with each species set being worth 50 points, with the appropriate multiplier (x2 or x3) for the "Rare" species, and cards in front of each player (but not yet in completed sets) being worth 10 points each.

name: Total Football
description:
Totalfootball is a Football (soccer) strategy game. It consists of a hard plastic carrying case which is, when opened, the football field. Each player has a team of 11 players, including the keeper, just as in the real game. The rules are an abstract version of the real rules, and in order to execute the actions, dice are used for details.

The game is published by a company from Kazachstan (Mind Game inc.) and several other Kazachstan companies have aided with this production. Besides a rulebook in a lot of languages also a CD-Rom with the game rules is included.

name: StockItToYa!
description: This is a game where you attempt to get the most money at the end of the game. You purchase stocks throughout the game, and when all of the stock for a company has been purchased, the stock gets sold. You get a bonus if you are the first to sell the stock in a company.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding

name: Kleine Ausreißer
description: Mama Duck's chicks can't listen and swim without precaution on the river. Mama Duck now has to catch them! Each player's three chicks try to enjoy their freedom as long as possible. The player who last has a free chick wins.

name: Pavia 1525
description: The battles of Pavia: France against Spain for the control of Italy.

name: Morocco
description:
In Morocco, players become merchants in the open-air Moroccan market, trading their wares in an attempt to drum up interest, selling them when profitable and storing them in their warehouses in hopes of future gains. Keeping a shrewd eye on what their fellow merchants are up to and a keen sense of timing will make you the richest merchant in Morocco!

Morocco is an economic card game for 3-5 players.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Trading

name: Walt Disney's Disneyland Card Game
description:
The 1964 version has two different games.

The Disney character cards are numbered 1 to 10 with four cards of each suit. However, the suits are red hearts, yellow sunbursts, blue five-pointed stars, and white daisy flowers. There are also four Donald Duck cards of a "wild" shamrock suit. The #1 cards are Mickey Mouse, the #2 cards are Minnie Mouse, the #3 cards are Pluto, the #4 cards are Thumper, the #5 cards are Goofy, the #6 cards are Dumbo, the #7 cards are Clarabelle, the #8 cards are Flower, the #9 cards are Daisy Duck, and the #10 cards are Chip 'n' Dale. The last card is an instruction card.

Game 1: The four #1 cards are placed face-up on the table. The remaining cards are shuffled and dealt to each player. The player to the left of the dealer begins by playing a #2 card on a #1 card of the same color; this player can discard a second card by playing a #3 card of the same suit or any other #2 card. A player can only discard up to two cards per turn. A Donald Duck card is to be played as an #11 card to complete a pile. The first player to discard all his or her cards gains 10 points. A player must gain 50 points to win the game.

Game 2: The second game is similar to a version of Crazy Eights or Uno. Each player is dealt five cards. The remaining cards are placed in a face down stack with one card turn upright. Players discard cards by matching either the suit or number or by playing a wild Donald Duck card. When a wild Donald Duck card is discarded, it is played sideways so that the next player will have to match the card underneath by suit or number or with another wild Donald Duck card. The winner is the first player to discard all of his cards.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Warbands
description:
From the designer's website:

'About 10 years ago I wanted to design a game that suited my own needs. I played many wargames and although some were close to what my vision is of a perfect game there was always something to bother about.

'I played many many wargames, and many of them disappointing me. In my opinion a game should have a fine mix of these elements:

* fast pacing, simple and only relevant statics
* depth, a good mix of planning, bluffing, fast thinking and random elements
* flexible, can you implement scenarios, new elements, characters and objects?
* rich, a fantasy world provides a rich world, there are almost no limits
* epic, can you remember the games you played a year ago?
* cheap, well you can actually download Warbands for free from this site. In return I ask you to enter the forums and join the discussions.

'These key-elements I kept in mind developing Warbands, I show no hesitation using elements from existing games to develop Warbands. Its really fun, fast-paced and has a lot of tactical depth.'

In the game Warbands you are represented by a hero-mage figure controlling a party of a few or maybe a dozen characters on a battlefield. This complete party is called a warband. Each character in the wardband has an unique name. With you controlling this warband you can play the provided scenarios or the ones you created yourself but the game is also designed to battle versus an enemy warband. In an arena or in the open, battle it out till the enemy character is destroyed.

http://www.warbands.info/
mechanics: Line of Sight, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Wetwar
description:
From Black Powder's Website:
The Species Conflict

The year is 2038.

Man has grasped deep into the ocean, the wild lands, and into the orbital space, colonizing and tearing resources for the peoples use in a darkening future.

The future at a glance seems hard, for the birth of Risen animal species to intelligence and form like the human kind. Species hatred flares as humans have employed these new lifeforms where humans deem fit. Life has been hard for the Hybrids and the Risen, often worked to their deaths in colonial construction.

As well, many humans are fearful that they may be placed the loser in species conflict. Older folk are afraid of the frog, rat, and feline folk that now live next door.

All the while the Corporate Lords take their due as new leaders of the 21st century.

Welcome to Pacifica, your role is as a thief and a soldier. Leaders of Buka Units such as yourself will do battle, live as a rogue, and all the while laugh at those who do not know honor and freedom. Southeast off the shore of Japan, is where you are needed as the the 1,000,000 souls of the Pacifica Ocean Settlements are at odds with seeming rebels. These insurgents may be backed by powerful forces, so beware.

Pacifica makes its pay from oil drilling, tourism, research programs, and especially, the Titan Naga Platform that taps and collects geothermal energy from the earths core.

Of course, the internet now exists as both the wire of mother earth, and as playground. Webcrawlers with HUD net access fly as Deva across the shadowy illusion that is the Cybernet. Pays to keep a few of those people around.

Some, like yourself, will make their pay by covert operations. Welcome Buka rogue,

Enjoy your stay.

The game is a build-it-yourself PDF download. It includes a modular board, units (infantry, vehicles, and weapons) a rulebook, and 44 cards used to represent background "cyber-combat," or the opponents' wrestling for control of the computer system of the building they are in. Physical combat is decided by a more conventional roll-to-hit system. Rules are included to simulate combat in flooded and fully submerged locations.

This game is out of print.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Family Choices Proverbs Edition
description:
(From the publisher's website - http://www.faithkids.com)

Family Choices Board Game - Proverbs Edition
"Applying the Biblical Wisdom of Solomon to Everyday Situations"
ISBN/SPCN: 9834503369 Item #: 101588
Size: 14 X 6.5 X 2"

Families! Play this game together and know where you are spiritually!

* Anne Marie has a great singing voice, but another girl got picked for a solo part at church. Anne Marie got angry and wanted to stop going to church. What would you say to her?
* Dad says no tattoos, but how would he ever know unless Megan shows him? Shouldn't she be able to make her own decisions? It's her body, isn't it?
* Mom found out her friend at work was going to be let go, but she told her boss she wouldn't tell. Should she keep her promise to her boss or should she be loyal to her friend and let her know?

Making the right choices in life can be tough. But with the help of Family Choices: Proverbs Edition, learning to make the best decisions becomes exciting entertainment!

Make Family Choices part of your Family Night fun, and get ready to come face-to-face with some of life's toughest real-life issues--issues we all face in today's world. Learn how real heroes of the faith, such as Solomon and his descendants, got wisdom for living by following God's laws. Now you can follow their example by talking about and learning eighteen Proverbs from the popular NIV translation of the Bible. Designed to be played by all the members of a family--from the youngest to the oldest--Family Choices: Proverbs Edition will become a favorite family activity. Included are a colorful game board, six player markers, 150 situation cards, 6 principle cards, and an instruction/reference booklet.

name: Tango
description: From the rules: "Tango - A game of men and women. Tango is a new game of revolutionary conception - to win, one must conquer your opponent and, at the same time, let your opponent conquer you. Knowing how to give and to take pieces is fundamental in this game. A player who only captures pieces or who only loses pieces probably will not be the winner".

name: Bonnie Blue vid fronten
description: Rules expansion for the game Bonnie Blue. This expansion adds rules for playing games in World War 1.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Münzenfund und alte Knochen
description: What is really stockpiled in museums all over the world? The people able to search the depots are interested in more than just Madonna sculptures or Biedermeier furniture. Real things are also hidden! Real mammoth bones, treasure chests, old toys and antique machines. Even parts of an old train can be found! A tactical dice game for three to six game players. The game features many very cool looking components.

name: Swamp Fox
description:
You are Colonel Francis Marion (the Swamp Fox). Be the first player to capture three British Soldiers and return to Snow's Island.
Based on the Disney series.
categories: American Revolutionary War, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Conquest: The Medieval Strategy Game
description:
"The playing board is divided into four kingdoms (colored separately), each controlled by a different player. The object of the game is to conquer all the other kingdoms on the board and bring them under your rule."

1 Playing Board
4 Big Pegs
1 Die
50 Brown Foot Soldier Chips
30 Blue Horse Chips
20 Red Chariot Chips
20 Green Worker Chips
50 Big Yellow Chips (i.e. gold coins) with printed stickers of 5, 10 and 50
20 Calamity Cards

name: Thermopylae
description:
This "Krieg-Kit" conflict game was designed and published by Marty Silva in 1973. The game deals with the both the strategic and tactical aspects of the Peloponnesian War.

There are two large monochrome (light and dark blue/black)map parts that depict Ancient Greece in 480. There is also a small 8 page rulebook, a battle results table and a counter sheet with adhesive printed counters that must be cut and peeled. There are a 138 counters, both men and ships. Basically, the game is a very early homemade DTP effort (long before the term was invented)from Orland Park, Illinois.

Fairly rare in wargaming circles, yet a simple and quick simulation of one of history's great wars.

name: Quadrant: The Game of Deep Space Control
description:
Quadrant is a boardgame that was included in Gameplay No. 4, May, 1983.

It is a connection game in that each player is trying to build a continuous line of occupied points from one end of the board to the other. Players are limited in their placement by a roll of four dice, which are used to generate coordinates. Four example, a roll of 1,2,3,5 could be used as: 1+2=3 and 3+5=8, to generate x=3 and y=8 or x=8 and y=3. Or 2+3=5 and 1+5=6 for x-y of 5,6 or 6,5 and so on. If a player tries to occupy a previously occupied space, there is a challenge which is resolved with a 2-die roll-off with the higher roll winning.

The game includes a grid board and 52 markers per side, all on light cardstock that needs to be cut out.

name: Scoop's Surprises
description: This is a children's game based on the classic three-shell game. One player takes the role of Scoop, an ice cream vendor promoting "his surprise ice creams." Four wooden ice cream cups are used to hide stacks of three wooden counters each. Each wooden counter represents a scoop of ice cream in a particular flavor--vanilla, chocolate, strawberry, or mint--with all of the scoops of a particular flavor being hidden under a single ice cream cup. The cups are then switched around--from 4 to 8 switches per round depending on what the players agree on beforehand--and the first player to Scoop's left tries to guess which cup a particular flavor (it's a little unclear from the rules, but apparently Scoop selects the flavor to be guessed) is under. If they're correct, they get one of the "scoops" of that flavor, and they become Scoop (i.e. they get to switch the cups around) for the next round. If they're incorrect, they lose one of their "scoops" from a previous round (if available) and the player to their left gets to guess. Players have the option of passing if they don't want to risk losing a "scoop." At the end of the round (after either a player has guessed correctly or all players have passed or guessed incorrectly). All of the cups are lifted and any lost "scoops" are returned to their respective stacks. The game continues until all of the "scoops" have been won. Cups with no "scoops" under them remain in the game. The player with the most "scoops" (wooden tokens) is the winner. The game comes with attractive wooden components, and ice cream vendor's hat to designate Scoop, and a sturdy box that's really quite a bit larger than necessary to hold everything.

name: Checkpoint
description:
From the instructions:
"Checkpoint is a collection of four 'gimmick' road rallies. However, these events are not run on a road or highway, but on a game board, the World Wide Web... and in your mind.

"Each of the four Checkpoint road rallies is sort of an elaborate game of 'Simon Says' played out by moving your tiny car across a road map/game board.

"In each, you will follow a series of route instructions that the devious Rallymaster has specifically designed to mislead you.

"You shouldn't lose your way because all the various routes across the map lead to same ending. However, the player who is best at remaining on the one true course... by spotting the Rallymaster's sinister tricks... will become the eventual winner."

The game also includes instructions for entering an online contest that started in November 1997.

name: A Corner Of Hell
description:
"A Corner of Hell" is a set of rules designed for fast, enjoyable skirmish level games set in the second World War.
The rules include all kinds of weapons & vehicles, from regular troops to elite.
categories: Dice, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
publishers: Brigade Games, HLBS Publishing (The Honourable Lead Boiler Suit Company), Rattrap Productions LLC

name: Voidstriker
description:
Semi-generic starship combat game played using counters or miniatures. Rules are simple and include a ship construction system. Ready-made ship designs and scenarios are included.

Expanded by:

Voidstriker Ship Recognition Guide #1

name: Air-Attack
description: This game is about plane to plane combat. The Corey Game Company produced a number of early games that were unique in that they were far more elaborate than other games from the same era.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War II

name: Sure Shot Baseball
description:
Various versions of this game have existed for many years. I am not sure if this game has been renamed?

Sure Shot Baseball is a two person game played much the same way as outdoor baseball. The game consists of nine innings of 3 outs each. The "pitcher" rolls a plastic marble down a slide and it heads toward a batter controlled by their opponent. The "batter" tries to hit the ball out of the stadium by turning a batting knob. If it goes out of the unique up-curved field the "fielder" then tries to catch it. Singles, doubles, triples, foul balls, and home runs are determined where the ball goes over the wall. The "runners" stay in their team dugouts until it is time to position them on the field.

Each "batter" gets only one pitch. A missed pitch counts as one out. Each team gets three outs and then players change positions. Players play nine innings and whomever has the most runs wins.

There are a few other simple rules. The game is quite tricky to learn and play competitively. But it is definitely a fun experience if you enjoy baseball!!

name: Saint Seiya Cardgame Collection
description:
It's a Collectible Card Game based on the popular anime series Saint Seiya, all in Japanese.

It seems you battle your characters using Cosmo points in various power fields : speed, Temperature and Psychokinesis. The playing mat looks fairly similar to the knights of the zodiac one, but the game seems completely different (different stats, different card design)
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Mythology

name: Brainsweat
description:
From the back of the box:

Destined to become a classic.

"The bottom line of Brainsweat is to earn the most points." Points are based on correct answers but more so on fooling other players.

Brainsweat variations: Scramble. Find as many words as possible in the mixed up letters.

Example: Seafscier--Fricassee (unscrambled word)-sea-ice-far-rice, etc.

Reverse: Co-players attempt to guess the word which has been defined or to create a convincing phony.

Hilarious "Oh no what now" cards that add another dimension that can be friend or foe.

Example: I've never been to France, but I love French Fries. Add 5 points to my score.

Warning: The "Sturgeon" General has determined this game could be habit forming.

Includes gameboard, 500 Brainsweat cards, 2 dice, 40 "Oh no what now" cards, 1 minute timer, 6 playing pieces, 6 pencils, score pad, answer pad, history of the game, scoring rule summary, and instructions
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Krebiz-4
description:
This is the description on the cover:

Includes all the rules needed to for play:
- Capitalist Movement--A campaign game
- 7 scenarios for Capitalist Movement

Technical information including:
- More X-1 ships (Cruisers, Capsules & Combination Units)
- An advanced Starbase and Battlestation
- Krebiz Carrier and Control Ships
- Krebiz tactical concepts
- Krebiz units operated by other races
- Battleship variants

Also included: 42 pages of Companion SSDs displaying 42 Krebiz units

Expands

Star Fleet Battles: Captain's Edition Basic Set
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Argonians-2
description:
This is an expansion for the game Star Fleet Battles Captain's Edition. This is the description on the cover:

Includes all the rules needed to for play:
- The Argonians: a new star faring race
- Argonian fighter rules
- More Argonian starship descriptions

Historical background for the Argonians:
- Argonian history
- History for the Argonian First Republic (A Far Side race)
- 3 more historical scenarios

Technical information including:
- Ship descriptions for 70 Argonian units
- Argonian fighter rules
- Argonian ship names

Also included: 32 Companion SSDs

Expands:

Star Fleet Battles: Captain's Edition Basic Set
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Far Side-1
description:
This is an unofficial expansion for the game Star Fleet Battles Captain's Edition. This is from the description on the back cover and contents:

Includes all the rules needed to for play:
- Two new star-faring races
- Bolaar Phaser Capacitors
- Deflection/Transfer Device
- Option Mounts
- Krebiz Capitalist Alliance
- Variable Plasmas

Historical backgrounds of two new races:
- Bolaar Pirates
- Corporate Aggressors
- Tuforeous Dead Zone

Technical information including:
- A fleet data table listing all the new races ships
- all necessary annexes

Also included: 22 Companion SSDs

Expands:

Star Fleet Battles: Captain's Edition Basic Set
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Celebrity Turds
description:
