Big name stars earn more in a couple of hours than most of us do in a year. And the media never let’s us forget how luxurious their lives are. We offer you a different view... we've drawn them as poo! Are you ready to have a little giggle at the overblown world of celebrities?

Players take on the role of movie director. They must create poker style combinations of celebrity turds to star in movies with a fecal theme. The player who scores the most points by making the most valuable movies wins the game.

It’s easy to learn and easy to play. Just deal the cards for guaranteed fun and laughter.

name: New Football
description:
"New-Football" - this the new intellectual game! a variety of football, it is just as good as chess with the same creative potential.

It has captured something better that football has! the drama of the duel, the beauty of thought and the polish of maneuver.

name: CRISS-CROSS
description:
This is a vintage game, made by KIM toys in the UK.
Dates from 1960's.

Contents:
A flimsy plastic board 6x6 with dice dots on each square
A dice
2x8 sets of markers

Object:
Each player tries to complete a row of six numbers in the same line on any direction.

Play:
Alternatively, players throw dice and put a marker on any square matching the dice outcome.
A "one" is a wild number.

name: Trans-aktion
description: Players buy up barrels of oil and try to sell these again for the highest possible profit. Whoever is the best at completing these transactions and owns the most money after a number of rounds is the winner of the game.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Dice Rolling, Stock Holding

name: K'DOR
description:
Material: 1 wooden gameboard and 24 wooden pieces.
The two players in turn set down one piece on the board until one of them can no longer play.
It is forbidden to place two pieces of the same color on two neighboring squares linked by a canal. They must be separated by at least one square.
The winner is the one who sets down the last piece.

name: Armor Attacks: The Tank Platoon
description:
"Armor Attacks: The Tank Platoon" is "an interactive exercise in small-unit tactics and leadership" written by John F. Antal, a United States Army armor officer.

A pair of six-sided dice are required to play this solitaire game which is a variation on the Choose Your Own Adventure game book genre.

In Armor Attacks, you take on the role of the leader of a U.S. Army M1 Abrams tank platoon. "Throughout the work, you will have an opportunity to make life-or-death decisions, and the story will develop according to the choices you make. As you progress through the book you will learn important tactical and operational lessons."

Armor Attacks is illustrated and includes 11 maps. Appendices provide background information such as weapons data, friendly and enemy unit organizations, and tank fighting positions.

John Antal wrote three books which used this system: Armor Attacks, Infantry Combat, and Combat Team.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Deflection
description:
Maneuver your discs in patterns of ricochet movement and try to capture all of your opponent's discs.

Whenever a disc is moved, it always in a ricochet pattern, with at least one deflector serving as a guiding device to determine the possible angles of movement.

name: Before I Was a Marshal I Was a Grenadier
description:
From the cover:
Being a set of very playable recreational Wargame rules from the 1960's designed for large-scale, convention play of tactical battles of the Napoleonic Wars.

1810-1815 Brigade/Division Actions
publishers: And That's The Way It Was...

name: Tangled Tales: The Gatekeeper Chronicles 2 – The Dungeon of Havenrock Adventure Deck
description:
The second part of the Gatekeeper Chronicles (Part 1 is included free with the Starter set)

The story so far...

Long ago, the evil wizard Null was trapped inside a magic book. Now he's sent his monstrous servants to find the artifacts he needs to escape his prison and destroy the world. Only you can stop him! You are a Gatekeeper, granted the power to travel into books!

Chapter 2: The Dungeon of Havenrock

The Staff of Power lies buried deep within an ancient castle built by Dwarves, Elves and Men. Null's horrible monsters swarm the abandoned citadel in search of this magical Staff. Can you dodge dragons, traps and deadly tentacles to find the prize before they do?

Also includes 10 Bonus cards from the secret chapter of the Gatekeeper Chronicles! Combine with secret cards from the Starter Set and Tangled Tales: The Gatekeeper Chronicles 3 – Pirates of the Black Grotto Adventure Deck to see how the Chronicles end!

Expands:

Tangled Tales Starter Set: The Gatekeeper Chronicles 1 – Nightmare Unleashed Adventure Deck

name: Tangled Tales: The Gatekeeper Chronicles 3 – Pirates of the Black Grotto Adventure Deck
description:
The third part of the Gatekeeper Chronicles (Part 1 is included free with the Starter set)

The story so far...

Long ago, the evil wizard Null was trapped inside a magic book. Now he's sent his monstrous servants to find the artifacts he needs to escape his prison and destroy the world. Only you can stop him! You are a Gatekeeper, granted the power to travel into books!

Chapter 3: Pirates of Havenrock

Sail into a world of adventure! Phantom pirates terrorize the seas,brought to life by the power of a magical Hand. When Null decides to steal the Hand's power for himself, it's up to you to find it before Null's monsters do - but beware! The blood-thirsty pirates who guard the Hand won't give it up without a fight!

Also includes 10 Bonus cards from the secret chapter of the Gatekeeper Chronicles! Combine with secret cards from the Starter Set and Booster 2: The Dungeon of Havenrock to see how the Chronicles end!
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Novel-based, Pirates

name: Giant Intergalactic Electronic Game Book
description:
From Back Cover - "Six great games packed into one giant book. Press the buttons and move your space travelers along the game paths in an all-out race to be the first one home! With six giant games to choose from, you can play them all in a row, or pick your favorites and play them over and over again!"

This is a collection of 6 original roll and move games laid out in a large book that unfolds to about 24"x36" of each game.
The games are 'Space Drain', 'Deep Freeze', 'Space Splash', 'Intergalactic Games', 'Air Lock', and 'Zoom'.
The rolling is handled by an electronic device attached to the book. Players push a button and the device makes sounds and gives a number, color, or symbol depending on the game being played. In one game the device will give additional information to the player on whether a door is locked or unlocked. The game also comes with 4 little space aliens to represent the players.

name: 3D5
description:
3D5 by the Lolo Company is essentially a 3D Tic-Tac-Toe game played in a 5x5x5 cube, allowing 109 possible winning combinations.

The one twist relative to a simple 5 in a row Tic-Tac-Toe game is that the center space of the cube is a "free" space, that can contribute to five in a row for either player. Optionally, players may specify up to nine additional free spaces beyond the center space as part of the set-up (game can with 10 neutral marbles).

An interesting feature of this game is that it comes with a set of tweezers to manipulate the balls in the grid. The grid levels are only about 2 inches apart.

Another odd feature is the posts that separate the layers. There are spacers between the layers with an elastic running through the center of the posts. Thus you can rotate the layers of the game and get it fold. There is a special peg provided to screw into the bottom tray holding the marbles to keep the game folded.

name: Perlen-Pyramide
description:
"Perlen-Pyramide" or "Pearl-Pyramid"

Quick playing abstract pyramid stacking game for exactly 3 players. Each player uses a pool of 25 "pearls" in their color and placement starts on a 5x5 base grid, with pearls in subsequent layers being supported by four underneath. A completed pyramid will thus contain exactly 55 pearl bricks.

Each player in turn will add exactly one piece to the construction, and the aim is to have the most external pearls visible in the completed pyramid. Players will be placing their pearls only onto the base of the pyramid, making sure all placed pearls touch what's already there (orthogonal or diagonally). Placement of pearls on the additional layers is triggered automatically by what is present underneath. The moment that a square group of four pearls is created in the same layer, a special "filling" placement interrupts the regular turn progression. To resolve which pearl gets placed on top of the four pearls underneath players need to look at how many different pearls are present. If one color is in the majority (3:1 or 2:1:1) then another pearl of that color gets placed on top. However, if two players each have two pearls present than a pearl of the third player becomes the peak. If all four pearls are from a single player then the player who would have the turn after this colour's player gets to place the bonus pearl. When the bonus pearl itself triggers the completion of another group of four in the next layer then again bonus pearls are resolved before the normal turn-order is resumed. When the 25th base pearl is placed the completion of the pyramid is triggered and the game ends. The winner is the one with the most external pearls present.

Three variations are also included.

Publishing history: Peter Pallat was one of the original designer "Altmeisters" of the German game industry. It was his designs that found their way into many family homes from way back in the 1930s, through Ravensburger, then known as Otto Maier Verlag, and others. He remained an active designer throughout his life, but his career went through a renaissance when, in his older days, he found a welcome and supportive group of younger designers and admirers, who, in their turn, had become torch-bearers of German game design. One of these, Reinhold Wittig, published a handful of Peter Pallat's games and ideas in small editions through his own Edition Perlhuhn designers imprint, giving him the recognition for his longstanding input into our hobby he fully deserved. These games later found their way to publishers like Abacus and the Danish Abra who released wooden versions of some of these. As did this game. "Perlen-Pyramide" appeared with Edition Perlhuhn in 1978 and was republished by the Danish Abra as part of their abstract wooden game series of the latter part of the 1980s. It is hard to get hold of these days.

name: Nuts and Bolts
description: Players attempt to build 3 specific robots by trading for certain robot parts. As parts become scarce, trading becomes more intense. A wrench is thrown into the mix. The player in charge of the wrench decides how many parts will be traded. He also uses the wrench to determine turn order. The first person to build their robots first, wins. Don't forget to do the "Robot" dance when your robot is complete.

name: Images
description:
Exhibited in September 2002 and developed by free jazz artist Peter Brotzmann, Images is a set of 15 cards that questions the boundaries of game as Brotzmann's own music questions the boundaries of form in jazz. Released with the designer's tenet project. Each card is meant to be reacted to slowly, one after the other in a sequence.

Integrates with:

Signs
mechanics: Pattern Building, Simultaneous Action Selection, Storytelling

name: Futebol Business
description:
Football (soccer) game, where the goal is to be as rich as possible. You are the trainer and the manager of your team. For that you buy/sell players and play a soccer game with cards.
The player's names are real.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Thunderbirds Are Go: International Rescue Board Game
description:
"Complete your mission and be the first crew to pilot Thunderbird 2"

A themed kid roll and move game, move your team of three pawns move around the board, to win you be the first to get all three into Thunderbird2. You must either move the full length of the board or get to the Thunderbirds HQ and get launched directly. The evil hood and other events are also waiting to slow you down. The added bonus when you get a crew member to the final square is that you get to launch them into thunderbird2 (which is suspended over the board) via the air blaster.

Contents
Thunderbird 2 model
Base section
Air blaster bellows
Number spinner (1-6)
12 tokens
12 astronaut pawns

Rules
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Atommate
description: AtomMate is a chemistry card game that consists of a deck of 49 playing-size cards with the names, symbols and facts about the elements of the Periodic Table. It is used to play games that involve making chemical compounds. Designed for students aged 10 and up, it is a grow-with-me game. Beginning students learn the names and symbols of the elements. Intermediate students learn to combine the elements to form molecules and compounds. More advanced students can use the cards to enhance their understanding of simple reactions. Instructions for eight easy games, which range in difficulty from easy to complex, are included. There are several games that may be played with these cards. All games are designed for 2 to 4 players.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Trick-taking

name: Squigle
description:
From the game rules:

Squigle is a chess like strategy game for two players. It is played on a specially designed game board of ninety-three squares. Sixteen geometrically shaped pieces (called SQUIGLES) are used in play... four tee and four square that are black in color... four El and four cross that are red in color. Though different in shape, each is mathematically computed to use the same number of squares. The black SQUIGLES are used in play by one player and the red SQUIGLES are used by the opposing player. SQUIGLE is simple in context and yet can be complex in play depending on the skill of the two players.

name: Caffe Primo
description:
From the publisher's website:

The casual game for two to four espresso lovers!

Sit down with a perfectly drawn demitasse, and enjoy an fun and easy game of Caffe Primo with your friends. Add a tile showing chocolate and steamed milk to espresso and score a Mocha. Or, add milk froth instead to score a Macchiato. If you can create multiple beverages in a single play, you score them all! Not sure how to whip up a Con Panna? Not to worry; all of the recipes are displayed on your score card. Caffe Primo is a relaxing game that anyone can play!

name: Bubblegum Crisis: Mega-Tokyo Combat Scuffle
description:
from the front cover art:
"Cyborg Monsters threaten Humanity! WHO can save us?"

description from the inside page:
"It's 2032, and in the mean cyber-streets of Mega-Tokyo, BOOMERS--renegade battle machines, are running rogue. Who can save us? Only the 'Knight Sabers', battle-armored Women 'mercs' with the power to beat any BOOMER. Are YOU ready to join them?"

Consisting of '11'-standup game counters('1'-BOOMER Leader & '5'-BOOMERS with '4'-"Knight Sabers" along with "Leon MacNichol"), the one page "RULES", and a small "game map"-(7 & 1/2-inch by 11-inch), while a 6-sided DIE is required, but NOT supplied with this. There are '4'-"Mission" scenarios included with varying 'Points' awarded for completion of those.
categories: Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Photo-Finish
description:
The thrill of harness racing. 9 exciting races, a daily double, 4 perfectas and the trifecta. Bet with your head not over it. Each race takes less than 5 minutes to run and is controlled by rolling 2 dice. Each race has a tote board showing odds, payoff prices and which horses move for each of the 11 dice combinations(2 through 12). Bet wisely and walk away with the most cash at the end of 9 races.

The game was manufactured in New York and was distributed in Canada and has the Windsor Racetrack sticker so locals could relate to a local harness racing track. Includes 8 horses, tote boards, instructions, two dice, play money, blue chips and racetrack board.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Real Hockey
description:
This Swedish Rod Hockey-like game claims to be the only ice hockey simulating game in the world where players are freely moving, and not tied to predetermined movement paths as in Rod Hockey. The secret is a Swedish patent that allows a player and the metallic stick, that is used to move the figure under the ice, to have a magnetic connection that is not disturbed by other sticks or figures. Dimensions of the plastic carrying case when open/closed 106 x 49,5cm x 6,1cm / 54,5 x 49,5 x 12,2cm, weight 4,1 kg with the cardboard box and 3,7 kg without.

This game is similar to Real Soccer.

name: Back & Forth
description:
Another of the "Games on the Go!" series of games from Patch Products...

From the Publisher:

The Turn Takin’ Silly Sentence Makin’ Game!

Pick a partner, then roll the dice to determine your Target Word. Now, the two of you have to get other players to guess it. The trick is, you and your partner have to take turns, word by word, to form a sentence!

EXAMPLE
Player 1: Monkeys
Player 2: Eat
Player 1: This
Player 2: Yellow
Player 1: Fruit

Target Word: Banana

For 4 to 6 Players

No. 3508
Ages 8 & Up

name: Starfight: Expansion Pack I – ships
description:
From the Publisher's web site:

This is the first expansion to the Beer & Pretzel's Game STARFIGHT. The expansion features four new ships, and new weapon type. This is not a game itself, you need the Starfight© base rules in order to use this expansion. This PDF contains:

A rule sheet
Four ship sheets
Four ship screens
Four ship counters

The new ships are all armed with long-range disintegrators!

Expands:

Starfight
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Curse of the Pharaoh
description:
From the Publisher's web site:

Curse of the Pharaoh is a murder mystery game for 6 to 9 guests and a host - download the free introductory pdf file (40KB).

Join us in Egypt, 1894, and determine the fate of the British Empire in a thrilling evening of mystery and murder. You will be in the middle of the action and it will be up to you to wheel and deal with the other guests. Can you achieve your goals, keep your secrets hidden and survive Curse of the Pharaoh? It's up to you.

At Curse of the Pharaoh you will discover the following:


Who murdered Abu Nazir?
What is the secret of the Eye of Horus?
How did Harry Flinders die?
Who is the sinister 'Mr Big'?
...and what dread secret lies buried in the Pharaoh's tomb, ready to stir once more?


Find out in Curse of the Pharaoh!
The Valley of the Kings, Luxor, Egypt. 23 April 1894. The excavation season will soon be over, as the baking sun makes digging unbearable, but the Oxford University archaeologists lead by Sir William Saville have made a startling discovery. Tonight, the team and their guests prepare to enjoy a slap-up dinner to celebrate the uncovering of the tomb of a previously unknown XVIth Dynasty pharaoh. But while the archaeologists make merry, dark clouds gather, internal tensions among the group burst to the surface and one of the local diggers is brutally murdered.

Curse of the Pharaoh lasts for about four hours and is suited to an evening. It is often played over a meal - a finger buffet if possible to allow guests to circulate and talk in private.

The free introductory pdf file (40 KB) contains an introduction to the game, a list of all the characters, an invitation to send to your guests - plus details of how to buy the game.

Curse of the Pharaoh is one of our more complex and intricately plotted games, and we don't recommend it if you're new to this kind of murder mystery party game. On the other hand, if you're a veteran you should find it highly satisfying!

Home Page: http://www.freeformgames.com/game_details.php?30

name: Way Out West
description:
From the Publisher's web site:

Way out West is a dinner party murder mystery game for 10 to 14 guests and a host.

[NEW! -- this game now includes a FREE special version written for kids and younger teens.]

Join us in a thrilling evening of scheming, intrigue and skulduggery. You will be in the middle of the action and it will be up to you to wheel and deal with the other guests. Can you achieve your goals, keep your secrets hidden and survive Way out West? It's up to you.
It is the spring of 1884. America's west coast is slowly being populated with small towns full of settlers, coming to prospect for precious metals, set up ranches and run dubious saloons. Now the railway is coming! Cactus Gulch is one such small town. Founded 20 years ago, tonight it has a festive air as the townsfolk get set to start their 20th anniversary celebrations. Plus, the railway is coming! However, all is not running smoothly. Land disputes, disreputable card games, strange folk from out of town and hostile Indians are all adding to a tense atmosphere...

Way out West lasts for about four hours and is suited to an evening. It is often played over a meal - a finger buffet if possible to allow guests to circulate and talk in private.

The free introductory pdf file (79 KB) contains an introduction to the game, a list of all the characters, an invitation to send to your guests, a copy of the Cactus Gulch Gazette - plus details of how to buy the game.

Home Page: http://www.freeformgames.com/game_details.php?50

name: A Dead Man's Chest
description:
From the Publisher's web site:

A Dead Man's Chest is a dinner party murder mystery game for 12 to 16 guests and a host.

Join us in a thrilling evening of piracy, intrigue, heroism and skull-duggery. You will be in the middle of the action and it will be up to you to wheel and deal with the other guests. Can you achieve your goals, keep your secrets hidden and survive A Dead Man's Chest? It's up to you.

Two pirate crews descend upon the sleepy Caribbean island of Santo Oloroso - to avenge the death of their former master Captain Flint, or to find and grab his treasure?

"A Dead Man's Chest was a great success. It's well thought out and so kept us all active the whole time. It's very good for getting everyone talking and having fun. None of us had played a mystery before, so we took some time to get started, but once we got going it went well." Keith, Whitby

Old enmities will surface, deals will be made and broken, and some folk will swing from the yard-arm while others receive the dreaded Black Spot, before these affairs are settled, for good or ill.

Will fortune favor the brave? Will faint heart ever win fair lady? How many Pieces of Eight make a Doubloon? Find out all this and more at A Dead Man's Chest.

A Dead Man's Chest lasts for about four hours and is suited to an evening. It is often played over a meal - a finger buffet if possible to allow guests to circulate and talk in private.

The free introductory PDF file (127 KB) contains an introduction to the game, a cast list of all the characters, an invitation to send to your guests - plus details of how to buy the game.

Home Page: http://www.freeformgames.com/game_details.php?19

name: The Final Curtain
description:
From the Publisher's web site:

A theater audience watched in horror last night as Vincent Royle, one of the leading actors of his generation, died horribly on stage...

For 7 to 14 guests!

Tragedy has struck in the normally quiet world of Littledean Theatre. During a performance of the thriller ‘The Final Curtain’ , Vincent Royle, the leading actor, has collapsed to the floor, dead. Amidst the screams and gasps from the audience and cast members the curtain comes down and the investigations begin. It seems that Vincent’s death is not by natural causes and Scotland Yard believe it is murder!

However, in true theatrical style, the show must go on. Vincent’s understudy plays his role the next night and afterwards all the company are called together by the theater manager, Jay Fitzharing.

Click here to download the introduction
(1.4MB PDF file. You will need Adobe Acrobat Reader to view it.)

More than just a boxed version of a murder game, "The Final Curtain" provides you with everything you need to run a fun, participative event for 7 to 14 people. Every guest has a character, with their own objectives and money and/or props, making the game both memorable and enjoyable for all kinds of people.

“The Final Curtain” is a 1920s murder mystery which runs for approximately three hours and welcomes you to the world of Littledean Theatre where artistic temperaments and theatrical secrets go hand in hand with cigarette holders and feather boas.

If you have looked through the introduction, and like what you see, you should buy a password for the main game from our shop

name: Laß die Kirche ins Dorf Erweiterung
description: An expansion for Laß die Kirche ins Dorf. Besides the necessary material for the 5th and 6th player this set includes 12 new fields, some with new events.

name: Murder at the Monster Mash!
description:
It was a cold and eerie All Hallow's Eve as Poppa Rotzi was on the hunt once again. Determined to get the photographs of a lifetime, snapshots never before taken, images of the immortal ones, the infamous "celebrities" of the dark side..... Poppa had finally tracked down the secret location of this year's "Monster Mash!"

As we find ourselves at a remote haunted castle we discover that every vampire, werewolf, and mummy….every goblin and ghost... and every witch and warlock have gathered together for their annual celebration of wickedness. The night was perfect... chilling screams filled the air. Poppa slowly followed the blood curdling melodies coming from the music room. With his camera in hand and the photo of a lifetime just beyond the music room door, he could feel his heart begin to wildly pound with excitement. He was about to make tabloid history... ah but alas, this is where his dream ended for Poppa was never seen alive again. His body was found hanging from the castle gallows….. with a roll of 35 mm film wrapped around his neck... and every last drop of his precious blood, a rare type - ZZ Negative, had been drained from his body!

Come join Count Drakula, Mary Vampirelli Frank N. Stein, Helga von Strudel Wilhelm-Stein, bride of Frank N. Stein, the ghost of Poppa Rotzi, Fang Horrorwitz and the Manhattan Sisters - the Wicked Witch of the Eastside and the Wicked Witch of the Westside. . . just to name a few, and help solve the "Murder at the Monster Mash!"

name: Hochseefischer
description:
The Hochseefischer (Offshore fisherman) board displays North and Baltic Sea with several fishing grounds. Every player has a small plastic "trawler", which looks suspiciously like a ferry boat. The predetermined courses often divide and circle back - the player throws two dice and decides if uses both or only one of them to reach the richest fishing ground (herrings just get him 100M (Mark), most profitable (400M) are redfish).

Manufactured in the socialist/communist German Democratic Republic, the game's objective (make the most money with your ship's payload) seems a little odd, if not "capitalist propaganda".

After the players think they have caught enough fish (there is a limit), they have to return to their home harbors (which can lie in the GDR but also in West-Germany, Scotland, Sweden, Norway, Finland, Denmark, ... - imagine that, until 1989 almost no citizen of the GDR was allowed to travel these countries!). The first players reaching their harbors (there are seven color coded harbors, in contrast to the maximum of six playing pieces) get bonuses. The richest player wins.

The game had no money bills or tokens - instead every player had to write down his progress on separate sheets of paper (not included).

name: Trellis
description:
Trellis is a connection game played on the intersections of a checkered square grid. The problem of deadlocks in connection games on squares grid is resolved by letting each player diagonally connect across the squares which are that player's color.

In the original version of the game the grid was 17x17 (i.e. 16x16 squares) and the game consisted of five sub-games - one for each quadrant of the board and one for the entire board. The object of each sub-game was for White to connect left and right edges and Black to connect top and bottom, and the winner of the game was the player who won the majority of the sub-games. Each player player played one piece a turn.

Later versions of the game were played on a 15x15 board, dropped the sub-game idea, and had players play two pieces per turn in a prescribed relationship to each other.

name: Bunte Kuh
description:
Players roll a die and move their cow across a meadow. Cows eat flowers, but only flowers with the right colors count positive!

Contents: 1 board, 6 cows, 36 colored flowers, 10 white flowers, 1 die

name: Ranged Fun
description:
Ranged Fun is a simple game of vehicular urban shootyness.

The core of the game is based around the four statistics which each unit has. These are reduced as the unit is damaged, so they gradually loose effectiveness before being destroyed. This means there is some bookkeeping involved, but it means the rules a great for quick skirmish games.

The statistics themselves are generalized: each is the combination of many factors the unit may have. For example, all the guns, ammo, rate of fire, targeting efficiency and range are represented by a single number. As the number is reduced through damage, it can represent individual guns being disabled, hampered aiming, ammo destroyed etc.

This may not be that realistic but it speeds gameplay and reduces bookkeeping. This is after all a game of fun - at different ranges
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Word$tock
description:
From the box:

Word$tock -- the unique definitional word game of skill, strategy, and chance --- is designed to increase vocabulary, build word power, and enhance verbal expressive ability in children and adults by utilizing selected word categories and graduated vocabulary levels.

Game Format: Four thousand words at five graduated levels of difficulty, from eight interesting word categories are required to be defined according to one of five versions or variations of Word$tock: Family, Cut-Throat, Cooperative, Solitaire, and Boardless.

Game Objectives: (1) To define correctly words of varying difficulty in specified word categories; (2) to increase knowledge of words and their usage; (3) to stimulate interest in language and learning in general; and (4) to experience FUN in a learning situation.

name: Mission Impossible Game
description: Players start at the four corners of the board and use a spinner to move 1-6 spaces. Players are also able to use Road Block cards and Mission Impossible cards to achieve their objective.

name: Pass the Bag
description:
Pass the Bag is an educational game for three to eight players designed to teach colors, shapes and sizes. Components include a plastic bag with one see-through side, four collecting cards and 40 wooden pieces in five shapes, each in two sizes, with four pieces of each size in red, yellow, blue and green.

With up to four players, each player takes a card. Players take turns holding the bag with the clear side facing away (so the other players can see the pieces inside). The current player selects a piece by touch that matches a piece of the right size and shape on his card. If it is the right color, he places it on his card. The first to fill his card wins.

A variant for any number of players is to place up to three cards in the center of the table. Players try to select by touch a piece that matches any piece on any card. A player who draws one of the right color places it on a card. Otherwise, he keeps the piece. When the bag is empty, the player with the fewest pieces in front of him wins.

Players are encouraged to use words, noises, gestures and expressions to mislead the active player into thinking he is touching the correct (or incorrect) color.

name: Woody Woodpecker's Moon Dash
description: Simple spin-and-move game as Woody Woodpecker races around a board with attractive moon graphics.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Grab a Loop
description:
“The Game that Really Grabs You” -- “You Loved Twister, Now Wait Till You Play Grab a Loop!”

Contents: 6 belts, each holding one each of red, yellow, green, blue, white and black detachable loops; 6 'goal pads.'

To start, players stand in a circle with one foot on their goal pad. You move off your goal pad once the loop-stealing begins. Game involves trying to grab loops of a particular color from your opponents while trying to keep others from stealing yours.

name: Sei Schnell!
description:
Be Quick was Published for Kids and adults from 4 - x Years

to win this game you have to collect the most wooden picture squares at the end of the game.

How to collect?

there are 3 different dice
1 for color
1 for size of the picture
1 for volume full or empty

One player roll all dice, all players have to look for the right picture square (there is one for every dice roll= 24 squares)) an grab it.

If one got it in a previous round, you can steal it, but if you take the wrong square, you have to put one square back in the middle.

Thats all

name: Puffalumps Card Game
description:
From the game box:

The Puffalumps are a lovable family of whimsical baby animals who travel the world in their hot-air balloon.

The family includes a bear cub, a bunny, a cow, a kitten, a mouse and a puppy, who can all be found in this beautifully illustrated jumbo card game.

The game play is easy. Just choose a "bingo" card and try to collect the Puffalumps that are on it. The first player to collect three sets of three matching cards is the winner.

name: Red Dwarf: The Card Game
description: Red Dwarf: The Card Game is a print and play card game based on the BBC sitcom Red Dwarf. Cards are taken directly from the TV show.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: El Enigma de la Pirámide
description:
The players begin their way through the Labyrinth, creating a route for themselves while trying to obstruct the paths of other players.
In the labyrinth which they are creating there are two types of tiles, blue and orange. In the blue ones mummies appear and must be dealt with.
When the players eventually cross the Labyrinth, they begin their way across the Shrine. There, they must confront not only more mummies but also rocks that fall. Both rocks and mummies cause a player to be wounded. The wounds are shown on the cardboard that each player has. When a player receives three wounds, the player dies and is out of the game.
After one reaches the Shrine there is a Treasure. The fist player to get it wins the game.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: Tombstones n' Tumbleweeds
description:
A character driven Western tabletop wargame by Game Werks. Players act out gunfights and other "Old West" scenarios involving a handful of distinct characters in miniature.
This game borrows many mechanics from other games, and thoughtfully blends them together for a easy to follow, yet comprehensive, miniatures game.
Like Mordheim, players are able to advance their characters, and play through many one off, or linked scenarios. Scale is 25mm.
Rulebook is available in print format, as well as a PDF download through RPGNow.com and Wargaming Online.

name: Nazca
description: The lines on the floor of the Nazca Valley in the Peruvian Andes have mystified us since their discovery in the early years of the last century. In this game, you assume the role of a Nazca village leader, managing your villagers and assigning them to tasks. The rewards of these labors are the resources you need to build the legendary Nazca Lines.

name: The Game of Mythology
description:
An instructional card game meant to teach players the names, history, functions, and associations of characters and locations in classical mythology.

The game is played with 76 different cards, which each tell the story of a different mythological figure.

Included is a pronunciation card, a 2-sided instruction card, and a 4 pages "background" by "the compiler": Laura Wheaton Abbot Cooke, Chicago, Ill., March 1884.

The object of the game is to collect the cards into "books" (melds). The one who collects the greatest number of books wins the game.

A book is composed of five specific cards (i.e. Jupiter - the number 1 card- +Saturn + Neptune + Rhea + Ceres). A typical card from the deck shows the name of a god, a small illustration of the god, the names of the four other gods which form a book, and (the largest section) a History, which is not used in game play. Note that the cards are in black and white, so the books lack the modern convenience of color-matching borders.

There are also a couple of "location" cards which have special effects.

name: Opinions
description:
Do you have the gift of the gab? In the tradition of the great orators, players are challenged to express their opinion on hundreds of issues (many of which are hilarious). Enhances creativity and lateral thinking and ideal for anyone wishing to improve their public speaking skills. 3 to 8 players. Ages 8 to adult.

At the heart of the game are the 500 ‘Opinion’ cards. When a player lands on an Opinion Square he or she becomes ‘the Candidate’, draws an Opinion Card and reads it to the other players. The Candidate then selects an opponent from amongst the other players who is now called ‘the Opposition’. The Candidate argues in favor of the Opinion for up to a minute. Players cannot choose sides - they must argue the Opinion as it stands - whether they agree with the statement or not.

The opposing player then argues against the opinion. The remaining players vote for the best argument - not for the argument they agree with - but for the best defended position.

Because the voters are not casting a secret ballot, but have to justify why they think an argument was good or bad, this part of the game can get pretty raucous as players try to convince each other that someone’s argument was absolute balderdash.

Opinions, however, is not just about arguing an opinion. There is a whole story to the game which unfolds as players race for the Presidency. Good and bad press, in the form of the 500 Press Cards, alternatively encourages or plagues players as they seek support for their campaigns. Get arrested in a riot, take a vacation in the Caribbean, rescue a kitten and meet the Queen as your career unfolds (or unwinds!). get caught in compromising situations or rewarded for your service to the community as you work your way to the top.

name: Cry Wolf!
description:
The players are shepherds in medieval Spain seeking to expand and make wise investments in their flocks. Throughout the game they choose from among the roles of Lambing, Market Day, Place Investments, Cry Wolf, Bear, Barter and Stray Sheep.

In lambing, the players can choose to cooperate and help the other shepherds or go it alone, in hopes of receiving a larger return. As the players all cooperate, the predator threat from the wolves and bear is minimized. If any player chooses not to cooperate, then the predator threat grows, usually threatening the non-cooperative players the most.

If the Cry Wolf role is chosen, then the players must (in an order determined by earlier play) roll a twelve-sided die to determine whether their flock has been attacked. Once a flock is attacked, the remaining players’ flocks are safe for the rest of the round. There are many different ways a player can minimize the predator threat to herself.

In order to make investments, a player must sell his sheep (which are also points at the end of the game) and then place the gold received as investments in a Ram, Best Pasture, Market Stand, Guard Dog, Gaita, or Divine Intervention. The largest investment in each of these areas provides advantages throughout the game as well as additional points at the end of the game.

Cry Wolf! uniquely employs a modified “prisoner’s dilemma” in lambing which is integrated with a typically increasing and dynamic predator threat. The majority area control of investments combined with the timing of placement being determined through variable phase order also provides challenging strategic choices.

name: Spirou Safari
description:
Magazine game from Spirou # 1782 "Special Vacances"

Components: Map, 5 paper vehicles (2 Land Rovers, 1 Land Rover pickup, 1 Jeep, 1 Helicopter), several cards (Money, Fuel, Tires, Radios, Animals)

2 Players represent hunters, 1 player has the role of poacher, 2 players represent the Police: jeep and helicopter

Hunters and Poachers hunt the animals
Police: Jeep tries to catch the poacher
Police Helicopter tries to catch the poacher and rescue the hunters from several dangers
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding, Variable Player Powers

name: Viva Zapata
description: Solitaire wargame set in the Mexican Revolution.

name: On The Brink
description:
As taken from the box:

What would you do if you found a creature that you have never seen before? What if you spotted a Tasmanian Tiger??! What can we do about foxes and feral cats? How would you save "Bilby"...The rabbit-eared Bandicoot from extinction?

These situations and more are posed in this fun family game of danger and rescue. As a result, kids will love putting their parents, friends and teachers on the right track of helping to save endangered Australian animals and plants from extinction.

On The Brink...is a game which is fully funded by the Australian Nature Conservation Agency, as a means of enlightening every Australian to the desperate plight of our endangered Australian species.

name: Merchant Prince
description:
Merchant Prince is a fairly simple Monpoly-inspired game - players purchase control of commodities and areas of the world and charge other players for landing on them, with the aim of bankrupting them.

The basic game system is fairly novel. There is a map of the world on which players move ships from port to port (along a track), and a standard track running around the outside of the board on which players move ambassador pieces. On a turn a player rolls the die twice and must use one roll for each piece. Control of commodities is purchased on outer track spaces, but your ship has to be at an appropriate port to do so, establishing a relation between the pieces. Other spaces on the outer track reward or punish players controlling various commodities, and there are also spaces which allow one to become a Merchant Prince controlling one of the six regions of the world (and charge additional "rent" to players).

Another interesting bit is that the game is nominally set in the 25th century, which is used to justify dividing the world into six regions rather than the nations of 1937.

name: Stampede!!!
description:
Oh, no! The barnyard critters have gotten loose! And it's your job to round them up. The objective of the game is to 'round up' the most points worth of critters, which consist of different barnyard animals that vary in point value.
However, the critters move on their own; so you have to direct them to your corral with fences or surround the critter out in the field with fences.
Fences are played by laying down a fence card and placing fences on the 'Ranch' grid. The fence cards have different patterns on them, which limit how fences can be played.
Each player also has one 'Stampede!!!' tile that can be used to cause every critter on the board to move at once and possibly escape. Beware! There are Stampede!!! tiles mixed in with the critters, as well...
Once every critter is either caught or escapes, the game ends and the person with the most points wins.
mechanics: Enclosure, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: The Siege of Draman Del
description:
Draman Del is an ancient fortress city in a mountain pass, the only pass between the west and east lands.

The west is represented by a confederation of kingdoms (Nath, Drakand, Draman, Randrom, Svariji, Land people) formerly known as "Draman". Draman Del is the only fortification against the east people, the barbarians called Zenith; if it should fall, the barbarians may swarm over the west kingdoms.

The Seven Black Generals all host a shard of the soul of the evil god Zadrak and have been asleep for thousands of years but now, unknown to all, they are awakening. One of them, Xishayah, under the name of Kan Zenith, has gathered the nomadic Zenith tribes and is leading them to attack the west. To do this the legendary fortress of Draman Del must fall before General Adran arrives with reinforcements.

The beautiful map shows a top-down view of the Draman Del fortress. The entire city was built using a 3D modeling program and rendered it with textures and shades. On one side are placed some useful charts.The map is 22x17 inches.

Inside The Siege Of Draman Del you will find:

-A set of rules,

-Four mapsheet (game board)

-One countersheet with a total of 287 counters

-Tables and charts

-PDF Version only

name: minizoomerz: Wild Canyons Toolkit
description:
The Wild Canyons Toolkit is an extension to the Print and Play minizoomerz Basic Game. It contains a wide selection of track sections which can be used to design and create your own track layouts and circuits.

The Toolkit introduces separate Finish Lines so that point-to-point races can be created in addition to circuit racing.

Also included are Checkpoint counters so that players can create races with an alternative win condition.

A number of restricted sections add additional variety to the layouts you can build.

The sections include:

- Left and Right starting grids (1-4, 5-8, 9-12)
- 2 Finishing Lines and 8 Checkpoints
- 4 Left and 4 Right tight (90 degree) corners
- 3 Left and 3 Right long (45 degree) curves
- 2 Short, 2 Open (medium) and 2 Long straights
- 1 Split, 1 Chicane, and 2 Restricted sections.
- 1 Left and 1 Right 90 degree corner with center lane blocked
- 2 overpass sections
- 6 Tunnel Entrances/Exits
- 24 assorted rocky obstacles

NOTE: The minizoomerz Basic Game is required to use this product.

Expands:

minizoomerz Basic Game
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Racing, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Phase Order

name: Makili
description:
A memory game. It's not easy to remember an unlikely story card after card: In the snow, a King on a motorcycle saw a spider...

Contains 90 Cards, for ages 5 and up.

name: Bunker Hill
description: Bunker Hill. Battle of the American Revolution. Card Game for 2 players. Separate Decks for the Americans & British. Cards represent Leaders, Troops, Fortifications, Shooting, Strategies, and Blunders. Unique Turn Sequencing results in Multiple possible Victory Conditions and Outcomes.
categories: Age of Reason, American Revolutionary War, Card Game, Educational, Print & Play

name: A Simple Civil War Game Deluxe
description:
A SIMPLE CIVIL WAR GAME DELUXE © 2004
Simple wargame rules for re-fighting the Battle of Gettysburg
Game includes:

16-page rule book
32-page Armies of Gettysburg (Ratings for all regiments and leaders)
50 card movement and firing deck of cards (using Avery Business Card Template 5377)
Full Color cover sheet with “Grand Battery” errata on reverse side
Players Aid sheet, 1- unit record sheet, and 1-sheet of game tables.

This simple tabletop game can be played with any Civil War miniatures you may have, or with something as simple as a set of wooden blocks painted blue and gray.

Combat is based on the “stand” (each stand representing 100 men, or 2 guns and crew)

Movement, combat, and morale are based (and modified) for the levels of command.
In these rules, leaders can make a real difference when units of equal capability and morale meet on the table-top. Card draw effects movement, combat, and time.

The 16-page rule book is easy to learn as the rule is on the left side of the page, and a photo, illustration, or highlight is on the right side of the page to clarify that rule or statement.

The 32-page “armies” booklet that rates each regiment, battery, and officer in the Army of the Potomac and Army of Northern Virginia for their performance during the Battle of Gettysburg and is organized by the UNION Corp or CONFEDERATE Division

1-set of 50 cards that control time, firing, movement, and “special situations” that might occur during a table-top battle. Each cycle of the deck is “1-hour” of game time.

These rules can use any of your existing miniatures, stand size makes no difference as long as both sides are mounted the same. If you do not have miniatures, or do not want to paint miniatures, a product called “ACW Paper Armies” is available for both sides. Individual “stands” show infantry, cavalry, artillery, commanders, wagons, and limbers in full color overhead photos.
categories: American Civil War, Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Tumble Words
description:
Seemingly another game similar to Perquackey or Scrabble Crossword Cubes Game. May predate both of them.

Tumble Words is a word dice game.

name: Pedrek
description:
The Cornish word for 'square', for 2 to many more players where the winner is the first player to complete a circuit of their score card, called their ‘Table card’.

In this game the players men are called Dan.

The sets themselves are made up of either:

a (A) set; Red, Yellow, Blue & Purple cards; Or

a (B) set; Black, White, Green & Brown cards.

Therefore with the adding together of further sets, e.g. 2 (A) sets, this would be a 2 to 4 player game with up to twenty-four Dan per player; or with the adding together of an (A) & a (B) set this would give a game for 2 to 8 players, with up to 12 Dan per player: Etc. There is no limit to how many sets can be added together to make a bigger and bigger game! Cracking. Recommended Ages 9+

name: Pictionary: Salem Holiday
description:
This appears to be a game issued by R.J. Reynolds. The use of Salem Holiday Edition on the box indicates it was sold as a promotional item (I assume with Salem cigarettes).

It comes in a small box (approximately 5 by 7 inches). The following items are included:

- A small gameboard (6 by 9 inches). The gameboard folds out and inside the directions for play are printed. There are also a small number of paper sheets stapled on the interior gameboard.
- A small die
- 4 pawns
- 2 pencils
- A small pack of 20 cards.
publishers: Pictionary, Inc., R.J. Reynolds Tobacco Co.

name: Arclight: Close Encounters in Nearspace
description:
Expansion to the base Arclight game with a focus on the creatures that inhabit space.

Expands:

Arclight

name: Felsberger Arena
description: Felsberger Arena is a fast-action dexterity game played on a hexagonal board. Players flick marbles into the center felted play area to score points and knock opponents' marbles out. Made to the same high quality standards as the rest of the Felsberger lineup.

name: Straßenfest
description:
A computer shop-owner was found in his shop in a pool of blood. Who is the murder from the street party?

All players (4 male, 5 female (+ 1 m/f)) should act out their roles to solve the mystery, because one of the guests is the murderer.

name: Geburtstagsparty
description:
Frida has her birthday party, and her sister gets sick and goes to the bathroom. When they check on her later, she's found in a pool of blood. What's happening here?

All players (9 male, 3 female (+ 1 m/f)) should act out their roles to solve the mystery, because one of the guests is the murderer.

name: Racecraze
description:
"RACECRAZE: A Strategic, Fun-Filled Racing Game!"

A Nascar-like themed racing game from a small publisher. The mechanics of this game are simple: "Qualifying" position is based on random card draw. Each turn, roll three (standard) dice, and optionally roll two more "special dice" (33% +3, 33% -3, 33% take a card). Move your car on the track (16 spaces to 20 spaces around from inside to outside track; no track "choke points") by the total amount. Cards either move car forward, backward, or force player "into the pit" before proceeding. Player turn order is re-ranked each turn by position+laps, and each race (of 5) ends after a predetermined number of laps.

Each player is awarded a number of points at the conclusion of each race based on finishing position. Winner has the most points after the fifth race.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Phase Order

name: Tank Killers
description: Two player card game. Simulates a battle between two tank formations during WW2. The current version of the game has decks for: Germans, British, and Americans circa 1944-5. Rules and card set available at: http://www.angelfire.com/games2/warpspawn/TanK.html
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Print & Play, World War II

name: What's Your AstroStyle?
description:
From the publisher:

Find your star power with What's Your AstroStyle? -, the game that reveals more than just your sign! AstroStyle is a brand created by the AstroTwins, Tali and Ophi, who are the official astrologers for Teen People Magazine. The Twins also wrote the book "AstroStyle", which gives advice for love, life and looking great. The AstroAngels are here to guide you! How well do you know your friends' hopes and dreams for the future? How well do they know yours? With more than a hundred different questions and hundreds of real-life astrological answers, you'll have plenty of chances to reveal fun secrets about your friends and yourself. There's no limit to how much your star power can shine! What's Your AstroStyle? is a game for 3 to 6 players. It has maximum interactivity every turn. Even during another player's turn, each player is fully involved in the action. Contents include 1 Zodiac Board - Game Board, 120 cards based on Love, Life & Style, 6 AstroAngel Tokens, 6 AstroWheels, 6 Answer Booklets, a Rule Sheet, and Game Die.

name: Dribble
description:
Dribble is intended for people aged 5 years old and upwards, and is fun and easy to play. Played with 2 dice and a timer for half time and full time, two players compete against each other to score as many goals as possible.

Throw-ins, Corner Kicks, are all possible and the games quick format lends itself to tournament playing amongst friends.

There are also customized editions for Celtic, Rangers, Aberdeen and Clydebank Football Clubs. The Celtic and Rangers versions are twice the size of the regular edition.
publishers: E. S. Lowe Company Inc., Shannon Boardgames

name: Flip-It Twenty One
description:
Featuring Flip Wilson on the cover, the object of this game is to be the first to reach 21 without going over (ala Blackjack).
Played like regular Blackjack, each player receives one hand card and shoots for their other cards using the spring-loaded ball to hit a blue plastic ball around the roulette-like board. Once a card has been rolled the player marks it with one of the small embossed plastic markers.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Math, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Number, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck

name: Ozette
description:
The game represents whale hunting in the village of Ozette (a prehistoric settlement on the American West Coast which was buried in a mudslide around 1500 A.D. and excavated in the 20th century).

The game mat depicts a whale. Prey stones are placed on the ribs. Players spin an unusual spintop, resulting in 1-3 red and 1-3 blue arrows pointing up. Depending on the number of red arrows, players move their playing pieces from rib to rib and collect prey stones, but only if the hunting stone is showing the whale. The hunting stone can be flipped instead of moving. When all prey has been collected, the player with most prey wins. However, if three blue arrows show six times during the game, the whale wins and the player loses. Depending on which arrow they spin the spintop with, players can influence the outcome of their spin.

name: Sterneföifi
description: A planetarium-themed game where players must identify constellations and other sky objects. The game includes 9 different start disks and components to make it competitive.

name: Kuller Spass
description:
The animals are hungry and are anxious to be fed with the fruits of the magic tree. But be careful: Only the one who shows some skill in this marble game will be able to hit the right fruits with the rolling ball and thus put aside his cards. Two game variants with different degrees of difficulty.

Ages 5 and up.

name: Knights in the Sky
description:
Knights in the Sky
Aerial Combat in the First World War
31 page PDF

Knights in the Sky is a complete miniatures game of WWI air combat. The basic rules allow for relatively large battles with up to a dozen aircraft per side and minimal record keeping.

Optional rules are included which cover; air to ground combat, bombers, observation balloons, Zeppelins, variable pilot quality and experience, and simple campaign system.

Advanced rules which add realism include; advanced maneuvering, deflection shooting, visual spotting, limited ammunition, critical damage, and more...

Also included is the Canvas Falcons aircraft lists, with game stats for 99 different aircraft from 6 different nations.

Download version can be purchased at www.wargamedownloads.com
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I

name: Play Racing
description:
This is a sports car racing game with a variable board of 6 pieces and 4 movable chicanes.

Each player gets a board, where he indicates the speed, the additional gasoline and the brake reserves. The later two things are needed, when a player wants to reduce or amount his speed by more than 1 click on a 1-8 table.

There are also 2 small decks of cards, which are used for pit stops or when a car goes off the track. Some of the cards also influence the condition of the track, so racing gets even harder to master than it is anyway.

The game belongs to a series of 4 square cardboard games from Scandecor Play Racing, Play Olympic, Play Western, Play Pirates. It has funny comic drawings, which could easily be from Jean Jacques Loup, who has made many illustrations for puzzles.

name: Play Ecology
description:
This game belongs to a series of 4 games by Scandecor, which come in a square plastic board (Play Cavalry, Play Balance, Play Ecology and Play Numeric). )

The game is played on a 12x12 board. The game can be played with 2 or 4 players. Half of the players take the industrial pieces, the others the nature pieces. When 2 players play, each has the following 47 pieces:
- 18 roads/rivers, 12 straight and 6 curved
- 24 houses/trees
- 4 factories/volcanoes
- 1 pollutions/earthquakes (disasters)

If playing with 4, each player gets half the pieces and the 2 additional pollution/earthquake tiles are used also.

The game begins with an empty board except the 2 or 4 disaster tiles, which are placed in the corners of the board. The players then start to place roads and rivers on the board and as soon as the first road/river is placed, they can also start to lay down the other pieces. Houses and factories can be placed 1-2 spaces besides the road, trees and volcanoes 1-2 spaces besides the river.

Factories/volcanoes protect the surrounding spaces from being overbuilt by the opponents. These restrictions make it more and more difficult to place the tiles on the board. Winner is the player/party who can lay down all their pieces.

Object of the game is to be the first, who can play all of their pieces.

name: Pandemonium
description:
A free to print game by Patrice Vernet with the same mechanics of Katmandou.

The game is set in medieval Europe, when most of it was suffering from Plague. Your mission is to eradicate the plague, by controlling population movements and by using the expertise of special characters (Inquisitor, Physician, Wizard, etc.).

This game is a more spiced up version of Katmandou.

name: Hank Aaron Baseball Game
description: Players take turns batting and pitching on the game's plastic stadium. The pitchers sends a marble-sized wooden ball down a chute, by rolling, snapping, or spinning the ball, and the batter attempts to hit the ball by spinning a dial that swings the bat. If hit, the ball is sent flying across and out of the stadium. If the pitcher catches the ball, it's an out; if not, the batter gets a single, double, triple, or home run, depending on where the ball left the stadium.

name: Geographisches Lotto
description: Geographisches Lotto is a 19th century parlor game with its base design similar to that of Bingo. The main difference here is that each player either has a map of the eastern or western hemisphere and match numbers to locations on the map instead of the usual bingo grid.
publishers: (Unknown), Baumgärtner's Buchhandlung, Jos. Scholz, Spear's Games

name: Kampf der Gartenzwerge
description:
This game was invented 1977 as "Organisms" by Sid Sackson. It was published in the Swiss newspaper "Tagesanzeiger" on October, 13th. 1982 as "Kampf der Gartenzwerge" and later in Spielbox 3/87 as "Krawall im Paradies".

The game is played on a 9x11 board. Both players have 21 tokens divided among 3 groups (6,7 and 8 pieces per group). Each group has 1 leader, 2 special pieces and 3-5 normal pieces.

Object of the game is to capture 2 of the opposing leaders first.

Movements can be done space by space or by jumping as far as wanted, but the 3 groups should always stay together. Isolated groups member will be flipped over and are blocked until the end of the game. This can be a hard problem, because the normal pieces can only capture opposing people by isolating themselves, while the 9 "better" pieces don't have that restriction.

name: Port-of-Call
description: Players build and operate merchant fleets in Pacific rim trade. Buy, sell and lease freighters and tankers, purchase and bid on cargo contracts for delivery between ports, smuggle, buy and sell maritime insurance. Ships move by die roll. Ending based on profit when all cargo is delivered or upon agreed time limit.

name: Pass
description:
The board looks very similar to a Malefiz-board and it also has barricade-fields.

But in Pass, players start in 2-4 corners of the board and must move to the opposite corner, so that the playing pieces move all in different directions. And the barricades are active only when the first token has landed on it. Passing these barricades in handled differently to Malefiz also.

Anyway, Pass looks more like a Malefiz variant than an absolutely new game.

name: Bienenkönigin
description:
Bienenkönigin (=Queen Bee)includes 2 games that are played on the same board of 11x10 hexes.

Game-1, for 2 players:
Object of the game is the capture of the opposing queen bee.

Game-2, for up to 4 players:
Object of the game is to bring all playing pieces on the opposing side of the board. Captures are not allowed here.

name: Horse Maneuver
description: Another game simulating a day at the races. The ultimate winner of the game is determined by a combination of finishing well in races, betting well against the game, and betting well with your fellow players.

name: Grand Slam
description:
Grand Slam is a card game about Tennis. The are 2 decks of 54 cards, each containing the same number of serve, volley, forehand, backhand, slice and ace cards. All six card types have different values. The points in Gland Slam are counted exactly like in professional Tennis.

One player plays with the red deck, the other with the blue one. The starting player must open the game with an ace or a serve card. An ace gives him the point immediately, a serve gives his opponent the chance to return. A successful return is made, when a player plays a card of equal or higher value. Playing serves and aces when returning is also possible, but several special rules apply then.

name: Clunk-A-Glunk
description:
Played this is a child, so the game's objective is not remembered. It came with a fold out board a la Twister, though not as large. There were numbered/colored Glunk cards that were placed around the board in designated outlined locations.

I only remember it being one of those frenetic games, as players raced to grab certain types of cards using the included one foot+ long wands with a suction cup at the end. Many times the suction wasn't strong enough and frustrated players with smash the wand down on the card numerous times until it would adhere. It was a noisy, chaotic affair, and the gimmick wore off quite fast. Made good for some temporary hysterics though..







"Played this is a child, so the game's objective is not remembered."

Response: This was kind of a Demolition Derby type of Go Fish. There were two sets of cards. Player Cards and Glunk Cards. The Glunk cards were shuffled and placed face down in the middle of a 4' by 4' heavy vinyl sheet. The Player cards were scattered face down around the Glunk cards. Each player would take turns counting 3-2-1 and tuning up a Glunk card and calling the colour of the Glunk pictured. The card would be placed face up on top of the deck.The person turning the card would have to quickly get out of the way as blows would begin raining down as players would try to stick their suction cup tipped Glunk stick to the back of each card in rapid succession, looking for a colour match. No hands allowed, except to replace the non-matching cards face down on the sheet. When a match was found the player would call it, keep the card and claim the Glunk card to form a pair. The winner was the player with the most pairs at the end of play.

(Note:*My brother's solution to cards not sticking well, was to LICK the suction cup in between cards. I ended up with many bruises resulting from being bashed while playing. The force of the blows was quite something, seeing as the sticks were made of thick, rigid plastic. Within two years all were broken and the vinyl sheet - white when turned over, became my thrifty mother's picnic table cloth.)

name: Så det kan låta: Junior
description: The children's version of the game Så det kan låta. The object of the game is for the active player to imitate a sound or act out a charade. If his/her team mates can guess the correct answer the team takes one step closer to the finish line.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Trivia

name: Revolte
description:
Only 40 copies of this early "Spiele-aus-Timbuktu"-game where published by the author himself. It contains 36 playing-cards and the rules (German only).
Players try to gain victory points playing their cards representing the old cities of France in the 17th century.

name: Flat Out War
description: Freeware generic miniature wargaming system. Built with 20-25mm miniatures in mind, but is built for any time period.

name: The Little Mermaid Under the Sea Card Game
description:
This is a pattern recognition and matching game with a theme from the Disney The Little Mermaid film. Three sets of rules are included so that children of different ages can play.

The basic game for ages three and up is a simple, non-competitive matching game. In this game, players turn over clue cards with colors or shapes and then attempt to find a playing piece that matches the color or shape (purple starfish, green seashells, and yellow sand dollars) and add it to their playing board. The second game, for ages four and up is similar, but it introduces wild cards and has a competitive element. The third game, for ages five and up, challenges players to create an original, repeating pattern using the shapes.

No reading required. Chunky playing pieces, easy for little hands to hold.

(This is not the same game as the 1994 Parker Brothers 'The Little Mermaid Under the Sea Card Game'.)
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection

name: Rembrandt en Tijdgenoten
description:
Rembrandt en Tijdgenoten is a trivia game. Players move on the board and answer questions in 6 different categories. Rules are simple:

You've answered the question correct:
- you score a "+ chip" of the category's color
- if you already have a "+ chip" of that category, you can flip one of your opponents "+ chip" over to a "- chip"
- if you have a "- chip" for that category, you can turn it over to a "+ chip"

You've answered the question wrong:
- you don't get a "+ chip"
- if you have a "+ chip" for that category, you'll flip it over to a "- chip"

Game ends when one player has 6 chips (either + or -). The player with the most "+ chips" wins.

name: Unter Uns
description:
This game is the graduation work of a student of visual communication in Weimar.
In the game players assume the roles of illegal immigrants trying to acquire a German passport while living from illegal work and evading the police.

Home Page: http://www.keinpasskeinspass.de/

name: The Adventures of Popeye
description: Object: Four different Popeye Adventures are illustrated on the board. The object of play is for the player to win each of the four adventures by "eating" enough cans of spinach (wooden green discs), which are won in the "Grand Spinach Lottery". After winning an adventure the player receives an Adventure Card. The first player to win all four Adventure Cards and get to the finish is the winner of the game. The game has a typical spinner, cards, wooden "cans of spinach", and a "Grand Spinach Lottery" which is a box that you shake tokens out of, the tokens state how many cans of spinach you will receive.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Het Grote Bosatlas Spel
description:
Het Grote Bosatlas Spel is a game based on the Bosatlas, the biggest Atlas producer in The Netherlands.

The goal is to answer questions about the six continents in 4 categories: geography, nature, people and records. (In a passport you will score your points and where on the map you've scored them.) ?? If you don't know the answer, you can look it up in the mini Atlas. But only if you're the owner of the Atlas at that time or are capable of taking the Atlas from someone else.

Contents: 1 70x50 cm board, 1 mini-atlas, 1 die, 6 pawns, 1 booklet with 50 passports, 1 pencil, 138 cards, rules.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Flagships
description:
Flagships is a naval strategy game requiring resolute and decisive action. To defeat the enemy, you must either sink his flagship or immobilize his fleet.

Flagships has one basic rule: ships may be sunk only by a superior force, either a single more powerful ship
attacking by right or a joint force of ships, one of equal power to the target ship attacking with the support of any other member of its fleet. No ship may ever sink a more powerful ship, even during group action.

Each player commands a fleet of nine warships: one flagship, two frigates, two sloops and four corvettes.
Only a flagship may sink the enemy flagship, and only if it has the required support.
Frigates, dominant in an open sea, can lose maneuverability as the fleets close for action.
Sloops, wayward and easily outflanked, can also be unreliable in support.
Corvettes, vulnerable at the outset, can determine the outcome of the closest battle.

Playing on a hexagonal shaped hex board of 37 hexagons, the two fleets are disposed as if sailing from opposite directions;
Each player in turn moves one piece in any permitted direction, moving from one hexagon to the next across their common dividing line. Lateral movements (north/south) are called movements abeam. Diagonal movements are called movements forward or astern

The various ships move as follows:
Flagship One space forward or astern or any number of spaces abeam
Frigate Any number of spaces forward, astern or abeam
Sloop Any number of spaces forward or astern, never abeam
Corvette Any number of spaces in an arc around any adjacent space

Sinking:
i) A ship is sunk by any enemy ship of superior power moving onto its space, and is removed from the board.

(ii) A ship may be sunk by any enemy ship of equal power moving onto its space, provided the
attacking ship is supported by another member of its fleet, the support ship being in a position
adjacent to the target vessel and on course to occupy its space.

(iii) No ship may sink a vessel of superior power, even during group action.

Support:
Support is only provided by vessels lying adjacent to the target vessel. Sloops may not support an attack while lying abeam of the target because they may neither move nor attack in that direction. Flagships may not support whilst disabled.

Disabling:
A flagship is disabled by any two enemy ships being in spaces adjacent to its own (even by sloops in positions abeam). Whilst disabled, a flagship may neither move, attack nor support an attack by any other vessel, but may form part of a cordon disabling the opposing flagship.

Winning:
Sink the enemy flagship or leave your opponent with no legal move.

name: Battlestandard Ancient Rules
description:
A set of miniature wargame rules for the Ancient period, encompassing early Greeks through Norman Conquest.

"Battlestandard" was designed as a moderate-complexity treatment of Ancient warfare fitting between some recent, simpler Ancients systems and the highly detailed systems that have been hobby staples for many years.

The basing system is compatible with most existing Ancients rule systems, allowing players to use these rules without changing already-based armies. Army lists are provided for Philippian/Alexandran Macedonian; Late Achaemenid Persian; Roman Marian/Caesarian; Celtic/Gallic Barbarian; Norman Conquest; and Late Saxon armies.

Turn sequence is determined through an initiative system. Armor and Shield protection is key to defining defensive capabilities. Multiple categories of mounted, infantry and missile troops are distinguished. Leadership is represented through several tiers of Leaders.

The system is primarily geared for 25/28mm figures. Conversion instructions are included for 15mm and 40mm armies. Armies usually compose from 100 to 300 figures per side; the standard system figure ratio is 1?40.

Army statistics, including General characteristics, War Machine attributes and Army List Templates are recorded on copies of forms provided with the rules. Referral to these lists suffice for determining combat and morale outcomes in a game. Games featuring armies of this size can be completed in three to four hours once the system is understood.

Publisher website: www.battlestandard.com

name: Rattled
description:
RATTLED is the fast paced word search game that will have you shakin' and makin words! Grab the handle, shake it up, then put it down. Both players (or teams) race to make the longest word possible from the eight scrambled letters.

The player who thinks he or she has found the longest word shouts it out and starts the timer. The opposing player has 30 seconds to find a longer word. The player who finds the longest word scores the point for the round. The first player to 20 points wins!
publishers: Educational Insights, Éveil & Jeux, Learning Resources

name: Goldfix
description:
From the Rules:

Goldfix is an exciting, fast moving, business game based on the South African gold mining industry. Players use their skill, nerve and luck to acquire leases, develop goldmines, produce gold and speculate in the bullion and share markets to raise capital. However, the gold price is continually fluctuating in a bull (up) or bear (down) market. Players also have to contend with taxes, debt, broker's fees, share takeover and possible bankruptcy as they compete in a corporate battle to gain control of South Africa's second largest mining house "Genmin".
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Commodity Speculation, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Freez!
description:
Dice Strategy Game for 2 Players!

Description and Object of Game: Freez! is a new, original two-player strategy game with similarities to both Chess and Go. It is played on a special 64 square mat, with 20 pieces. Dice are used as the playing pieces, but after the roll to determine who starts, luck is not a feature of the game.

In Freez!, pieces are attacked and frozen; the frozen pieces remain on the board for the rest of the game. The object is to freeze your opponent's pieces. Alternatively, you can win by trapping your opponent behind a wall of frozen pieces. The game is won when a player completes a wall separating all of their live pieces from all of the opponent's live pieces, or the opponent cannot make a legal move, or a player freezes the opponent's last live piece. Playing time is 20 minutes to 2 hours.

name: Speed Baseball
description:
All the thrills of baseball without leaving your house.

Speed Baseball uses a combination of cards and a die roll to determine the outcome of each hitter. As well as normal play each person has 3 special actions a game that they can take which have a huge affect on the game. These actions range from pinch hitting to a double play.

The game be downloaded for free from the publishers official website http://www.spunkychicken.com/baseball.shtml

name: Words Worth
description:
The game contains 100 letter tiles, 50 category tiles, a large 'bucket' to hold the tiles, and a 60 second sand timer.

Before each round, players draw 8 letter tiles from the bucket. A category is drawn.

Players have 60 seconds to form a word from their tiles. A bonus is awarded if the word relates to the category drawn.

A typical game last 10 rounds.

name: Tectonic
description:
The face of the world has changed. Earthquakes have leveled most of the planet. To survive a new form of Architecture called Tectonics has been developed allowing entire cities to be built on hovering pads to avoid the stress and destruction of the almost constant earthquakes and tectonic shift.

The Goal of Tectonic is to be the first player to build a floating city or colony with a population of 12 or more.

Each turn players perform two separate but unique actions trying to collect random City Tiles. Each of these tiles represents a city structure worth 1-3 points. Players may also play cards to add "resident" tokens to their city to build the total population (and score) of the city.

Several cards allow the players to perform espionage either destroying or stealing city tiles and/or residents. (Remember the cities float now.)

Mixed in are world effect cards like an Earthquake and Armageddon which can change the entire face of the Earth (and the game) once again.

This is a NON collectible game consisting of 35 random city tiles, 10 resident tokens, and 104 full color playing cards.

name: Chasse Patate
description: Chasse Patate is a cycling game designed by Eric Le Bras, who lives in La Rochelle, France. The dimensions of the board are 59x41cms. There are 5 teams of each 2 cyclists (plastic figures). Tactics- and bad luck card plus 4 dice make the game complete. Each team has one climber and one rouleur. Movement is done by rolling the dice but the cards also have an influence.
