The board is divided into different étappe sections and has an interesting mechanism to determine time differences for the overall classifying. Winner is the player whose team does best for the overall lead.
mechanics: Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Saga
description:
From the rules

"Each [player represents a] raider [who] sets out with 500 men and his aim is to take Perth. Before taking Perth, he must hold at least 6 other settlements and must enter Perth with no fewer than 100 men."

Movement on a hex map and hazards on the map will cause you to lose men on your way. You can raid other players settlements.

name: Sing-Sing
description:
This Heyne travel game is played on a 4-piece board showing 2x3 prisons and several traveling ways between them.

Each player has 18 tokens in 3 colors. The 6 tokens per color form 3 "tribes" of tokens, where one is the master tribe.

Object of the game is to capture all 6 tokens of the opposing master tribe. This is not so easy, because captured tokens can be rescued from the prisons and brought back into the game. Another problem is, that the tokens can only enter the game by throwing a 6. A player on the way to losing the game can therefore try to inhibit tokens from his master tribe to enter the game!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Criterium
description: This game was developed with the support of the French cycling association. Criterium is a cycling game that is not dice controlled, tactics is important, this is done by playing cards from the hand. There are 15 cyclists (very nice miniatures) in the game, before the game it has to be decided how many will be used by each player (normally 3 per player, in case of 15 people playing this game, each will have just 1 cyclist). The board is double sided (69x51cm.) with at one site a racecourse and on the other side an oval indoor track. There are 189 cards that determine the value (ranging from 7 to 16) of the movement, 27 bonus cards, 17 risk cards, 6 metro cards and 25 replenishing cards. The winner is the player who's cyclist reaches the longest distance after the finish line after the final turn. Bonus cards are very important in this game, it allows cyclists to stay in the wheel of another cyclist and as a result exploit the slipstream. The game consists of basic and advanced rules.

name: Banco
description:
This card game consists of a huge deck of 132 cards and 25 letter chips.
100 of the 132 cards are coupons, showing a letter and a value of 10 or 50. The rest of the deck has 32 cards of 11 different types, such as gold-barrels, bank robbers, guards, policemen and others.

Before the game starts, 3 letter chips are drawn; they form the combination, which is needed to open the bank safe.

During the game, the players play cards on 3 different places of the table: their own playing area, the bank-safe or around the bank-safe (to protect the safe).

The game ends, when the bank safe is either opened with the correct combination or successfully robbed by a bank robber.

Points are calculated to determine the winner - the bank safe is likely to give the most points, but cards on the playing areas and cards still in the hands are calculated also.

name: Wehrmacht: Fifth Blitzkrieg
description:
In Wehrmacht: Fifth Blitzkrieg players can play WWII in the East from May 1942 to March 1943. The battle of Kharkov of May 1942, Operation Blue on June 1942 or the Russian counterattack of November 1942 leading to the Stalingrad encirclement and von Manstein counter stoke of February-March 1943 are all included.

It includes two 59 x 84 cm map stretching from Leningrad (included) to the Caucasus (the whole Eastern Front). The map covers , except the Finnish front and a bit of the most Western parts of the Soviet Union which were overrun in Summer 1941 at the beginning of Operation Barbarossa.
The map and rules (22 pages) are printed in Japanese.
720 counters: units are divisions for the Germans and Axis allies plus separate tiger tank companies; tank and infantry armies, tank, mechanized and cavalry corps for the Soviets.

For one or two players.
Playing time: about eight hours.

(BGG user's description)

name: Feeeeed Meeeee
description:
From the Rules:
"Feeeeed Meeeee is the most popular game among the Big Trolls. The rules are simple: Big Trolls sit around a table loaded with food.. but they are not allowed to eat! As time passes, they get hungrier and hungrier. The first Big Troll that can´t control his hunger and starts to eat the food is the loser"

You must collect sets of food cards. This is done by rolling 2 dice to determine how many action points you get for the turn. With these action points you move to different storage places and collect food.

The Swedish edition, called Glufs Glufs, was included in issue 5/2006 of the Swedish games magazine Fenix.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Brazil
description:
Abstract strategy game created for the "Learn & Play a New Game" tournament held during FirenzeGioca (="FlorencePlays") 2006

It is freely downloadable.

name: NetResults
description:
The Synestructics company sold the building toy of the same name, which was a set of hollow rods of various lengths and connectors with various numbers of prongs, which together could be combined to build three-dimensional frameworks.

NetResults is a game which uses Synestructic pieces - one type of connector and one size of rod (in three colors). Starting with a simple triangle, players take turns adding pieces to a common structure, attempting to complete polygons of any shape. Points are awarded for the polygons based on the number of edges, with extra points awarded for completing polygons that use pieces from other players.

The game can be played by 2-3 players as individuals and 4 or 6 players in teams of two.

name: Chicky Picky
description:
What a hullabaloo in the chicken coop! The little chickens are very hungry and the mother hens are looking for earthworms to feed them. Which chicken gets full the fastest?

This game won the Deutscher Lernspiel-preis in 2004.

name: Rainbow Woods
description: You are trying to create a path through your opponent's trees. To remove a tree, you roll a die and choose one of your opponent's trees. If it is a match, the tree gets removed. If it is not a match, the tree gets turned back around. The first person to make a path from the center of the board to the opponent's edge wins the game. A tree with a bear on it is not removable, and a tree with a rainbow can be removed with any die roll.

name: Cartel
description:
Object of game: to conquer or bankrupt opponents. Game looks like a take on monopoly with military strategy and combat.

The game is a sort of cross between Monopoly and a light wargame like Risk. The board has an outer track, very Monopoly like, but a map occupies the space inside. It is divided into 16 countries, forming color groups known as Cartels. As you go around, you buy up "countries" to charge other players "port fees". The countries can have their industry developed by buying Factories (e.g. houses/hotels). The Community Chest/Chance cards have been replaced by Spot Market and Commodity Exchange decks, which are used to simulate a player's speculating on the spot market. A key difference from Monopoly is that you can build up your military and use it as an alternate means of conquest.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Fall of the Weimar Republic
description:
Card Game simulating Politics in Germany between the two World Wars. 7 Historical Political Factions Available.

Depicts the causes of Nationalism and Anarchy in pre-war Germany plus the tactics used by the Nazis to gain power. Players share a common deck and attempt to obtain legitimacy and control of certain sections of the populace (Intelligentsia, Labor Unions). Common deck Cards allow you to build up the organization (propaganda capacity) of your party and damage your rivals. Win by having the most Power when the Republic Finally collapses.

name: Invincible
description:
A 32-page expansion to the CyborGladiators game that features new aliens, new cybernetics, new arena hazards, new weapons, new pre-generated gladiators as well as rules for bloodsports and battling beasts of both earthly and extraterrestrial nature.

Expands:

CyborGladiators

name: Battle of the Three Emperors
description: 2 Player Common deck card Game. Simulation of the Battle of Austerlitz 1805. Play as Napoleon or the Coalition. Control 3 Fronts and reduce your opponents Morale to zero to win. Cards depict Leaders, Units, Strategies, and Events. A glorious victory awaits you! A complete copy of the rules is available for free.
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Napoleonic, Print & Play

name: Operation Solstice
description: This game is also called Operation Sonnenwende. 200 DTP counters The game depicts the 11Pz SS Army attack in Pomerania on February 15, 1945. This offensive had the purpose of hitting th weaker Russian Northern flank of the future drive to Berlin which was strung out a very long front ending on the Oder river. The offensive was planned by Heinz Guderian. The Germans were able to assemble 200 tanks unknown to the Russians, achieved tactical surprise and managed to reach one of its objective, the city of Arnswalde and to save the encircled garrison, but they did not advance much further. (batallion, regiment size units with some companies for the Germans, regiment, and brigade size units for the Russians), one 11 X 17 map.

name: The Pennant Yacht Race Game
description: Dice based Yacht racing game. The game board has 6 lanes one for each color. Arrows indicate the locations that player may switch lanes in an attempt to block the other players.

name: Algernon Pulls it Off
description: Miniature wargame rules for Great War air combat. These rules are a development of the Too Fat Lardies Second World War air combat rules Bag the Hun.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: Aussie Rules Super Earthling Abductor
description: This game is based upon the players drawing a mission card, and attempting to complete this mission. Players do not reveal their missions to the other players. There are 3 different classes of ships to choose from. Players can see what their opponents ships are, and narrow down the potential mission of their opponent. As the game progresses, players attempt to block their opponents from reaching their goals. The goal may be to abduct different types of earthlings, or destroying cities (to name a few). On each city, there is a marker that the player flips to determine how many cards to pull, or perhaps damage to the ship. An additional angle is not all of the cards drawn are not necessarily good, so, it may not always be advantageous to be on a city that is giving a lot of cards.

name: Tactic Blue
description:
Tactic Blue is a compilation of 6 abstract games by 3 different authors. All of the games are played on a two-sided board, using the hex-grid or square-grid side.


Accasta
Abande
Attangle
Attraktion
Alva
International Checkers


Accasta, Abande, Attangle are games designed by Dieter Stein and are part of his stacking games trilogy. Attraktion, a game by Jaroslav Cichocki, uses pull force (attraction) in movement to form a winning condition. Alva, designed by Alvydas Jakeliunas, is like a souped-up version of checkers. The last game included is a classic International Checkers. Apparently the gameboard and components happened to be compatible. Some of the games were previously published on websites.

name: Regatta
description: Spin and Move boat racing game.

name: Firepower Pass
description: Designed to easily control 15-20 capital ships a side (which can be 4-5 squadrons), while concentrating on squadron level tactics, Firepower Pass uses a unique command oriented system that allows units to attack as individual ships (i.e. at a tactical level) yet defend and maneuver in 3D as squadrons. Octagonal 3D movement tiles easily and elegantly depict the 2D vector of 3D movement.

name: Reefer City
description:
Be the king of Pot, Hash and 'Shrooms. You roll dice and progress around the board. In the process you 'make connections' wherein you can buy and sell illegal commodities.
The Market Level for commodity prices will vary as the game goes on. Be the first to accumulate $20,000 and you win!
publishers: Game Makers, Inc. (II), Reef City Productions

name: Robber Barons of the Gilded Age
description: Some superficial similarities to Monopoly such as Board shape and pawn movement. Players build up Wealth and Economic Resources. However to win, you have to have the best Legacy, which means you must convert some of that wealth into philanthropy before the game ends. Monopolies are based on 20 different Industries including Oil, Banking, Railroads, Steel, etc. Players can own holdings within the same space. Not complex but it does offer lots of period flavor. A complete copy of the rules are available for free at: http://www.angelfire.com/games2/warpspawn/RBGA.html
categories: American West, Economic, Post-Napoleonic, Print & Play, Trains

name: Labans spökspel
description:
Swedish children´s game featuring spöket Laban (Little ghost Godfrey) from the books by Inger and Lasse Sandberg. The friendly ghost must practice some ghostly sounds. Players move around the board, representing the castle, and collect and imitate various sounds. The winner is the player who is the first to reach the Ghost Room and make the Great Ghostly Bawl.

Contents:
26 sound markers with drawings of cats, owls, cars etc.
4 key markers
4 pawns with plastic stands
Die
Rules

name: Aglagla
description: A simple roll and move game for children (5+ years). This game is based on Snakes and Ladders, but with players controlling penguins in the Arctic instead.

name: Hell & Fateful decisions
description:
Rules for company to battalion level, from 1919 to 1999.

Scales

1 vehicle, 1 infantry squad (circa 10 men)
1" = 50 meters
No stated timescale

A simple set of miniatures rules which places the emphasis strongly on the motivation of troops rather than the technical capabilities of their weapons.
This is essentially the big brother of "Hell by Daylight" the author's 20th century skirmish rules set.

Rules cover; troop types, terrain, visibility, night, command and orders, small arms fire, states of being, casualties and morale, indirect fire, close combat, anti tank fire, anti aircraft fire, aircraft, mines, snipers and booby traps.

At the end there is a very short variant "Kalashnikov Tribal" for combats between 3rd world warlords and the like. Finally there are three scenarios; one in Vietnam, one in Afghanistan (Soviet occupation era), and one in Italy (1944).
categories: Fighting, Korean War, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Vietnam War, Wargame, World War II

name: Secret Forest
description: A guessing game for 2 to 6 players with playing board, 48 picture cards, wooden rabbit counter and instructions. The picture cards feature objects from the Secret Forest board. One player takes a card and the players have 15 questions to guess what it is. A family game designed to develop logical reasoning.

name: Battleshift
description:
Battleshift is a game of mass starship combat. It is being designed to allow players to run hundreds of ships on the table in a two to three hour game. Ships have enough detail to make them interesting and distinctive, but not so much that they each need record sheets to keep track of them. This should allow small games of a dozen ships per side to be played as enjoyably and effectively as giant games.

Battleshift refers to starships shifting in and out of hyperspace during the battle. Though it is a staple of sci-fi, few games really let players use hyperspace tactically. With good planning, squadrons and taskforces can leap from one part of the battle to another, escaping from certain destruction or closing a trap on an enemy taskforce.

Battleshift also features a suppression system, which causes squadrons to lose accuracy as they take fire.

Fleets are bought at the start of the game, based on a point cost system. Fleets are composed of Taskforces, which are in turn composed of Squadrons. Each squadron may have 1 - 7 ships that must stay within 6” of each other.

name: Ration Board
description:
A game created in 1943 in order to help Americans deal with the fact that rationing of goods was needed in order to win the war!

Players start at home and then travel along a much traveled route applying for Ration Cards at the Ration Board. Players are liable to meet many obstacles along the way. Luck and skill are important factors in players acquiring their ration cards. Numerous helpful as well as hindering elements that make the trip a most exciting experience can to a certain degree be determined by the players themselves but others are left to chance. As is natural during the present emergency, the players will take these encounters in stride like the good American he/she is.

Each time around the board the person stops at a different Ration Board and tries to acquire a different ration card by fulfilling different requirements; BUTTER roll a 5 or a DOUBLE, SUGAR roll an 8 or a 2 or a 12 etc. The first player to acquire 5 ration cards and return home is the winner.

The game board is a road winding through the countryside and suburbs to a city where the Ration Boards are stationed and then back again to home.

Additional info: Contained 8 wooden car pawns and 2 wooden dice, and was "item number 432" from Jayline Manufacturing Company of Philadelphia, PA.

name: Revelation
description:
Revelation is a straight-forward trivia game that contains 5000 questions and answers about the Bible. It includes the following categories of questions: Events and Places, People, Things, Numbers, and Memory.

Contents: A Playing board, one die, eight colored tokens, forty-eight color coded discs, and a book of questions.

The winner is the person/group that first disposes of 6 color-coded discs by placing them on the corresponding color-coded symbols on the board; this occurs when the corresponding question is answered correctly.

name: Palatin
description: Palatin - a hot game for vigilant observers, at least this is what the box says about the game. Basically it's roll and move to get your pieces through the "labyrinth" first. Also contains rules for team play.

name: Fairy Meat: WAR
description:
From the Publisher's website:

In War, Straightedge Fairies, Greater Fae, Goblikes and Imps enter the scene! With amber armor, sunflower bombs, pistols, rifles and other dangerous weapons, the Straightedges bring squad-based war to the fairies! Goblike mercenaries strengthen this army (when they're not busy eating it), and Imps and Greater Fae likewise enjoy the new state of fairy affairs. After all, in the old days, it was frowned upon to senselessly riddle another fairy with a hail of arrows!

Even better, this 32-page Fairy Meat supplement features new rules for establishing ongoing campaigns! With skill points, your fairies can learn as they kill and become tougher than ever! This book also includes rules for Fame, new printable warband and squad sheets, and much more! Although War is fully compatible with Fairy Meat, it is a supplemental rulebook only. Unless you already know how to play, you will need the Fairy Meat core rulebook in order to play effectively.

Expands:

Fairy Meat
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Blood Diamonds
description:
Blood Diamonds pits west African warlords against one another for control of rich diamond fields. Your goal is to acquire as many diamonds as you can and sell them for the highest profits.

This game was an entry to the Mesomorph 1 Piecepack Contest, and is designed for a "SixPack" (1½ piecepacks).

name: Chameleon
description:
The players jointly build the board, one tile at a time, as the game progresses. Each time a player places a tile that forms a group of three or four like-colored tiles, that player receives points, with the quantity depending on the group configuration and on chameleon (pawn) positions on the board. If a player places a tile adjacent to a wasp (die), he loses points to the wasp’s owner. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

This game was an entry to the Mesomorph 1 Piecepack Contest, and is designed for a standard piecepack with a four seasons expansion and pawn saucers.

name: Schwerpunkt: Divisional Level WWII Fast Play Rules 1920-1950
description:
Schwerpuckt is a set of miniature rules for playing large WW2 battles. Each stand is 1 company, 1"=200 yards, and 1 turn = 30 minutes. Most mechanics use single die rolls with situational modifiers to speed play.

Rules are 20 pages, and cover the usual fire, movement, and morale rules. Army lists and scenarios will be posted on the Web site:

http://www.freewebs.com/tommiatkins/

More info from the Web site:

World War 2 is a incredibly well supported area as regards wargame rules...... for skirmish or company level rules.

What's out there for Brigade and above? Spearhead? (Rolls around on floor in stitches, gasp! gasp!) Yeah there is a set of rules that reflects reality! Oooh yes please!

What's actually needed, is a set of rules that reflects the kind of decisions that a commander at this level takes.

Is their command attacking or defending, are they dispersed or concentrated? What is the units strengths and weaknesses? The penetration ability of a Sherman easy eight vs a PzKpfw IV's rear plate is NOT on his mind.

That his light tank battalion are probing towards the objective supported by a Elite mechanized infantry battalion will be.

SCHWERPUNKT

Schwerepunkte is different to any WW2 miniatures rules in this respect. It takes you to the Divisional HQ and asks you to make the kind of decisions that will spell victory or defeat. Dice are involved, good equipment will help, but it's YOUR actions that will carry or lose the day.

The usual tommiatkins "one roll of a D6" settles combat, players will be in command of Infantry, Engineers, Artillery, Armour, Signallers,(get those unused radio cars out)and Military police etc. Anti-Aircraft fulfills its true role instead of being "another Anti-tank" unit.

Schwerpunkt will allow 6 players to fight Arnhem with every unit involved in a full day with time to get totally hammered on cheap red wine afterwards. Two players can do Arras 1940 to a conclusion in 20 minutes.

So, If your fed up with rolling a hundred dice in FOW, and knowing that if you roll higher than your opponent then you've won, keep your eyes open for Schwerpunkt.

So what do we have?

Heres whats in already:
1) Minefields
2) Signals
3) Military Police & Kommisar's
4) Night Fighting
5) Squadron level air support, Air recon and AAA
6) Harrassing artillery fire & on-call fire missions
7) Bridging and demolition
8) Detached company support units
9) Ambushes approach and surprise fire
10) Combined arms supporting
11) Engineers
12) Formation's (I.E: Concentrated/Dispersed/All Round defense/ Deploying)
13) Airborne assault and Marines
14) Real Reconnaissance

name: Shrinkwords
description:
Given a wacky story as context, fill in each blank by removing a letter from the previous word and rearranging what is left.

Example from box:
To bring off this party trick requires great PANACHE. You have to eat a XXXXXX while balanacing a XXXXX nut on the XXXX of your neck and a XXX on your nose.

With the answers being canape, pecan, nape and pea.

name: Tactex
description: Tactex is a hexagonal version of Piet Hein's classic TacTix which was a two-dimensional generalization of Nim. In Tac Tix, players take turns removing pieces away from a rectangular grid. In Tactex, pieces are placed on a five by five by five hexagonally-tiled field and are removed from one of the nine vertical columns or eighteen diagonal rows.

name: Fortress Illinois
description:
This is a very amusing send up of Fortress America. Set in 2024, Fortress Illinois supposes a future in which Iowa, Missouri, Indiana, and Wisconsin invade Illinois. The game begins when Illinois destroys Gary, Indiana without warning. (Can you really blame them?) President Bobby Knight III leads the four states, which join forces and invade the Flatlanders in an effort to wipe out their leader, Governor Daley IV.

The game consists of a map and cards. It can not be played without owning Fortress America. This game was packed with and offered free with purchase Magic & Tactics' Axis & Allies homage, Middle East Combat.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: DJ Mole
description:
(from box description)

Take part in the funniest Phone-in ever!

DJ Mole "King of Rock 'n' Roll" is the radio host with the most in this groovy poptastic quiz!

Match the pictures on your cards to DJ Mole's silly sound-bites in a race to win his radio quiz"

Just listen to the sound-bites the DJ plays. If any of your cards has instruments or sounds from the clip, then hit those phones!! For every correct phone-in you lose a card. Get rid of all your cards first and you'll be the WINNER BABY!

name: The Game of Society
description: A pretty complicated game considering it was produced in 1874. The Game of Society is written on 55 cards (22 red (virtues), 13 black (vices) and 20 green (neutral) in 4 letters A B C D which stand for Angles, Britons, Celts and Danes the principle components of the Anglo-Saxon race. 2,4, or 6 can play. If played in teams the teams are either 2 or 3 person teams. Deal 7 cards to each player. The top card, called the Providence is then turned over. This determines trumps for that round. if the trump does not suit the person to the left of the dealer that person may say "NOLO" in which case two more cards are dealt to each player and a second Providence card is turned over which must remain trumps for the round, if the card does suit the player he calls "VOLO" and the hand begins. The cards have names on them that relate to their rank in the suit. Names like Benevolence, Christian, Industry, Press, Villain, Education, Intemperance, Virtues, Man in Home, Woman in home, Debt etc. These cards have value which determines which card wins the trick. Some cards reduce the value of a trick and therefore wind up resulting in a negative valued trick. Virtue cards are positive and vice cards are negatively valued, neutrals are just that and are worth zero. Object is to be the first to get to 7 points.

name: Operation Market Garden
description: "Operation Market-Garden: Paratroops across the Rhine, September 1944" is the full title. Game features 400 colorful back printed die-cut counters and a beautiful four section interlocking, mounted, map board. Has two identical back printed player aid charts featuring terrain and combat resolution charts. One off board movement chart for the German player allows units to come on the map board. One glossy 35 page rule book (in Japanese). Best at two players though team play is fun too especially amongst the Allied player. Game features seven scenarios as well as the campaign game. From Hobby Japan Co., Ltd. No. 103 is the stock number.
mechanics: Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Paper-and-Pencil, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Rickety Raft
description:
APPROXIMATE BOX SIZE: 20.5" x 12.5" x 3"

The gameboard is a blue-aqua 12" square plastic bowl ('pond') about 2.5" deep with individual scoring tracks along each side lip. The 'pond' is filled with water before play and a plastic/polystyrene circular raft 5" wide is placed on the surface. The raft is divided into two different colored sections along its axis of symmetry. Each player starts with six (three pairs of) men of varying shape and weight (and value: 5 or 10 points) which must be placed on the raft without causing it to overbalance.

Players use a spinner to determine which particular weighted man must be placed on which side of the floating circular raft. When one player causes the raft to overbalance, their opponents receive points based on the number and type of their own men who were on the raft at that time.

The first player to reach fifty points is the winner.

name: Winemakers: El juego del vino
description:
Winemakers allows the players to live the experience to become an owner of a wine cellar. In Winemakers, players acquire property in wine-growing zones (at Mendoza, Argentina), select and plant the suitable wine varieties, harvest, elaborate, bottle, label and place wines in national and international markets

Each player has a million wine dollars, the official coinage in the game, and with that money must travel the 5 circles that represents the process of wine making.
If your dice-rolls are not good you can have earth tremors, ice storms, or even go bankrupt.

And most important: You play it drinking a bottle of wine!

Game contains:

1 gameboard
2 dice
74 cards of properties and values
8 corks of different colors
74 cards of events
12 millions wine dollars


Home Page: http://www.eljuegodelvino.com/
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Chippawa: The Birth of the United States Army
description:
DTP wargame that covers the battle at Chippawa during the War of 1812 at the battalion-level. Based on the system that appeared in the earlier Vimeiro game by the same game designer.

Components:
178 die-cut counters
1 11 x 17-inch color map
2 info card sheets
Rulebook
Charts

name: Das Agenten-Comptoir
description:
In 'Counter Agents' you control 12 agents with which you must infiltrate your opponent's base. Basically, you must get one of your pieces on to your opponent's baseline. When moving, it is important to keep 'in contact' with a piece on your own baseline. Contact is maintained by being in a direct, unobstructed line with the piece or via lines of contact with your other pieces. If you 'lose contact' your agent can be bribed by your opponent if he can make a similar line of contact between the piece and a piece in his own base. A bribed piece cannot be moved by the enemy but can be used in his own lines of contact. If you regain contact with a bribed agent you can re-take control of him.

The game bears some similarities to Rob Abbott's 'Epaminondas' (in the layout and victory conditions) and to Sid Sackson's 'Network' (in the way lines of contact are maintained).

name: MOHO
description:
MOHO was a free cut and play game in issue 31 of Jeux sur un Plateau. (It even came with its own cut and fold box.)

The game itself is a scrabble like word game, where players add cards to cards already on the table.

The difference is that the each card has 1 of 8 different symbols. Each symbol represents 1 to 4 letters of the alphabet depending on its orientation.

The back thematic story is of the expedition by Professor Nemo Sogol where he discovers this unique alphabet.

name: Salamis
description:
This is a monster DTP wargame. It has individual ships for the whole battle and separate counters for the Marines on board (some 2,300 counters in total) and 28 maps, which come out at about 8 by 4 feet. Victory is determined when one side's fleets have all broken. This involves a dice roll for each fleet each turn matched to how many triremes they have lost.

Only 50 copies were produced.

name: War in the Pampas
description:
February of 1994. The Argentine military retakes power through a coup de etat. The Argentine civil government manages to find exile in neighboring Uruguay. The Argentine military issues an ultimatum to Uruguay to hand over the fugitives or face an invasion. Brazil guarantees the defense of Uruguay in the event of a Argentine invasion. Argentina launches a surprise invasion of Uruguay precipitating a counter attack from the Brazilians thus starting the war of the Pampas.

The war of the Pampas is a Brazilian designed Alternate history wargame of a war between Argentina vs. Uruguay and Brazil in an alternate early 90s.

The game consists of 169 counters representing the military forces of Argentina, Brazil and Uruguay. 12 pages of rules. and special rules such as artillery, air support and more...

name: Smallville Board Game
description:
Smallville is a copyrighted property. This is an unauthorised, unofficial game produced merely for the entertainment of fans and is non-profit making.

"Agents of the evil Kryptonian known as Zod have arrived on Earth and have disguised themselves as Kal-El of Krypton, who goes by the identity of Clark Kent. The agents of Zod each want to convince Clark Kent’s friends and family that THEY are the real Clark. In doing this the agents of Zod can banish the real Clark (Kal-El) and with him gone, the Earth will be theirs"

In this FREE 'Print and Play' board game players will battle villains to save their friends and earn valuable respect points.

All the files you need to play are available on the NEW and improved website below.

http://mmboardgames.page.tl/
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play

name: Baptism of Fire II: WW2 to Modern Skirmish Gaming
description:
From the publisher's Website

Baptism of Fire II, BoF II, is a complete revision and overhaul of the original ‘Baptism of Fire: World War II Skirmish Wargaming’ (BoF) and ‘Wild Fire’ (WF) miniature wargames. The result will seem familiar to players of these first games, but in many of the mechanisms and details there has been change.

The changes have made for standardized systems, which are both easy to teach and remember in play. The text is clearer with more and better examples. It has also been organized by a group of players like yourself, so hopefully finding information in a hurry will be easier.

BoF II continues as a leading miniature skirmish game, for games of Squads up to reinforced Platoon level from WW2 to present day. It includes rules for all manner of infantry and vehicle operations. There are additional optional rules to further enhance the gaming experience.

The rules are aimed to create as authentic a battlefield experience as possible, players are encouraged to utilize real life battlefield strategies and tactics as these will give great success.

BoF II continues using a similar system as Baptism of Fire and Wild Fire to create a highly interactive, unpredictable, yet the player can try and exert a degree of control and planning to implement his strategies and tactics.
categories: Book, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Vietnam War, Wargame, World War II

name: DarkeStorme
description:
From Publisher:
The fantastical world of Valon in the Dark Age. The time of swords and decaying Empires when Wylde Magicke ruled. Monsters and mayhem fit for champions. A world consumed by war and plunder where you as a Hero lead your band on a quest for riches and fame. Will the fates shine on you?

DarkeStorme has an easily learned 2D6 based rules system that is scenario driven with a normal game lasting between one and two hours in play. The game book features full rules, no need for expansions, create and advance your characters and creatures using a full points and species generation system. Also a full magic system and all needed rules for Chariots, Artillery and Monsters. Generate scenarios, the terrain and even the weather!

name: Lace Wars: Wargaming the Period 1660-1720
description:
Subtitle: "Wargaming the period 1660-1720"

Three different scale rules with mostly common mechanics.

Scale/One Unit/One inch:
1. Skirmish/Company (80-150 men)/25yd
2. Tactical/Battalion (400-600 men)/50yd
3. Grand/Brigade (3-5 battalions)/100yd

In addition to the rules, the book contains cardstock Play sheets, color-printed period Flags , 2 army lists (War of Spanish Succession France and Britain) and 5 scenarios. Complexity is not high, Play sheets consists of just 3 pages for all three scales. Typical play area is 6' x 4'.

There are 4 scenario books published.
1: Wars of Glory [Louis XIV's War of Devolution, Dutch & Rhineland Wars]
2: Wars of Grand Alliance [War of G.A., War in Ireland, Tangiers Campaign and Monmouth Rebellion]
3: The Great Northern & Turkish Wars
4: Wars of the Spanish Succession
Each scenario book contains several army lists, more than a dozen scenarios and color Flags.
categories: Age of Reason, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Memorise
description:
To score points by memorizing details from and answering questions about a passage of text.

Players, either individually or in teams are invited into the world of some of the greatest storytellers ever. Short extracts from famous and classic novels take you into their world of thrills, chills, comedy and romance - but can you memorize what you have read?

If you can, and can answer your questions correctly, you'll score points. From simple "either/or" questions to real tests of memory and recall. Memorise is an exciting and tense battle of wit and nerve. Tactics and strategy may allow you to secure valuable bonus points.

This game is simple to learn and, unlike most question and answer games, requires no previous knowledge. All the answers are in the passage that you have just read - but can you memorise them?.

This game also gives you a flavor of the contents of a number of famous and classic novels.

Note: Memorise appears to be a reprint of Echelon. The text and question cards are exactly the same, but a cheaper board and playing pieces have been substituted.

name: Rodeo-opoly
description:
from the publishers:

Giddy up Cowboys and Cowgirls! Here’s a game celebratin’ the rodeo! Whether you enjoy rodeo from the back of a bull, the saddle of a bronc, or viewed on the wide screen in the comfort of your easy chair, you’ll have a whole mess a’ fun playin’ Rodeo-opoly with family and friends! Full of rodeo humor and rodeo facts, Rodeo-opoly is a big “Hats Off” to this fascinatin’ sport and way of life. Buy favorite rodeo properties. Increase rent on your properties by collecting Scores and trading them in for Gold Buckles. It’s all fun and games until you’re sent to Bucked Off, then you’re skiddin’ on your back side across the board and you’re out for three turns!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Stellar Poker
description:
Stellar Poker is a cardgame for 2+ players.
As you can imagine by the name, it’s a “variant” of the classic game named Poker so the only thing you need to play is the dedicated deck available for free download (http://www.webalice.it/alecrespi/html/warpspawn.html) or in the files section.
All the game is set in the space and the usual numeration of the traditional cards is replaced by the sequence of the planets in the solar system.

There are 13 different cards for each seed:
1 Sun
2 Mercury Internal Planet
3 Venus Internal Planet
4 Earth Internal Planet
5 Moon Internal Planet
6 Mars Internal Planet
7 Asteroids
8 Jupiter External Planet
9 Saturn External Planet
10 Uranus External Planet
11 Neptune External Planet
12 Pluto External Planet
13 Comets
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: Piratas del Caribe
description:
Save yourself if you can! You will need all your ability and a little bit of luck to stay onboard the ship, when the wind makes your boat stagger and the waves cover it over. Roll the dice and try to maintain the load in perfect balance. If your pirate remains in the boat when all the others have fallen into the water, you are the winner.

Components:

1 pirate ship
18 pirates
7 coins
1 dice
rulebook

name: TV Week TV Trivia Board game
description:
From the publisher's website:

Are you a TV Trivia expert? Test you knowledge of TV and you're friends with the TV Week TV Trivia Board game. The ultimate for TV lovers. It includes questions in 5 categories on all you're favourite TV shows, old and new, as well as Australia's glamour television event, the TV Week Logie awards.

The TV Week Gold Logie Award goes to...
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: They Died For Glory
description:
Grand tactical miniature rules for the Franco-Prussian War, 1870-71.
1 turn = 15 minutes, 1 inch = 50 yard, 1 figure = 50 men.
Fairly orthodox rules.

11 Scenarios (using period maps to show scenario setups).
Complete Order of Battles for both sides (1 August 1870).

Scenarios and OBs cover the Imperial phase only. French Republican Units are covered in optional rules.
publishers: Quantum Printing, The Courier Publishing Co., Inc.

name: Ironside Game
description: A roll-and-move game based on the popular TV show of the same name.

name: Munnrapp
description:
(From the box - translated from Norwegian):

Solve challenges and find the word hidden in "the Mystic Wheel"!


Are you fast in the mouth and quick thinking?
Then come up with 10 words that rhyme with CAT.
You only have 1 minute, so get going!




Do you like to mind twisting and puzzles?
Then you surely figure out what a IANSR is, when we tell you the letters are shuffled.
Here's a clue - it may be eaten!




How about your vocabulary?
Name 5 words that contains GAME.





Do you throw fancy words around?
Then you surely know what an Equilibrist is?





Or are you good with phrases?
Which words are missing here? Cat ... your ...



Munnrapp demands both a quick head, imagination and luck. If you add a bit of strategy along the way, you have a good chance to find "the Mystic Word" first and win the game.

Munnrapp is suitable for 2-4 players, 10 years up. It may be played in teams if more than 4 wants to play.

name: Roger Maris Action Baseball
description: Game consists of metal field with spring-action bat and marble. Wood frame reads "Roger Maris" at top. Maris facsimile signature appears at bottom left. One player "pitches" the ball and the other attempts to hit it. Many holes are located in the outfield and when the ball falls into one of those holes the result of the play is determined.

name: Storm over the Taiwan Strait
description:
This game is the first in the Oriental Flagship Company's "This is No Drill" series. The theme is a future Mainland Chinese invasion of Taiwan.

The game includes 125 counters, a foamboard-mounted map with a hexagonal grid superimposed on a satellite photo of Taiwan, a novel sliding Combat Resolution Table (instead of dice), a counter tray, and a very nice box.

The game, sometimes described as the first Mainland Chinese board wargame, is closely based on Ty Bomba's When Dragons Fight.
publishers: Oriental Flagship (BEIJING) International Technology CO., LTD

name: Take My Word
description: The game consists of 108 letter cards valued 1-4 and a simple board (a score pad is also included). Players start with a hand of 7 cards, then take turns adding one card to the front or back of the word being formed on the board, drawing a new card from the deck at the end of each turn. A player who cannot add a card that makes a legal word fragment must "Take My Word" and put all the played cards into a penalty stack. The game ends when the deck runs out; lowest score wins.

name: Match of the Day Electronic Trivia Game
description:
Show your skill by answering football trivia questions & be the highest scoring team when full time is reached & the referee's whistle blows.

Includes over 1700 questions & an Electronic scoreboard !

name: All About Minneapolis
description:
Listed in American Games #4181. 1981, Cities & Town, Board Game.

Limited Edition promotional board game from 1981 about the city of Minneapolis.
Each player visits the shops and businesses and collects cards as detailed on their shopping list.
The first to return home to their residence with the travel cards for all the locations on their list, wins.

The locations and streets are real businesses in Minneapolis, and this game was made as a promotional item for the area.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection
publishers: All About Town, Inc., Windsor Publications

name: Car 54, Where are You?
description: Listed in American Games, #4206. 1961, TV, Law, Board game.

name: CULLODEN: The Last of The '45
description:
Culloden on Drummossie Moor, April 16, 1746. William Augustus, Duke of Cumberland, leads a new Government army loyal to the House of Hannover north to face Prince Charles Edward Stuart's fierce Highlanders. Bonnie Prince Charlie's Scots have been victorious in every encounter with the forces of the 'German Usurper' George II since the Jacobite flag of rebellion was raised at Glen Coe on August 19, 1745. Now as the fog lifts off the sodden moorland at 11 AM, 4500 claymore-armed clansmen, most having not eaten nor slept in a day and a half, stand to as the red-coated ranks of 9000 troops of the government army march into battle formations. As the cannon of both sides unleash grapeshot, the Duke orders his troops forward, confident in their fire discipline. The Scots, outnumbered 2 to 1 in bodies but possessing the spirit of a lion in every Celtic breast, launch themselves into an attack borne by their battle ferocity that has been victorious in every contest of arms for the past year. The throne of Britain has just been laid on the scales of combat.

Culloden contains:
one 11" by 17" map;
140 die-cut backprinted 1/2" counters;
8 pages of rules and scenarios;
Just Plain Wargames Folio Format
Cover Artwork by Adrian George
publishers: (Looking for a publisher), Pacific Rim Publishing

name: Pedal Power
description:
Pedal Power is a unique game based on bicycle touring. The goal of Pedal Power is to be the bicyclist who has the most fun. The player with the most Joy Points at the end of the game had the most fun and is the winner of the game!

Players plan their trips and attend bicycle events (Weekend and Week Long Tours as well as Expeditions) for experiences and fun. Experiences earn the players Joy Points. The players will enjoy Bed & Breakfast, Camping, Mountain Biking, Tandem and Winery experiences throughout the game. Experiences can be had many times as joy and fun are not confined to one trip.

The players will also experience days where skies are blue, roads are smooth and enjoy tail winds. Other days players will be chased by dogs, have headwinds, rough roads, flat tires and thunderstorms. During the game players will be able to take all these Joy and Misery experiences and 'Tell A Story' and earn Joy points.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Under The Sea
description: This a Candyland variant taking place ... Under The Sea! The game includes 1 colorful game board, 4 pawns, 8 sea location cards, and 1 spinner. Pawn are moved via the spinner, but moving to the next color the spinner indicates. Certain colored space allow you to draw a card, which will send you ahead or back to a certain special locations, such as The Sunken Treasure Ship, or Rainbow Reef.

name: Hearsay
description:
The aim of Hearsay is to identify personalities, television programs, movies and songs from the "Hearsay" clues.

This is a great game in which you can hear what you're saying but not necessarily say what you are hearing!
Clues lead to answers which individually are merely words - put them together however and they take on a whole new meaning!

Even if you solve the clues within the time limit you might still fail to put them together and give the correct solution. What is certain is that your opponents will revel in your struggle and doubtless be highly amused at you being so near but so far- particularly if they have already worked it out!

An example of a hearsay round is...

The category is T.V.

Your clues are:-
1) Scottish word for small.
2) Fondness or affection
3) Castle
4) Female Sheep
5) Sound of the 14th letter.

The answers to the clues are:-
Wee - Love - Fort - "N".
Answer = "Wheel of Fortune".

Game Contents:
1 x playing board
200 x "Hearsay" Cards (800 x Challenges)
40 x Category Tiles
1 x sixty-second timer
1 x Cone
6 x Pawns
1 x Dice
1 x Score Pad
2 x Note Pads
6 x Pencils
1 x Rules Sheet

The game was exclusively developed and designed for WH Smith by Games Talk. Developed by Christopher Shaw and Kari Nightingale.
categories: Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia, Word Game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Sadie! The AlphaDeck Word Game
description:
Sadie! is a Word game, that use a special deck of 69 cards, with the 26 Latin letters on them, as well as values ranging from 0 to 10.

In Sadie! each player is dealt 6 cards and the rest of the cards form 7 piles, in the center of the table. The top card of each pile is flipped face-up and play begins. On his turn, a player creates a word or passes. A created word must be entirely from the face-up cards or include at most one card from his hand. A word must be at least four letters long. After making a word the cards used are collected and discarded and the Word's value is added to that player's score. Then new cards are turned up and the next player's turn begins.
Also included are rules for Sadie's Solitaire, Letterummy, Word-Poker, Five-Card AlphaDeck Stud, Seven-Card AlphaDeck Stud and Alphacasino.

Sadie! comes with a board capable of scoring up to 259 points for 4 players, using a unit peg and ten peg system. The four peg colors are white, yellow, red and blue (2 of each). The board also has capacity to hold the seven piles used in Sadie!.

name: Foolmania
description:
FOOLMANIA:
"The cutthroat stock market game that teaches you nothing."

From the box cover:

"Foolmania is the card game that rewards strategic play, creative thinking, backstabbing, and a little bit of good fortune. Your goal is to build a first-rate investment portfolio by acquiring great companies and avoiding lousy ones.

"Each turn, players buy from a group of available investments. Players may also play Jester cards, allowing them to change the mechanics of the game. Foolmania is simple and easy to learn, but the endless combinations of cards make Foolmania engaging, challenging, often laugh-out-loud funny, and highly re-playable.

"Are you the smartest, most creative, or perhaps the luckiest investor in your group? Play Foolmania and find out!"

Foolmania was published privately by The Motley Fool in 2001, and distributed as a gift to customers. Copies remain extant, and indeed, continue to be played with enjoyment.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Stock Holding

name: Gear Shift
description:
An obscure board game take on Formula One released by small games publisher Actiongable during the late 70's. Gear Shift has a unique and in many ways quite realistic take on F1 racing, where the movements are generally dictated not by dice, but by on-track position.

So - unusually for a car-racing board game - this is very much a strategy game, with the element of chance coming in the form of hazard squares which require a roll from the 36-item hazard list on the inside of the box lid.

Only one track comes with the game - Brands Hatch - but the rule book claims that Actiongable were going to make further tracks available. One can only assume that disappointing sales scuppered those plans.

A hidden gem of the genre.

name: Ulysses S. Grant's Early Battles
description:
'Grant's Early Battles is a collection of games about Ulysses S. Grant's first experience of command. Three battles are covered - Belmont, Fort Donelson and Shiloh. Belmont, and the single day scenarios of Fort Donelson and Shiloh can be played in two to four hours. The two larger battles also have multi-day actions which make for a challenging 6 to 8 hour games. Various alternative history options are included.

Components:

Three 11"x17" Game Maps (one for each battle)
432 9/16" pieces, representing historical combat units and unit or formation status markers.
Two Game Reference cards for each player
28 page color booklet of rules, play illustrations and detailed historical commentary.
1 Six-sided Die

name: Barnstormer
description:
This is essentially the same game as the later and much more popular game Loopin' Louie. However, it appears that this game pre-dates Loopin' Louie by almost 25 years!

The front of the box proclaims, "Up and down and around the old plane goes. Where she hits nobody knows."

The game was manufactured by Marx Games which appears to be a division of Marx Toys as the two companies used a similar font in their logos.

The game uses thick horizontal discs instead of thinner vertically placed discs used in Loopin' Louie. The discs appear to be very similar to the game pieces for the more popular game Trivial Pursuit with the interior of these discs divided into four sections instead of six.

name: You Run The Zoo!
description:
Imagine yourself in charge of a zoo! What animals would you select? Would you focus on building a zoo that your visitors enjoyed the most, or would you prefer running the biggest zoo with all the large animal enclosures? In "You Run the Zoo!" you will be competing with other zoos to create the most magnificent zoo using limited resources within a fixed amount of time.

"You Run the Zoo!" is a fast-playing game, where limited options create challenging decisions, making every move an important one. A zoo has 16 available enclosures. You will fill them in with animals of your choice, gaining points along the way for the rarity of the animal, and gaining secret points for "visitor cards" requiring certain animals or arrangements at your zoo.

name: Ki Shogi
description:
A modern variation of the traditional Japanese form of chess played on an infinite "board" with cubical pieces.

Pieces are introduced to the field adjacent to their King and must remain so lest they become "stranded" and thus lost. A piece promotes every time it moves or captures, flipping to the opposite face or to the next most powerful form, respectively.

The objective, as in most forms of chess, is to checkmate the opponent's king.

name: Skribble Dash
description:
From the publisher's website:

Can you draw an egg? How about the sun? Then YOU can play Skribble Dash!™

Roll the die to choose the category. The harder the clue the more points you and the guesser will earn.

This crazy fun doodling game will keep EVERYONE on their toes as EVERYONE tries to guess what the player is drawing!

name: Togg
description:
Another tactical game from Swiss publisher Arte Ludens.
The goal of this abstract game with wooden tiles is to reach the opposite side with your own tiles. But on your way there your tiles may be blocked. You can defend yourself by blocking opposite tiles. You just put yours onto them but avoid running out of tiles.

name: WrestleFest
description:
WrestleFest is a table-top dice rolling game with mini's, based on wrestling. It has over 150 wrestlers, managers, and officials, and 9 match types. Match types include, Cage, Barbed Wire, and Ladder. WrestleFest also includes 8 different ring types.

'WrestleFest's minis, rings, and more are all print-and-play! Download from the WrestleFest website.

Home Page: http://www.wrestlefestonline.com/

name: Draft Choice: Choix Au Repechage
description: The idea behind this game is to simulate the NHL draft and the operation of a team. 6 teams are included in the game Toronto, Philadelphia, Minnesota, Boston, Montreal and New York. the game board is an ice rink with a superimposed chart on it. the chart has 6 columns each representing one of the teams in the game. Object of the game is to allow players to participate in a number of transactions that occur in the NHL such as drafting players at the start of the season and then making changes to the team during the season. There are two decks of cards included, one titled "Starting Team Player Cards" and the other "Standard Player Cards" A third deck is titled "Vouchers" and is used in relation to draft choices. Object is to wind up with the best possible team.

name: Software Process Improvement Game
description: Also known as SPIG, developed at Carnegie Mellon University as a means of instructing good engineering practices in software design. Said to be Monopoly-like.

name: Chassepot and Needlegun
description: Chassepot and Needlegun is a set of wargames rules for fighting battles of the Franco - Prussian War in miniature. The standard units are the infantry battalion, cavalry regiment and artillery battery. The rules also include supplemental material for the Crimean War, Franco - Austrian War, Austro - Prussian War, and the Mexican War.
publishers: And That's The Way It Was..., Frontier Miniatures

name: Hallo, Taxi!
description:
The boards shows a tangle of streets and 40 specially marked points on these streets, which correspond to the 40-card order deck that is used for play. Besides that order deck, there is also a 12-card deck with 4 different penalty cards.

When a player has drawn an order, he must try to reach the end point within a certain number a turns, which is determined by the throw of a die. The shortest distance to the end point is the amount of chips that can be won, but failing to succeed results in loosing further turns as well as loosing chips.

Before throwing the die, each player must choose among 4 risk levels: the higher the level, the farther can his move go, but the higher is also the risk to be punished with a penalty card.

The game ends after a previously fixed amount of time and the player with the most chips is the winner.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Employee of the Week
description:
"Play as a sleazy computer salesman in this insanely, chaotic card/ dexterity game of sensory overload."

In Employee of the Week, there are seven working days during which the players must collect the necessary parts to fulfill as many orders as possible.

Employee of the Week is self-published by Toronto-based Steve Lefort (creator of Treasure Quest), and can be played at various Toronto Area Boardgaming Society (www.tabsonline.net) gatherings.

Employee of the Week is currently slated for a 4th Quarter 2007 release.

name: Occult Wars
description:
Ever fancied gaming "Buffy: The Vampire Slayer", "Underworld" or even "Constantine"?

Occult Wars is a set of miniature wargaming rules that allow you to game in a horror setting, playing as a group of humans hunting horrific monsters.

But that's not all.

You can also play as a group of Vampires, Werewolves, or even Angelic or Demonic Beings. Each faction has it's own abilities and unique weaknesses

The game rules and for 'skirmish' style games, using up to 10 or so miniatures a side. And includes campaign rules for character enhancement between encounters.

Additionally, Occult Wars contains many additions that allow you to play the game as an RPG-Lite style campaign.

name: Auf hoher See
description:
The game is played on 7×7 grid game board. The 4 corner spaces are the home harbours, where the players start with their ship. The 45 other spaces form the sea, which is filled with 45 wave chips. A red(!) pirate ship is placed in the middle of the board.

The harbours contain 3 of 4 merchandise with prices that are defined by a dice throw at the beginning of the game. A player can load his ship with up to 2 merchandise and must deliver them in another harbour than they are bought from.

Each turn, a player must make 3 moves: 1 wave, his ship and the pirate ship. Waves are stacked upon each other, ships cannot jump over other ships. Movement is determined by the number of waves and playing pieces on the starting space, but a wave must be left back at every crossed space during a move. In this way, the waves shift constantly over the sea giving a really floating sea feeling.

Winner is the player who has earned a previously fixed amount of gold pieces the first.

name: Pension Munter
description:
The game "Pension Mutter" was included in Spielbox 1/90 as part of the "Spiel im Heft/Game in the zine" series.

The board depicts a hotel lobby showing the reception desk and the key cabinet. The game can be played with a 32-card Skat deck or with 32 self made cards: 11 hotel key cards, 11 guests, 8 move cards, 1 concierge and 1 guest book card.

Object of the game is to find the correct (hidden) keys for the 11 guests that will enter the lobby during the game. The concierge (Jack of Hearts) acts as steering element for the keys. The guests will appear randomly from the 19 card deck containing the move and guest cards.

Winner is the player who has collected the highest number or guest/key pairs.

name: Wellen-Halma
description:
The game "Wellen-Halma" was included in Spielbox 4/90 as part of the "Spiel im Heft/Game in the zine" series. It is played on a 8x8 grid board with 5 specially marked 2x2 squares.

Each player has 12 playing pieces which are placed on the board at fix positions. 4 neutral pieces complete the starting position with all 28 pieces on the board.

Object of the game is to either occupy one of the five 2x2 squares with his own pieces or form one of 2 special pentagons anywhere on the board. The neutral pieces can be counted as own pieces by both players.

Each turn, a player can move a playing piece either 1-2 straight spaces in one of the 8 directions or by making a chess-knights move.

The name "Wellen-Halma" (="Wave checkers") comes from what follows after a playing piece has moved: all adjacent playing pieces are moved away for 1 space, if the are not protected by pieces behind them!
mechanics: Area Movement, Area-Impulse, Enclosure, Grid Movement

name: Der Pate
description:
The game "Der Pate" was included in Spielbox 6/90 as part of the "Spiel im Heft/Game in the zine" series.

The board is played on a large hexagon containing 184 hexes. 6 home cities in the middle circle are surrounded by 2 x 6 free cities in the outer and inner part of the board.

30 playing pieces and 1 special piece (the "pate") per player are provided, but at the beginning of the game, each player just starts with 2 pieces and his pate in one of the 6 home cities.

Depending on the number of players, 26-72 playing cards are needed for play (one suit=13 cards per player). These cards enable to buy new playing pieces, make movements or assassination attempts and help to protect your pate.

The pate is a figure that you must protect from being lost, because otherwise, you have to start from the beginning, with just the 2+1 playing pieces. The best protection would be to marry him and to get a son, who can replace your pate if needed!

As soon as the first player occupies 7 of the 12 free cities, the game is over and he is declared the winner.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting

name: Le Mystere des Masques
description:
The year is 1791 and France continues its headlong slide into a state of anarchy and terror. As the starving French people riot openly in the blood-stained streets, leaders of the country's various rival factions continue to quarrel and fight in their attempts to seize outright control.

Meanwhile, following their desperate failed attempt to flee the country, the deeply unpopular King Louis 16th and his equally despised wife, Marie Antoinette, have been taken to the Bastille fortress, where they are now being held under guard, "for their own safety".

In a brave attempt to inject a small degree of normality back into the royal couple's lives, Cardinal Richelieu decides to continue as planned, with the Masked Ball he was intending to hold in honor of the King’s 40th birthday - albeit on a much smaller scale, with just the jail’s four current residents, and each of their guests, in attendance.

However, with just an hour to go until the party begins, Richelieu is horrified to discover King's lifeless body lying slumped across his dressing room table, having been poisoned with some form of deadly toxin!
Confusion soon replaces shock, however, when a second ‘living and breathing’ Louis then appears, identical to the first, and claims that he is the real king, and that the corpse is obviously just a ridiculous impostor!

With the future of France at stake, Richelieu realizes he must enlist the help of all those attending the ball, if he is to catch his killer and unravel this mystery, before news of the terrible events escapes, and a panic takes hold of the city!

name: Mayday
description:
Mayday is a variant of Werewolf set in the holiday of Mayday. Players are assigned characters of various iconic figures from the socialist revolutions. However, there are three traitors, the forces of Greed, Power and Corruption, trying to bring down the revolution from within. Players must root out the traitors and exile them to Siberia while avoiding that selfsame fate.

Mayday is a print and play game that can be downloaded at http://interactivitiesink.com/larps/mayday/.
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Horror, Murder/Mystery, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Rock-Paper-Scissors, Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: ZAGA: Oyunların Efendisi
description: This game is designed after a very famous TV show "Zaga", which was presented by Okan Bayulgen in Turkish televisions. In this game players roll a dice and move along the sections of the board. In the trivia section, they have to answer questions about the 80's. In the "persons" section, players have to mimic the persons, described in the card. In the "bet" section, players have to bet on the subject, written on the card for one of the players. In the Zaga-live section, one of the players become a guest for the Zaga show. A very exiting and wonderful game. It has lots of jokes and humor for the taste of Turkish people.
categories: Dice, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Storytelling

name: Regne-lotto
description: Plays just like regular Lotto, except the tiles depicts an amount and the boards have simple math questions.

name: Star Fleet Battles: Module Omega 5 – Omega Flotillas
description:
Part of the Star Fleet Battles Captain's Edition line.

From the publisher, Amarillo Design Bureau (ADB):

BACK FROM THE BRINK!

The Souldra Onslaught and Andromedan Invasion have been defeated, and now the empires of the Omega Sector must pick up the pieces before new enemies appear and old enemies become a threat. The devastation inflicted by the Andromedans and Souldra left each Omega Empire holding only a core region, and dreaming of plans to reclaim their previous territory and rebuild their previous power. As new enemies loom, new technology (gunboats!) sets the scene for the worst fighting yet!


Gunboats, the ultimate attrition unit, take fighting to new levels of savagery.
Tenders and Space Control Ships carry the gunboats into battle.
Special classes of escorts appear to protect the key carriers.
New types of bases are deployed to support the new fighters and gunboats.
Captor mines are deployed to protect key planets and bases.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Chuggedy Chug Game
description:
A simple train game for children in which a player spins a spinner and then moves his train down a track. Special spaces on the track can force the child to blow his whistle or to lose a turn, possible destroying a deeply developed strategy.

The game is significant for its theme. Pictured prominently on the box is the ventriloquist Paul Winchell and two of his wooden dummies. In reality, Winchell and the dummies have nothing to do with the game - their names simply appear on the board. But Winchell was at the height of his popularity when the game was released, so he name and image were used as makerting tools.

On a side not, Paul Winchell also did the voice of Tigger in the Winnie-the-Pooh movies.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trains

name: Horse Racing Game
description: No information yet known. Basis for game is a picture which was uploaded to the wrong entry on BGG The Horse Racing Game

name: Tannenberg, 15 July 1410: Downfall of the Teutonic Order
description:
"This game simulates the battle between the army of the Teutonic Order and the Crusader knights from all over Western Europe who joined them, under Hockmeister Ulrich von Jungingen, and the combined armies of the Kingdom of Poland and the Grand Duchy of Lithuania, under Wladislaw II Jagiello and Vytautas "the Great", fought on 15 July 1410 between the villages of Tannenberg and Ludwigsdorf, west of Lake Lubien in Prussia (modern-day north-east Poland). The game system is a simplified version of that used in "Hanba'al: Ambush at the Trebbia", from the spring 2007 issue of battle-market. As well as enabling the battle to be replayed as it happened, the game is designed to explore "what-if?" questions (see "Scenarios", below), such as:

If the Poles and Lithuanians had deployed the other way round (Poles on the right and Lithuanians on the left) might it have significantly affected the battle?
Can a completely different deployment by both armies make a radical difference to the outcome of the battle?
Could a more intelligent use of the Teutonic infantry have made a difference to the outcome of the battle?


The game includes an historical article, rules, A4-sized map, A4-sized page of tables, 71 game counters, 71 strength counters and a game turn counter.

Each game turn represents 20 minutes. Each hexagon represents about 250x250 meters. Each counter represents 1000 cavalry, 2000 infantry or a leader with their personal "banner" of 240 cavalry.

name: Ma'alinti Rangers: Black Hawks Down – 1993 Battle of Mogadishu, Somali
description:
"This game simulates the 1993 Battle of Mogadishu (Ma'alinti Rangers - The day of the Rangers - in Somali). The game is designed for solo play, the player controlling the U.S. and U.N. forces involved in the battle, while the game system simulates the Somali defenders."

The game comes with an historical article, rules, an A4-size map of the Mogadishu area, an A4-size page of tables, 70 game counters, game turn marker, and 2 six-sided dice if not the magazine version.

Each game turn represents 15 minutes. Each hexagon represents about 200x200 meters. Each infantry counter represents from 4 Delta Force or Navy SEALS to 8 Rangers. Each vehicle counter represents 2 Humvees, a 5-ton truck, or a helicopter. There are also three counter representing the Rescue Convoy.

name: Bugles, Boots 'n Saddles
description:
From the Rulebook:

"Being a set of playable, entertaining and enjoyable skirmish-level rules that can recreate the excitement and savagery of the countless skirmishes, patrol and raids in the American West in the late 1800's
publishers: And That's The Way It Was...

name: Final Argument of Kings
description:
Final Argument of Kings is a product of the same circle of players and designers who produced the Squad Leader board game and the Johnny Reb Civil War miniature rules. Final Argument bears a strong resemblance to the latter but was designed to tune to the warfare of the middle part of the 18th century. These rules are appropriate for games set from the time of the War of the Polish Succession (1734) to the beginning of the Wars of the French Revolution (1789.) It is scaled to be appropriate for battle on the European continent. For 15mm figures, one inch on the table represents 45-50 yards.

Horse and foot units are each four stands and represent infantry battalions and cavalry regiments. Artillery batteries are single stands as are army, wing, and brigade commanders. The number of figures per unit is variable with each figure representing 40 soldiers or one section of artillery. Stand size is variable with the number of figures so that units with more men cover a wider frontage. (The game would be playable with other basing systems, but the game's basing has a number of subtleties that transmit the tactical feel of the time. For example, units are longer in march column than they are wide in line as, indeed, they should be.)

Turns follow a set sequence with simultaneous movement and fire of various types. Each turn represents 20 minutes of time. Players mark orders for units that are hidden from the opposing player. Command is an important element but does not dominate the game or become obtrusive. There is also provision for grand tactical movement so that maneuver and closing to battle may happen quickly without taking too much time nor sacrificing tactical detail. Combat tends to be bloody with stands taking figure losses as a result. Morale of units is a key game concept. Units have a basic morale point that is altered by loss of strength and the local situation faced by the units. Battlefield events trigger morale checks. There are no saving roles.

name: Resources
description:
Described in the book Beyond Competition, Resources is a cooperative game where players take turns collecting resources on the game board. The object of the game is to keep the distribution of the four resources between the players as even as possible.

Movement on the board is done by jumping when possible or moving to a spot when not. Bonus are awarded when all the players have the same number of a particular resources. Penalty points for a resource are given at the end of the game for each resource another player lags behind the leader. If the resulting score is positive - everyone wins; if negative - everyone loses.

name: A Trip Around the World
description: Roll and move game with a travel theme. Players visit exotic locations and world Capitals. Starting and ending in New York.

name: Anyone Can Par
description:
Anyone Can Par is a golf simulation game.

The general rules of golf are followed. Players tee-off by rolling up to 5 white dice. The dice are added up and the total is multiplied by 10 to determine the yardage. To simulate a hook or slice, the black die is rolled to determine which lane the ball lands in. Shots from sand traps, putts and chip shots are done with special dice that have non-standard number distributions:




Brown

Sand Trap Shot

1:2:3:3:3:4



Red

Chip Shot

1:2:2:3:3:4



Green

Putt

1:2:2:2:3:4




Alternately, these shots can be done by taking the appropriate card and following the instructions. As the player's marker (ball) gets closer to the green, they will wish to roll fewer white dice to ensure they do not overshoot the hole. Markers landing in hazards suffer penalties. The course includes 9 holes with water hazards, sand traps, out of bounds areas, and trees.

name: Non Sequitur
description:
Avoid reaching the 'Out' square (at the end of the board) by successfully giving answers that are within chosen categories.

Ex- If a category is 'State Capitals' each player must name a state capital in a clockwise rotation until a player cannot think of an answer or duplicates an answer already given.

The winner is the player closest to start when a player reaches the 'Out' square.

name: Killer Katanas II
description:
Killer Katanas II is the revised version of a set of miniatures rules designed to simulate warfare in Japan during the 16th and 17th centuries. The designer has also been a consultant on several recent board games on samurai warfare and renaissance era Japan.

The rules support two different scales of battle. In the small scale a base of figures represent 120-150 foot or 60-75 horse. The larger scale enables simulation of the biggest battle of the era. Each base represents 240-300 infantry or 120-150 cavalry.

The rules cover all the unit types of the era including Ronin and Warrior Monks. Further, the author includes nearly two dozen classical Japanese army deployment patterns. Besides the rules, the booklet contains extensive lists of leaders and their ratings as well as army lists, ten historical battle scenarios and a scenario generator.

name: Santa Anna Rules: Warfare in Mexico – 1820-1870: Volume 1 – Tactical System
description:
These rules simulate land warfare in Mexico, 1820-1870. The rules permit simulation of all the many conflict during this time including the Mexican-American War and the Maximillian War.

Units are infantry battalions, cavalry regiments and artillery batteries. The rules give a playable game while providing a remarkable feel for the warfare of this time and place. Unit morale is critical. Casualties are indicated by figure loss but there are also losses to straggling.

The rules also provide two scenarios for the Mexican-American War (Buena Vista and Churubusco) as well as for the battle of Puebla in 1862 and for San Jacinto during the War for Texas Independence.

name: General-at-Sea: Wargames Rules and Scenarios for Fleet Actions, 1640-1721
description:
General-at-Sea is a set of rules and scenarios for fleet actions, 1630-1721. They were mainly designed for 1/2400 and 1/3000 models although 1/1200 may also be used. The rules use a multi-ship system that permits large actions to be fought to conclusion in good time.

The rules also include scenarios for the Anglo-Dutch wars as well as for the later periods of the War of the League of Augsburg and the War of the Spanish Succession.
categories: Age of Reason, Book, Miniatures, Nautical, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Ancient Warfare
description:
There is no text on the back of the book. An excerpt from the Author's Notes inside is as follows:

"A to Z Rules For Ancient Warfare is a fast playing set of rules for 25mm and 15mm miniatures. It is compatible with all basing systems, army organizations and army lists. It will enable you to play a game with 300 to 400 figures per side in about four hours.

The heart of the rules is the initiative-impulse movement system, the command control system and the morale system. These are the most critical areas determining the flow of the game. They are also areas of great flexibility and changes can easily be made to meet the requirements of different army compositions or scenarios."

name: Cleveland Trivia
description: This is a set of cards intended for use with Trivial Pursuit or other similar trivia games. All of the trivia questions related to the city of Cleveland, Ohio (USA). The question categories include: People, Business/Technology, Places, Culture/Entertainment, Fine Points, and Sports.

name: In Pursuit of Nothing the Seinfeld Board Game
description:
From the manufacturer:

We all have a friend like George, who is as cheap as the day is long. In this game, each of the players is having lunch with this "George," with the goal of contributing NOTHING to his lunch tab. Playing is simple:

Players, in turn, choose a question by value/difficulty. Answer the question right - transfer a portion of your contribution to another player (i.e., the value of the question). Answer the question wrong - another players transfers the value of the question to you. The first one to Nothing wins.
categories: Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Overtime
description:
Overtime is a game supplement to The Hunt by Maverick Games Co. The book clarifies rules, offers more arms, armor, and optional rules to enhance the base game.

Let's not forget the Kings of the Maze: The Foxes. The Overtime supplement adds seven new Foxes to cause headaches and mayhem in the Maze they are placed into.

See also Overtime

Expands:

The Hunt
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Maze, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Cubed
description:
From the box:

"Choose your color, place your cubes (dice). "Rock", "paper", and "scissor" cubes appear, disappear, move, rotate and capture until only one remains.
