Many ways to play - the basic game for kids of all ages or the advanced game for a greater "cubic" challenge!"

The game uses custom dice and the board and box are laser-cut and laser-etched wood.

name: Spartacus
description:
From the publisher:
Spartacus' Slave Revolt was also known as the Great Slave War and this supplement focuses on the events surrounding that War as well as providing details of the two earlier revolts.

Featured within this 48-page book are army lists for the Slave and Roman armies, as well as a linear campaign for leading the slaves to freedom.

Expands:

Warhammer Ancient Battles
categories: Ancient, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: Mr. Surgeon
description: This game is very similar to "Operation," in that it is a physical dexterity game where the players play the role of a surgeon operating on a cartoon-like character. In this version, players use a fork like tool to carefully remove various pieces of the patient without causing him to shake and wake up.

name: Space 1889 Adversaries
description:
Adversaries was GDW's series of additional detailed game components (miniatures really) for the many titles under the Space:1889 Banner.



Martian Cloudships (GDW 1801)A set of miniature plastic Martian cloudships. The box contains several additional sprues of the Martian Cloudships, identical to the single sprue contained in Sky Galleons of Mars. The true genius here was including kit bashing instructions so that avid players could convert these stock miniatures into other cloudships detailed in yet other Space: 1889 (Original edition) products.

Expands: Sky Galleons of Mars and Ironclads and Ether Flyers



Aerial Gunboats (GDW 1802)A similar set of plastic British aerial gunboats. In this case, additional sprues of the British Gunboats from Sky Galleons of Mars with kit bashing instructions to create other gunboats detailed in Space: 1889 (Original edition).

Expands: Sky Galleons of Mars and Ironclads and Ether Flyers



Victorian Adventurers (GDW 1821)A set of ten 25mm figures created by RAFM to replace the pawns in Temple of the Beastmen.

From the publisher:

Intrepid Victorian adventurers penetrate the inner sanctum of a High Martian kraag, the mountain fortresses cut from the living stone of tall mesas by the savage winged High Martians. Each adventurer strives to be the first to fight his way through to the heart of the kraag and discover the sinister Worm Priests.

Expands: Temple of the Beastmen, Soldier's Companion, and Cloudships & Gunboats



Kraag Warriors (GDW 1843)A set of twenty 25mm figures (in 10 poses) created by RAFM for use with Temple of the Beastmen and the related role-playing game.

Expands: Temple of the Beastmen, Soldier's Companion, and Cloudships & Gunboats



Soldiers of the Queen (GDW 1841)A set of eighteen 25mm figures (in 10 poses) created by RAFM for use with Soldier's Companion and the related role-playing game.

Expands: Soldier's Companion and Cloudships & Gunboats



Legions of Mars (GDW 1842)A set of twenty 25mm figures (in 10 poses) created by RAFM for use with Soldier's Companion and the related role-playing game.

Expands: Soldier's Companion and Cloudships & Gunboats
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Sockeye
description:
Sockeye follows the life-cycle of a Sockeye Salmon. It is designed to be a fun educational exploration of salmon information.

Players begin as salmon eggs which hatch into fry. The fry grow into fingerlings in a lake and then proceed to the ocean. This course is reversed as the salmon returns to the same spawning bed were it was born. Along the way there are many hazards to the growing salon; from river dangers to being eaten by animals and people.

The game is a standard roll-and-move variety. The frequent hazard spots move the player back or forward a number of spaces; make a player miss a turn; or require a particular number to be rolled before continuing. The last hazard, three spaces from the finish, is particularly nefarious as it sends the player all the way back to the beginning.

The game comes with a map of the Sockeye spawning rivers of BC Canada and a detailed description of the life-cycle of a Sockeye Salmon. The game artwork is beautiful, from the board to the fish-shaped playing pawns.
publishers: Coqualeetza Education Training Centre, Fforbez Enterprises Ltd.

name: Vectis
description:
A boardgame allowing two players to fight out a fictional campaign from the Napoleonic Wars: a French invasion of England's Isle of Wight. Full rules are provided, with period illustrations and fictional vignettes conveying the feel of the game setting. Provided with the cut-outs needed to make the four-part A2 board and 93 playing counters. A game should last 90 minutes on a first play, reducing to an hour once familiar with the rules.

The PDF version can be found at:
http://www.wargamedownloads.com/item.php?item=577

name: Noodle Booster
description:
This is a trivia/brainteaser type game marketed for children. Includes 200 Noodle Booster challenge cards, 80 tokens, 6 "Take a Chance" cards, and a one minute timer.

From the publisher: "The game designed by Gifted Program educators.Testing to identify gifted students is based on higher-level cognitive processes and to a large extent children are poorly prepared due to little or no exposure to such subject matter. Noodle Booster exposes players to these concepts and techniques in a fun format. Studies and research demonstrate that a child's performance will increase significantly by merely becoming familiar with the concepts."

name: Run for President
description:
Described in the book Calculate!, Run for President is a representation of the Electoral College system for selecting a President of the United States.

Play makes use of a calculator - floating point division is used at the start to seed the game. Beyond that point, the process could also be done simply by hand (multiplication by a single digit). The first three digits of the resulting number gives the state and number of votes cast in that state.

When all states have at least one vote cast in them, the game ends. The player with the highest number of votes cast in the state wins the state and scores points equal to the electoral votes the state has.

name: Big Balls
description:
BigBalls represents an advanced development of EinStein würfelt nicht! and consists of similarly short rules. The neutral balls however do not allow to use the same successful strategies as in EinStein würfelt nicht!.

The wooden gameboard is triangular with 28 fields.
Each player gets a color (black or white) with six stones each. In addition there are six neutral marbles, called Big Balls in the third corner.

When it's your turn you may roll a dice and move an according numbered stone of yours upwards or sideways or you move one of the BigBalls downwards.
You may beat (eliminate) own stones as this enables you to move faster. But this also bears the risk running out of stones that will cause losing the game.
Winner of the game is the player who reaches first the corner of the BigBalls with one of his own stones.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Deals on Wheels
description:
In this game each player represents an enterprising transporter. The object of the game is to be the first to earn either E500,000 in the short game, or E1,000,000 in the standard game.

Players earn money by transporting cargo in their trucks between European cities. You can invest the money earned, buy more trucks or bigger ones, or increase the radius of your deliveries.

Actions available each turn depend upon the roll of the dice. Actions include taking a chance card, taking a cargo card and auctioning it, driving the trucks or refueling.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: Milky Way
description: You win the game by making it to planet Earth-- where your Milky Way Child will renew his or her Milky Way power and assist the Parentals in defeating the Evil Agents of the four supreme Galaxies. (Quoted from Instructions.)

name: Ever-Victorious Armies: Fast Play Rules Nineteenth Century Warfare, c. 1790 to c. 1885
description:
Light, quick skirmish game of warfare during the 19th Century.

From the Introduction

The late nineteenth-century has always been a popular subject for wargaming, and there are already plenty of rule sets around. But when HLBS Publishing (The Honourable Lead Boiler Suit Company) was planning their Victorian British in Home Service uniforms figure range they decided to publish their own rules to go with them. Why?

Firstly, because the emphasis in Ever-Victorious Armies is rather different from that of most rule sets. The authors were especially interested in the role which the British army might have played in a European War of the period, and so they wanted to cater for this sort of hypothetical scenario. They also wanted to be able to fight "alternative history" campaigns, involving fictional armies based fairly loosely on real-life prototypes. This required a "broad brush" approach, catching the essence of the period, but without concentrating too intently on the tactical and organizational minutiae of a particular conflict.

The other factor which HLBS Publishing (The Honourable Lead Boiler Suit Company) sought to emphasize in this war-game is the "game" part. Some of the best known rules for the period -- as for many other periods -- are a bit too much like work to play. Authenticity is all very nice but real warfare has been aptly described as a combination of ninety percent boredom and ten percent confusion. HLBS Publishing (The Honourable Lead Boiler Suit Company) have tried not to reproduce this aspect too faithfully in Ever-Victorious Armies.

Ever-Victorious Armies is based on individual figures, which are removed to simulate casualties, thus minimizing record-keeping. It requires little if any paperwork, no little boxes to tick off, and only one kind of dice. The command and control rules require each on-table unit to be given orders at the start of the game, to which they must try to adhere as long as morale test results permit. The orders should specify the objective and route if the units are to move, or the position to be defended if not. An army's Commander-in-Cheif may attempt to modify the orders of one unit, per turn, by utilizing a messenger figure to convey a new set of written orders.

The rules ideally require figures to be based so that they are individually removable, but multi-figure "blocks" -- like those produced in 2mm and 6mm bi Irregular Miniatures -- can be used instead, if you prefer to use the smaller scales. In this case, simply treat each block as if it was a figure.

A game involving several hundred figures a side can easily be completed in an evening. After a few attempts players will be able to remember most of the rules which are needed, and so will be able to keep the game moving without constantly referring to the rulebook. This leaves the players free to enjoy the games and admire their carefully painted figures -- which is what it is all about, after all.
publishers: Brigade Games, HLBS Publishing (The Honourable Lead Boiler Suit Company), Rattrap Productions LLC

name: Anzio: Drive to Rome (1944)
description:
Anzio – Drive to Rome is a two player, World War Two regimental level simulation covering the first month of fighting in the Anzio bridgehead in Italy during January and February 1944. Under the auspices of Operation Shingle, Allied units from both the United States of America and Great Britain conducted a beach landing in the area surrounding Anzio in an attempt to seize the strategic Alban Hills and cut the supply to German troops fighting further south near Monte Cassino. Ultimately, the invading forces had the potential of capturing Rome, described by Churchill as “the keys to Europe”. Planning for the invasion of Normandy, Operation Overlord, was well advanced and any success or failure at Anzio would surely lead to ramifications for the larger invasion planned for France.

In Anzio – Drive to Rome, each player takes command of either the Allied of Axis forces, and each player moves his supplied pieces in an attempt to fulfill the victory conditions as set out further below. The game commences on 22nd January 1944 following the Allied invasion and finishes on 1st March 1944 unless the automatic victory conditions are fulfilled by either player.
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Rei dos Piratas
description:
From the box: Command your ship crossing the seas in search of incredible treasures. Play with Pirates, the Navy or the Phantom! Amazing emotions await you in this amused marine adventure
Da Caixa "Comande se navio cruzando os mares em busca de incríveis tesouros. Jogue com Piratas, a Marinha ou Navio Pirata! Incríveis emoções o aguardam nessa divertida aventura marítima". Veja no site:
http://www.paisefilhos.ind.br/

name: All Stars Coach
description: In All Stars Coach, players form their own soccer teams (based on real players; cards represent the players of a team). Different players have different prices, abilities and so on. After the card drafting phase the actual game begins where the actual soccer match is played on the game board.

name: Node Ball
description:
Node ball is an abstracted sports game, where you're trying to bounce one of three balls in the game through an opponents goal area. You have several pieces that can move in varying ways to "kick" the ball, which then roll as far as the kicking piece moved in the opposite direction. The game continues until all balls have scored, and the player with the most points wins.

Full rules at: http://www.luchacabra.com/?p=29

Online Play


Super Duper Games

name: Mirrorwing
description:
Mirrorwing is a game inspired by Chess but with some interesting twists. All pieces are, essentially, pawns ("villagers") at the start, but they can be stacked -- at which time they become a "dragonrider", with the movement based on the bottom piece ("dragon") and the attack/capture (which is done without moving to the capture location, unlike Chess) based on the top piece ("rider"). As an added twist, any piece that moves over the center line of the board flips over, reversing the dragon and rider abilities. Winner is the last player to have an un-enhanced (villager) piece remaining.

Full rules: http://www.luchacabra.com/?p=28

name: Shannon
description: This is an abstract strategy game where players are rolling place dice onto a 4x4 chess-board like area. One player has light dice and the other dark -- and similarly there are light and dark squares on the board. The player with the highest score in their dice on the opposite toned squares wins. The trick comes in that the dice are placed with a particular horizontal or vertical orientation, and that when a dice is placed, adjacent dice may be converted if the facing side of the new die is higher in value than the facing side of the original die. Also, to give a bit more strategic depth, players may store up to 3 dice that they don't like the rolls on -- and may use one of these instead of rolling on any turn. But, they must use all the stored dice by game end.

name: Leave No Man Behind
description: This is an abstract game played with a chess board and Icehouse Pieces where the object is to get your pieces to the opposite corner of the board as quickly as possible. It has some of the feel of Chinese Checkers, but with the added complications of the possibility of your opponent being able to immobilize your pieces, and you being able to carry your immobilized pieces, and movement rates and jumping restrictions based on the size of the pieces involved.

name: William at Hastings
description:
Simple game depicting the Battle of Hastings. 144 counters plus an arrow supply marker, 11x17 map, one page of rules, one page of designer's notes.

Terrain affects combat through additions to or subtractions from the attack or defense factor. Thus, the Normans are weakened when attacking up Senlac Hill, while the Saxons are strengthened attacking down it. The Combat Results Table is bloody enough for a battle that was fought for the most part without the fiddly flanking moves that produce ZOC-kills. The Norman arrow supply and Saxon Hand-held missiles rules add flavor to a bloody shoving match.

name: Masterpieces
description:
Masterpieces - The Family game created by children.

In Masterpieces players attempt to guess what young children have drawn.
The game consists of 560 cards. The face of each card displays a framed drawing - the vast majority of the drawings have been drawn by children under the age of eight. The reverse shows the value of the drawing, the answer, name and age of the artist. A small quantity of the cards are "Forgeries" which have been drawn by famous adults.
The first player (or team) to collect £100,000,000 worth of "Masterpieces" (by correctly identifying the subject of the drawings) wins the game!
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Humor, Party Game

name: Tosenkyo
description:
What is the Tosenkyo?


To-sen-kyo means throwing-fan-amusement. To contest your skill with your rival, aim the target, toss the fan, and then refer scoring chart for victory points (VP). Although its elegant image made some fantasy like "game of Heian Era from a millennium ago", it is only legend. According to evidences of manuscripts, it might be flourished from middle of Edo era (about 1770s).

Skilled veteran makes victory points constantly. Beginner may hit big score luckily. Because of this easily enjoyability for everyone, it won popularity once among commoners.


Difference of Tosenkyo from Darts


As same throwing game, Tosenkyo is frequently compared with Darts. The most significant deference of Tosenkyo from Darts is way of scoring. VP of Darts are gained from stabbed area directly. But in Tosenkyo, after hitting fan dropped the target down from the Base box, VP would be determined between distance and over/under positions of fan and target (and sometimes Base of target). Beginner cannot win almost against veteran in Darts. But in Tosenkyo, scoring system has some happening factors. Some beginner may hit big lucky score and win against constant veteran. This makes the game unexpectedly thrilling and exciting.

In fact, adequate proportion of luck factor against cool rule is the joyous essence of Tosenkyo.

Page: http://www.tosenkyo.net/whats-e.htm

name: Channel
description: Each player has 10 numbered disks and 10 numbered slots (Channels) on his base that each disk goes into. The board is a grid pattern. In the middle of the board is the scoring base. The scoring base as 10 numbered slots like each players base. The scoring base also has four channels to move disks through. Each turn a player may move one of his disks one place; forward, backward, left or right. Each player is trying to get his numbered disk in the same numbered scoring slot on the scoring base. Each scoring slot only holds one disk. Players may use their disks to block slots and channels. When all scoring slots are filled players add up the total of a each players respective scoring slots with the highest winning.

name: Dragon War: The Shadowland Set
description:
The Shadowland Set adds a giant side board for the Reaper. No good comes to a player that is forced to play through the Shadowlands. It also comes with 4 new fate cards and a card for the board.

Expansion to Dragon War
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Dragon War: Power Cards Set
description:
This 10 board game card set adds cards that are inserted into the board and can only be accessed by certain players. When they are accessed they grant bonuses to the character that accessed it.

Expansion to Dragon War
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Dragon War: Movement Fate Card Set
description:
This expansion adds 34 Fate Cards with art by Robert Kraus and Eric Kempher. The fate cards play a huge role in surprising your opponent in Dragon War and this set adds more to the original fate cards, as well as introducing a new type of movement Fate Card that can be used at any time.

Expansion to Dragon War
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Dragon War: Rak Character Pak Set
description:
This expansion adds 5 new character cards, 5 character tiles and 5 life counters to allow for more players.

Expansion to Dragon War
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Casualtees
description:
The game of futuristic international automated warfare.

In the future, war will be fought without humans on the battlefield. CasualTees is a tabletop miniatures wargame that recreates the experience of future wars. Each pre-painted miniature represents one automated army unit that a future General might have at his or her disposal.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Flora
description:
This game seems to have some of the most uniquely formed tiles: They look like the outer shape of a water fountain after a pipe has burst.

There are 78 of these tiles, depicting flowers, leaves, bees, bugs and scissors.
The winner is the one who builds at first on the playing mat in front of him 4 flowers. Two of these have to be from the same kind.

With the scissors you can cut an unfinished flower from an opponent and use his tiles for yourself.
The bug allows to change a certain number of tiles (variable) and placed on top of one of your flowers prevents the opponent to cut it.

At the end of the game the flowers count different point value.

This is a stripped down variant of the OGALLALA game from the same author.

name: Charlie McCarthy's Radio Party
description:
"The game consists of 21 figures... one of Charlie McCarthy and four each of Edgar Bergen, Don Ameche, Dorothy Lamour, Nelson Eddy, and Robert Armbruster. Also a spinner which determines play."

The spinner features a picture of the puppet Charlie McCarthy.

name: Generic Outlandishly Big Spacefleets (GOBS)
description:
From the introduction:

"Generic Outlandishly Big Spacefleets! is the game where you control vast fleets of vessels of all shapes and sizes, from nimble little fighters to moon-sized planetsmashers. Move your ships. Fire your weapons. Launch your torpedoes. And watch your enemies explode into brilliant flashes of molten metal! Everything a budding megalomaniac... err, defender of the galaxy... could want!

G.O.B.S.! is designed to allow you to build big, custom spacefleets and fight quick, explosive battles with simple rules and little or no record keeping. Just move, shoot, and (probably) explode. What could be more fun? Best of all, you can use G.O.B.S.! with any spaceship miniatures you like, from those expensive metal jobs to cheap plastic toys to scratch-built wonders made from household items. (Yours truly is contemplating a fleet made from seashells.)

In G.O.B.S.!, a ship’s speed and combat worthiness are determined by the size and apparent purpose of the miniature(or whatever the manufacturer happens to call the thing). Players may then customize the armament to reflect their preferences.
Big ships are slow, clumsy, and easy to hit. They also carry lots and lots of weapons and are both very dangerous and hard to destroy.

Smaller ships are fast and nimble, and very hard to hit. However, they carry few weapons and are very easy to destroy.

The movement and combat systems of G.O.B.S.! are designed to reflect these general principles."

Download G.O.B.S.! at:

Homepage: http://www.thegobspage.com

name: QUEST: An intriguing game of mazes!
description:
Very simple premise - Be the first to get out of the maze and win the game!
The unusual component is the board itself, By twisting the handle in the center, the direction you are forced to move changes, this providing the difficulty.

name: Sharpe's Skirmish
description:
The rules for the Durham's Chosen Men 40mm demo game of skirmishes in the napoleonic age are currently free to download.
This game did all the rounds in 2006 and won many awards for best demo game and has a high grade of detail while still being easy accessible and quick to learn.

name: Dragon War: Elemental Furies
description:
This expansion adds 4 Card/Board Game Pieces and 4 Oversized Elemental/Minion Game Boards that can be shuffled into the base deck for more danger.

Expansion to Dragon War
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Dragon War: Castle of Doom
description:
This expansion contains 1 oversized board, 2 castle gate cards, and a deck of monster cards that populate the dungeon for all players to escape from.

Expansion to Dragon War
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Dragon War: Dragon Allies
description: This expansion to Dragon War adds four Dragon Cards and four Dragon counters. The cards are two-sided, so there are eight allies for players to attempt to win to their side, by accomplishing six different Alliance tasks in the game. Once a Dragon Ally's allegiance is won, its powers are yours to command. Each Ally has different powers.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Dungeon Builders
description:
This piecepack game has two phases: First all the players build a dungeon by placing rooms, monsters and items. They may also use their turns to power their hero up, as only the most powerful hero will enter the dungeon.

When the dungeon is ready, the most powerful hero (in case of a tie, there's a small auction) enters the dungeon and plays a mini Dungeon Crawl, trying to get all the gold and defeat the monsters.

If the hero is successful, he'll keep the gold, but the other players will also gain gold for every point of damage done by their monsters and for items used.

The game is played in different rounds until one player gains a set amount of gold decided at the beginning.

There's an element of bluffing because items and monsters are placed face down, hiding their identity, and this can be used to trick other players.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Desert Rats
description:
An expansion for ASL. 8 scenarios featuring desert warfare from December 1940 to November 1942.

This features German, Italian, British, Indian, French and New Zealand forces.

These scenarios use boards 25-29.

The scenarios are:

1) The Italians Need Help: Camp Tumar Wes, SOuth of Sidi Barani, Egypt - December 9, 1940
2) Tobruk Derby: South of Mechili Libya - April 5, 1941
3) Hellfire Pass: Halfay Pass, South of Sollum, Egypt - June 16, 1941
4) Seizing Sidi Rezegh: Near Sidi Rezegh, Libya - November 22, 1941
5) The French Fight: Bir Hachiem, Libya - June 9th 1942
6) Killing Field: Knightsbridge, South of Bir Lefa, Libya - June 12, 1942
7) Devil's Garden: South of El Alamein, Egypt - October 24, 1942
8) Supercharge!: South of El Alamein Egypt - November 2, 1942

This is not a complete game. Ownership of ASL modules is required.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Rebels & Royalist
description:
Rebels & Royalist is a multi-player wargame taking place in an imaginary country. Each player controls a faction of rebels and is trying to get their faction to control five (of twelve) cities or three Royalist cities. Players receive production for their holdings, build units, move and fight, etc., in a reasonably familiar fashion. There are rules for supply and fairly elaborate rules for scouting.

There are two unusual features of the game. One is that the Royalists take part in the game but are not controlled by a single player - when it is the Royalist's turn to build or move the player to the left of the last player to do something takes control of them. The other is that every turn has an alliance phase, in which the players may make or break alliances between their factions. The player order for each turn is determined by drawing cards, and all factions in an alliance move when one of the faction cards is drawn (the members may vote to wait for a later card rather than moving at the first opportunity).

name: Auditions
description:
If the terms “Theater Sports” or “Whose Line Is It Anyway?” mean anything to you, you’ll recognize the spirit behind this Theatrical Styled party game.

Impersonations, Charades, Jokes, Songs, Improvisation and more.

From the early years of Decipher, Inc, Auditions at times resembles an elaborate version of Cranium, while at other times it seems like a party-event-in-a-box, reminiscent of a Murder Mystery Dinner Party, with Wayne Brady standing in for Sherlock Holmes.

From the box:
AUDITIONS, the game
"everybody wants to get into the act" tm
Now you can too.

See your friends in a whole new light - the spotlight - as Auditions turns your living room into center stage for the evening!
- See your button-down brother-in-law become the world's fattest ballerina!
- Hear your best friend as a TV evangelist begging for bucks! Hallelujah!
- Experience your next door neighbors playing the hapless victims of the "Mattress Tag Police"
- You had no idea your mom knew THAT joke, or that ELVIS LIVES... in your great aunt Bertha!
- Witness your boss become... almost lifelike! You'll laugh! You'll cry! You'll laugh 'til you cry!

If you get a charge out of a great impersonation, appreciate a good joke or a clever charade, you'll love Auditions! Off-the-wall scripts, goofy songs and more, combine for an evening you'll never forget! Play Auditions to get rave reviews! Your family and friends will be begging for an encore!

name: Troglodita (En busca del fuego)
description:
The strange name "Casuga Guina" stood for the initials of the surnames of the company designers and publishers: Manuel Calbet, Amando Suriñach, Manuel García, José Luis Guitián and Xavier Navarro. This Spanish company appeared in the mid 80s and published this and another title, Tutankhamon (see entry)

In "Troglodita", each player represents a prehistoric tribe that fights for survival and tries to occupy more caves than the others. In the meanwhile, they have to hunt, fish, confront wild animals, fight another tribes and suffer natural disasters such as earthquakes or epidemies. Obtaining fire is essential to keep food.

The game contents were poorly presented, but it was funny to play and it would have been really good with some extra work on rules and graphic design.

name: Battle of the Bracchi Hills
description:
Battle of the Brachhi Hills: on the Road to Rome – May 12-14 1944

The battle for Rome from the perspective of the 351st Infantry Regiment, 88th Division, the soldiers charged with cracking the Gustav Line. This historical module comes in a zip-lock bag.

Contents:
Cover Page (front) / Rules (back)
22"x34" map
12 scenarios

Battle of the Brachhi Hills is not a complete game. Ownership of Beyond Valor and Yanks from the ASL game system is required to play this game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Trial 1997
description:
From the back of the box:

"Trial '97 brings together facets of the riddle of the future of Hong Kong which now confronts the 6 million inhabitants who are the pawns in this game of intrigue. Invite your friends to roll the dice and play the future of Hong Kong. Politics, Power, Money and Technique will challenge your every move to Trial 1997!"

Published in 1987, when the future of Hong Kong was uncertain, this is a roll and take an action game where players try to get as much money out of Hong Kong as possible before the final handover.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Dice Rolling, Stock Holding

name: De Matrica Bellae
description:
De Matrica Bellae is a set of matrix game rules for tabletop wargames by Graham D. Evans and was published as the Society of Ancients incentive game for 2005. The matrix style of play often produces an anarchic type of game and also needs an umpire, but can produce an entertaining game that is good fun and can provide a lot of value to the wargamer. DMB also includes a bonus matrix game campaign, "Londinium's Burning" - a matrix version of the Iceni revolt led by Boudicca.

(from the SOA website)

Matrix games use structured arguments rather than mathematics to determine the success or failure of actions within the game.

name: Star Deck Card Game
description: Star Deck is a two player game of cards where you build your own starship with the cards provided in your own deck and then attack your enemy.

name: Wings
description:
Wings is a exciting game of strategy and business in the fantastic aeronautic world.

Each player starts the game with a MD-83 plane to accomplish an itinerary between two cities of the world.

To do so, they will have to fly from city to city to reach the destiny's airport; buy players have to be foresighted when they decide which flights to get, because the room for planes in each airport is limited!

The more itineraries accomplished, the more money earned to buy more planes to create an airline that allows plays of high strategy, to get connections which give the opportunity to accomplish a higher number of itineraries taking advantage of the planes, to assure spaces in each of the airports, to block routes to force other planes to change direction, and to get a lot of money to build an AERONAUTIC MONOPOLY!

name: The Battle of Bunker's Hill: 17th June 1775
description:
A simple wargame using counters or miniatures (not supplied) to simulate the battle of Bunker's Hill. Movement and combat are straightforward, with infantry having a short effective firing range, hitting on a roll of 6 on an ordinary die. In melee a simple comparison of combat value is made, with the weaker unit retreating. Artillery units have a long range but limited mobility as you would expect. The American forces have stronger firepower but are weaker in melee, thus the British need to press their attack strongly.

This game appeared in Practical Wargamer vol 11 no 1 and is described as a framework which could be elaborated upon as required. A plain map (no hexes) and counters (to cut out) are included.
categories: Age of Reason, American Revolutionary War, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Movement Template, Simulation

name: Quatre Bras 1815
description:
A simple wargame using map and counters, giving an outline framework for the battle of Quatre Bras. Movement is simultaneous but straightforward. Musketeers, riflemen and artillery can fire at range, hitting on a 6 on a standard die - units take two such hits to destroy them. Melee combat simply consists of comparing the strength of the opposing units, the weaker side retreating on their next two turns. There are rules for terrain and forming squares, and it is suggested that the rules could be developed further if the players wish.

This game came with Practical Wargamer vol 10 no 6, Nov/Dec 1996, and included a simple map (no hexes) and counters to be cut out.

name: Chevyland Sweepstakes
description:
Published by Milton Bradley in 1968 for ages 7 to adult. A roll & move game simulating ownership of a Chevy Dealership. Players move around the board using 1 of 4 different colored tokens (no cars) and earn or lose 'sales' depending on where they land and what 'community affairs' cards they draw.

Contains 4 colored playing pieces, 24 Chevrolet 'community affairs' cards, a pack of money and a die.

Box insert features color cartoon sytle pictures of 1969 Corvette Coupe, Camaro SS 396 Coupe, Impala Convertible, Impala Sport Sedan and Biscayne 4 Door Sedan. Also features a larger real life picture of the Corvette (same picture on box cover).

name: Starz
description:
Backgammon enthusiasts should feel at home with Starz, in which players maneuver pieces around a board according to dice throws, attempting to land on various "power beads." When different beads are added to a piece's spire (which is made of flexible plastic, but still is something to keep away from children), it gains the abilities to move onto red and blue squares, to move diagonally, and to land on opposing pieces. Since a piece acquires the power beads of any opposing piece it captures, everyone has plenty of incentive to play aggressively, even in a four player game.

(Description from Nov. 1984 GAMES Magazine, p. 36, with minor correction--the original read "added to the board's spire," rather than "added to a piece's spire," but the former is clearly incorrect, judging from the picture which accompanies the game description in the magazine; "a piece gains the abilities" was then changed to "it gains the abilities.")

name: King Kong Game
description:
KING KONG GAME, cartoon-themed, dated 1966 by Milton Bradley.
This game is for 2 to 4 players, ages 5 to 12.
Based on a short-lived cartoon of the mid-sixties.
Fairly easy track game of getting from the start to the finish on the board,
taking either the longer, safer paths or the more dangerous shortcuts.
Board illustrated with Kong and the cartoon characters.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Annex
description:
The game comes with 132 letter tiles in four colors, three 'wild' tiles, and a board that consists of interlocking paths. Each player draws four tiles as his or her starting hand. An additional eight tiles are drawn and turned face-up to be used as a common pool. The pool and the players' hands are replenished as the letters are used.

Players take turns placing letters onto the paths to form words. Each word must use at least one letter already on the board and at least one letter either from the common pool or from the player's hand. Words may turn corners (move from one path onto a different one) and read forward or backward, up or down. Longer words score more than shorter words; words using letters of a single color score more than words of multiple colors. The game ends when all the paths are completed or when no one can play a letter that will form a new word.

name: Rumbling Spell Orchestra
description:
Rumbling Spell Orchestra is a CCG based on the "Touhou Project" series of Japanese shoot-em-up games. They're what the Japanese call "danmaku" games, literally "bullet hell," a genre known for it's manic focus on dodging extremely complex bullet patterns, where thousands of deadly projectiles can fill the screen at a time. The Touhou games are known for their intricate and complex bullet patterns, unique fantasy setting, many characters, and prodigal amount of fan-derived works...this card game included.

"This is a two-player turn-based dueling card game. Each player starts out by choosing four characters (repeats are allowed), and designates one as the leader. Your leader has an initial health point (HP), border value (BV) and evasion value (EV), which will be used throughout the match, as well as some special abilities. Your starting spell point (SP) is zero. The other characters are to allow you access to other cards; the character requirements can be seen at the top of each card.

After you've picked your team, you get to choose 40 cards (duplicates are allowed up to a total of three) that comprise your deck. Obviously you will pick cards that you can actually use.

You will keep track of your HP and SP using counters. The game ends when one person's leader's HP drops to zero or when his or her deck has been depleted."
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting, Video Game Theme

name: Attack
description:
The object is to attack, capture and destroy enemy camp or ammunition dump by placing a shell, bomb tank or men within them.

Play is started by placing men & mortars in camps; guns and tanks in ammunition dumps, airplanes at home airdromes. Mine locations are secretly noted. Units are moved 1 at a time within the allowed movement range. Units can capture multiple enemy units simply by entering their square or they can shoot and destroy a single unit per turn. First player to capture or destroy an enemy dump or camp wins the game.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Taking the Fort
description: A very early wargame by Parker Brothers. Up to four players spin a spinner in turn and move down a path to be the first one to take the fort.

name: Test Cricket Game
description: This game was played by children during the War. Game comes with instructions on the lid, a miniature wooden cricket bat and ball, wickets, a scoreboard and 4 wooden players.

name: Sandy Hawley's Post Time
description:
A Canadian-made horse racing game, endorsed by champion jockey Sandy Hawley.

Game summary;
The players each start the game with the same amount of game money with which they buy horses and bet on them in 6 races. The horse cards are dealt to the players and each player decides to buy one or more of those dealt. Horses not purchased are returned to the bank and are offered again after the first race. The odds paid to the winning bet are determined by dealing the "odds" cards to the players' horses. Each player may bet up to $1000 to win on horses that the player owns. A race consists of 4 or 5 quarters. There are 5 identical decks of "race cards" that have on their face one of the ten available horses. For each of the quarters a "Race Card" deck is shuffled and then laid out in a row on the game board, the horse pictured on the last card is in the lead of that quarter. The leading horse earns a bonus for the player. The horse pictured on the last card of the last deck is the race winner. The winning horse earns the bet times the odds for the player. After 6 races, the horses are sold back to the bank for the original purchase price and the richest player is the game winner.

From the game box:
"The high stakes horse racing game. Fun for the whole family!
Post Time allows a maximum of 10 horses to run in every race.
Experience the thrill of owning a racehorse, entering it in a race, and collecting the prize money.
You have a six race series in which to accumulate assets, through buying horses and betting them to win! And, of course, your stable of winning horses can net you BIG purse money.
You don't need horseshoes to win!
A basic knowledge of horse racing is all you need to play and enjoy POST TIME. The Tote Board provided sets the odds, purse money and payoff for each race. Play your cards right, and you could be the 'winningest' owner at the track.
POST TIME includes:
1 Game Board
1 Tote Board
1 Set of Steward Cards
1 Set of ODDS Cards
1 Program with Rules
5 Sets of Race Cards
1 Set of Ownership Cards
POST TIME Cash"

name: Mexican Pete: I Got It
description: This is a dice rolling gambling game from Parker Brothers featuring cards with all possible die rolls on them. Rolling correct numbers results in winning bets on particular die rolls

name: Warzon
description:
From the rules:

Each player represents a country engaged in war. The players begin the game with well equipped sea, air, and land forces and a war chest. The units are moved around the board, encountering the dangers and obstacles of modern warfare. During the play the units may seize certain strategic bases, ports, etc., allowing the player to collect a specified amount of money from opponents.

The units are safe at all times in friendly territory but may be lost or captured when they enter enemy areas. Each player moves the units into play three at a time, one in each of air, land and sea lanes. Players must continue to move the 3 units around the track (lowest rated move first) until all 3 units have left the playing field. Then another 3 units are moved through the track until all players have moved all their units through the track.

The winner is the player that has earned the largest amount of assets (money + value of surviving units).

name: Pro Gloria! Rules for Wargaming in the 18th century
description:
These miniatures rules were designed to be both simple and realistic.

Pro Gloria! is a set of rules for 15mm abd 25/28mm wargaming. Cavalry and Infantry are represented by stands 50 of men. Artillery, Engineers and Staff are represented by stands of 10 men. An artillery gun model represents two actual guns.
categories: Age of Reason, American Revolutionary War, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Moon Melee
description:
In the not too distant future war and fighting have been banned on the planet earth.
All disputes are now resolved on the moon through hand to hand combat. Each nation involved in a dispute chooses its 7 most powerful warriors to compete in a decisive battle.

Moon Melee is an abstract strategy game in which players play cards to determine the movement of their warriors. The warriors are represented by dice and have a life force of 6.
Players take turns moving and attacking their opponents. When a warrior is reduced to a 0 life force they are removed from the game. The game takes place on a 7 X 7 square grid. The player with the most life force after 3 rounds is declared the winner.

name: JokerFace
description: JokerFace is a card game where players try to run out of cards they are holding. Players connect cards from their hand to those played face-up on the table. Cards are connected by matching symbols (Hearts, Diamonds, Spades and Clubs). Some cards have Jokers on them, which are wild. There are also 8 Face cards (King, Queen, Jack, and Ace) that give players special abilities during the game. If players can place a card that connects to two cards simultaneously, they may play an additional card the same turn. Players start their turns by drawing a card, so playing more than one each turn is vital. Each card also has text on it (Blue or Red), that create special circumstances (Rotating cards 90 degrees, Flipping them 180 degrees, and Moving them to another location on the "board"). Some cards played allow you to automatically play additional cards, and some force you to draw more.

name: Be an Airman
description:
Approved by Air Marshal W. A. Bishop V.C. D.S.O. M.C. D.F.C., better known as Billy Bishop, Canada's highest-scoring fighter ace of WWI. Bishop was officially credited with 72 kills, despite having started the war in the infantry and flying in combat only between March and August 1917, and April to June 1918. He was the first Canadian promoted to Air Marshal in 1939 and was in charge of air force recruitment and training at the time this game was published in 1941. For more details on his life, see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Billy_Bishop.

From the rules: Starting at the Recruiting Depot, players move through the Manning Depot to the Initial Training School, where they are classified as Pilots, Observers or Airgunners.

Each player then follows his course through its various stages till completed --- goes overseas --- serves with the Fighting force and finally returns home.

The game is driven by exact die rolls (getting to key spots and ending the game requires an exact roll) as the player moves through the contiguous points on the board. The cover is excellent and one of quite a few Canadian wargames created during WWII.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Red Actions: Beyond the River Don
description:
"The union of all the new State formations in Russia, and of all Russians who understand and care for the interests of the State, is all the more possible because the Volunteer Army has no reactionary aims in view, and does not decide beforehand what the future form of the State in Russia shall be, nor even in what way the Russian nation shall declare its will."

Speech by General Denikin to the Rada of the Land of Kuban, 14 November, 1918

From the publisher:

"We have completely outdone ourselves this time! What if I told you this was a campaign game that takes maybe 30 minutes to create from scratch, with limitless scenarios, a different map each and every time, and has counters representing the following armies and their equipment: Reds (All over Russia), Whites (Kolchak, Deniken, Wrangel, Yudenich, Komuch, Kappelites etc), Greens (Mahknovists), Estonians, Latvians, Finns, Lithuanians, Ukrainians, Poles, Armenians, Turks, French, Greeks, Japanese, American, British Empire (Including Canadians, Australians, and Indians), and Freikorps."
categories: Civil War, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Wargame, World War I

name: Penguins Paradise
description:
Penguins Paradise is a children's game where players try to be the first penguin to travel around the South Pole. Players roll a die to move. Some spaces have a fish marker where you can draw cards. Cards move penguins to different locations on the board, as well as forward and back. Cards also let you do special things during the game.

Players may play a card on their turn instead of rolling to move, or after rolling and moving. Cards may be played on yourself or an opponent. You can hold up to four cards before you must play one.

name: ZhanGuo
description:
This is a mod for the cardgame Illiad which is originally based on the Trojan war between the Greek states and Troy over Helen.

Changes have been made to convert the game into the 7 states of late ZhanGuo (Warring States) period of China ca. 4th-3rd century B.C.

Distinctive elements of late Warring States warfare have been incorporated into the game, whilst trying to stay within the original spirit of the Illiad gameplay.

State Banners (Heroes)
1. Zhao
2. Wei
3. Han
4. Yan
5. Chu
6. Qi
7. Qin

Tiles
Bamboo Bian +1 (Agamemnon +1)
Stone Bian +2 (Athena +2)
Bronze Bian +2 (Poseidon +2)

Units
Crossbow Trap (Harrow) - 6 cards
- prevents Cavalry and Chariot from being deployed

Yunti Che (Trojan Horse) - 6 cards
- hides units within (Ping, Gong & Nu)

Pili Che (Catapult) - 8 cards
- targets Crossbow Trap, Yunti Che, Pili Che & Chuangze Nu

Chuangzi Nu (Ballista) - 8 cards
- targets Cavalry, Chariot, Chao Che & Chuangze Nu

Chao Che x2 (Elephant x2) - 8 cards
- allows mounting of infantry (Ping, Gong & Nu), x2 to total unit values
- mounted Nu and Gong can target any unit in any rank of Missile or Skirmish formations

Cavalry (Chariot) - 4 cards
- targets all infantry units, can attack without being first deployed

Chariot (Chariot) - 4 cards
- targets all infantry units, can attack without being first deployed

Nu 2 (.....) - 6 cards
when not in formation
- targets Nu, Gong & Ping or 1st to 2nd rank of Nu, Gong & Ping in formation
when in 3-row deep "missile-formation" in any value combination
- targets Nu, Gong & Ping, 1st to 2nd rank of Nu, Gong & Ping in formation or Cavalry & Chariots
- only missile units in the first two rows can attack
- values are calculated as the sum of unit values from the first two rows multiplied by the unit value from the last row

Gong 1 (Archers 1) - 8 cards
when not in formation
- targets Nu, Gong & Ping or 1st rank of Nu, Gong & Ping in formation
when in 3-row deep "missile-formation" in any value combination
- targets Nu, Gong & Ping, 1st rank of Nu, Gong & Ping in formation or Cavalry
- only missile units in the first two rows can attack
- values are calculated as the sum of unit values from the first two rows multiplied by the unit value from the last row

Ping 1 (Hoplite 1) - 6 cards
- can be deployed into 4-row deep "skirmish-formation" in decreasing value
- values are calculated as the sum of all unit values multiplied by the number of rows

Ping 2 (Hoplite 2) - 7 cards
- can be deployed into 4-row deep "skirmish-formation" in decreasing value
- values are calculated as the sum of all unit values multiplied by the number of rows

Ping 3 (Hoplite 3) - 8 cards
- can be deployed into 4-row deep "skirmish-formation" in decreasing value
- values are calculated as the sum of all unit values multiplied by the number of rows

Ping 4 (Hoplite 4) - 9 cards
- can be deployed into 4-row deep "skirmish-formation" in decreasing value
- values are calculated as the sum of all unit values multiplied by the number of rows

Victory Cards
Mandate of Heaven (Helen) - 1 card
City +1 (Victory Town +1) - 4 cards
Fortress +1 (Victory Tireme +1) - 4 cards
City +2 (Victory Town +2) - 5 cards
Fortress +2 (Victory Tireme +2) - 5 cards
City +3(Victory Town +3) - 4 card
Fortress +3 (Victory Tireme +3) - 4 cards

Oracle Cards
Zhan Shen -1 (Thanatos -1) - 4 cards
Zhan Shen -2 (Thanatos -2) - 3 cards
7th Month Hungry Ghost Festival (Gorgon) - 2 cards

The following are some of the basic changes and assumptions I've made in the Mod:

I've introduced crossbowmen (Nu).

I've introduced a new "missile-formation" of archer/crossbow/ping 3-row deep ranks. Only the missile infantry of the first 2 rows of the "missile-formation" can attack. Units killed within the formation are removed and the formation is reassembled downward. Cavalry and Chariots can be attacked by missile troops in "missile-formation".

I've also bumped the game up to a 7 player game to match the 7 warring states. The 7 banners of the 7 warring states now replaces the 6 heroes.

I've increased some of the unit numbers and decreased others to enable the additional 7th player, to take into account the new crossbowmen, as well as to rebalance the game towards a slightly higher emphasis on missile troops.

Gorgon is now 7th Month Hungry Ghost Festival.

Thanatos is now Zhan Shen.

Helen is replaced by the Mandate of Heaven.

City/Tireme replaced by the duality of Civil/Military City/Fortress.

Agamemnon, Athena & Poseidon have been replaced by Bian (Tablets),a Bamboo Bian, a Stone Bian (for Civil City) & a Bronze Bian (for Martial Fortress) respectively.

Chariots are now split into lower value Cavalry & higher value Chariots.

Trojan Horse is now a Yunti Che.

Elephant is now Chao Che.

Harrows are now Crossbow Traps.

All other units remain basically the same except labeled in their Chinese equivalent.

Go here for more info: http://www.act.com.sg/zhanguo/
categories: Ancient, Bluffing, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Tile Placement

name: Wewanago Camping
description:
From Publisher's Website:

Players navigate the campgrounds by rolling dice and directing their plastic motorboat pieces. Identification squares prompt players to collect camp supply cards, collect money from the bank, select a “Bear Claw” or to pay for a misfortunate roll of the dice.

The object of the game is to be the first player to collect and present camp supplies from A to Z and make it to the finish square. A skilled and somewhat lucky player may collect the necessary camp supplies in one campground alone and head for the finish on “Home Stretch Road.” Too many mishaps and you may be forced to return to the campground you started in.

name: Mit "Prien" gegen England
description:
Based on the exploits of Gunther Prien, a German U-boat commander who entered Scapa Flow in 1939 and sank the British Battleship Royal Oak.

The game has 6 metal submarines that follow points on a track around the North Sea based on the roll of the die. Players must follow the instructions of special spots they enter.

Very simple game play.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Blockdance
description:
The game is played on a 8 sided hexagonal board, with groups of 7 stones, arranged in a hexagonal formation, at the center of each side, with opposing colors facing each other (a diagram is available on the game's website.)

On each turn, a player: (a) selects a group of connected friendly stones, (b) name one as pivot, and (c) rotate the group any multiple of 60 degrees around the pivot, provided all the landing places are either empty, with opponent stones, or one of his own cells that the move is just vacating. Any opponent stones landed on are captured. Passing is legal, and compulsory if no moves are legal.

The winner is whoever captures all his opponent's stones.

Blockdance does not have great clarity, i.e., it is very hard to predict what is the exact outcome of a sequence of moves. However, part of this difficulty vanishes once a player gets used to these pivot moves, and even if there is not much strategy, the game is highly tactical and fun.

name: Black Thursday
description:
A buying and selling game for the piecepack.

On your way to work at one of New York’s most prestigious investment firms, you consider the successes of the past fiscal year:

'I have been blessed,' you reflect. 'My portfolio is diverse, yet strong in all areas. Sickle Moon Steel is having record sales in the mid-west where those new tractors are pulling larger and heavier plows. A bumper cotton crop has made Sun Textiles a real winner in the Carolinas. Clean Arms Chemical just built that new plant in California. And who would have guessed that Crown Petroleum would find so much oil in Oklahoma? Yes, I have been blessed. However, since summer the market seems to be a bit bearish. Perhaps I should just take profits on a few shares and treat the family to a nice Florida vacation for the winter?'

Thursday, October 24, 1929. You are a New York investor floating an economic bubble that’s about to burst. Suddenly caught in the market panic, you use shrewd trading (and a bit of luck) to get rid of as much stock as possible and avoid jumping out any windows.

name: Shape
description: Players create shapes by laying tiles so adjacent colored sections match and then strive to control those shapes in order to score them. This unpublished game has several rule sets in development and was first shown publicly at BGG.CON 2007.

name: Wiki
description: This is a hybrid between Pictionary and Charades. The players spin a wheel to determine if they must draw on paper or act out the idea or phrase stated in a card in a limited time. Score is kept on a board where pawns race to the finish line.
mechanics: Acting, Line Drawing, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: CSz!
description:
CSz! is a card game based on ComedySportz (the interactive improvised comedy show franchise). Each player represents a team of ComedySportz performers (Actletes), each one with their own strengths and weaknesses.

The game is divided into the same rounds performed at ComedySportz shows. Players try to earn modifier points by having their Actletes make funny offers during improv games. Offers can be good or bad, and they can be played by either player on a given Actlete.

At the end of each round, players roll to see who the audience votes for, modifying their die rolls with the points they have accumulated.

The game is designed to recreate the experience involved in putting on a ComedySportz show (not necessarily the experience of a show itself). Actlete cards are based on real performers from various ComedySportz cities around the country.

Each Actlete has 5 attributes, and 11 points to divide up among the attributes (they must be between 1 and 3). Veteran Actletes get an additional point.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Castle Croquetnole
description:
The ingenuity of man has never conceived anything better calculated to bring out all the evil passions of humanity than the so-called game of Croquet. It is not long before every honorable feeling, every dictate of morality has been obliterated. The hoop is the gaping jaws of hades.

Living Age magazine, 1898, quoted in The New Games Treasury, Merilyn Simonds Mohr, 1997

An adaptation of Lewis Carroll's game Castle Croquet. Each player brings his knight out of his castle by playing it through its castle's gate, and 'invading' the other castles with it in the proper sequence. He then re-enters his own castle and hits his tower, while his own guard is 'on duty'. The first player to do so wins.

name: Space Cruiser Yamato
description:
This game makes "Space Cruiser Yamato" of the animated cartoon work a radical.
This game is if Seriesof bandai's boardgame.
this game is a board of the strategy class in the world of Yamato.
This game appear "Battleship, cruiser, destroyer, guided-missile-cruiser, aircraft carrier, fighter, bomber,
and torpedo bomber, etc." .


Components
map 3(590x228)
unit 447
rulebook
Scenario Book
player aid card 1
Ship Log sheet 1
Aircraft Log Sheet 1
dice 2



Yes, it's true. This game DOES make Space Cruiser Yamato of the animated cartoon work a radical.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Clear!
description:
A game for the piecepack.

Equipment:

Each player requires:

* 6 piecepack tiles (doesn’t matter which ones)
* 4 piecepack dice
* 24 coins from one piecepack (all 4 suits, null/2-5/ace each suit)
* opaque bag, cup, or other means of mixing 24 piecepack coins for random drawing

One player is designated the scorekeeper. That person needs:

* notepad and pencil, or some other scorekeeping mechanism
* an additional piecepack tile
* 3 pawns

Object: Score the most points after a predetermined number of rounds (7 rounds makes an excellent game). Object of each round is to be one of the first players to clear your card.

This game is very similar to Bingo in the sense that each player possesses a “card,” which one marks based on a random element. In this case, you are attempting to remove coins based on the roll of 4 dice.

name: City Planning
description:
A game for the piecepack.

Equipment:


1 piecepack
1 standard Go board with two sets of differently colored Go stones (white and black stones are assumed in these rules)
1 opaque bag or bowl from which to draw piecepack coins
Paper and pencil for score keeping


The little village of Fumblebuck, Iowa, is in trouble. It’s currently a small village, but the population is booming and the rich resources of the area are bringing industry and commerce. The mayor of Fumblebuck decides to hire a pair of city planners to help plan and control the growth of his budding metropolis. The city planners know that the one who successfully brings the most balanced development to Fumblebuck will be assured of a long and lucrative political career in the region. So they set about zoning the county for development.

The players are the city planners hired to develop Fumblebuck. They compete with each other to create the best-supported Residential, Agricultural, Commercial, and Industrial zones in which businesses and families can thrive. The game progresses from a relatively unstructured growth in population and resource development in the area of town (placing Go stones on the board), through the establishment of various zones for constraining land usage (placing piecepack tiles on the board), to bringing new businesses, industries, and housing developments to town (placing piecepack coins on the board).

name: Samsara
description: In this multi-player chess-like game, each player has 5 stackable follower pawns that start out along the edges of a wheel-shaped board. Pawns become stronger by winning battles with superior forces, dividing 4 moves between their pawns on each turn. Whoever controls the most pawns when the first player is wiped out is the winner. Players may negotiate deals and form alliances.

name: Tooth and Claw
description:
Tooth and Claw is a set of wargaming rules for hunters of prehistoric animals. One or more players can represent either stone age tribesmen or 19th Century sportsmen hunting after the biggest prey to roam the earth since the last Ice Age.

Weapon tables provide stats for pre-gunpowder weapons, muzzle-loading firearms, breech-loading rifles, and repeating guns.

Animal appearances are determined by encounter tables and their behavior, including attacks, are determined by the game system.

Animal stats include all the saber-tooth cats, prehistoric wolves and bears, mammoths, brontotheriums (rhinos), aurochs (oxen), giganthopithecus (gorillas), and giant birds.

There are 5 scenarios included in this 32 page full colour, self contained booklet.

name: The Martian Gathering
description:
The Martian Gathering brings two armies of Icehouse pyramids with different powers to the battlefield, where their commanders apply their leadership and magical skills through Magic cards to achieve victory.

You need Icehouse pieces for the five colours of Magic: The Gathering plus a clear set if you want to use colourless spells. The game plays fine with the basic set and fewer card colors. Each player also needs 20 Magic cards which fit their anticipated army.

Knowledge of the Magic: the Gathering rules is assumed.

Rules Link
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy

name: Math Wiz
description:
"Math Wiz" is a math puzzle card game for all ages. The game is played by searching through the cards in your hand to create a math problem that equals the target number (the solution) that's shown on top of the draw pile after seven cards are dealt to each player. The more cards a player uses to reach the target number the more points the math problem is worth. If a player finds a way to use all of their cards to reach the target number, the math problem is worth double points. Each card can be used either as a number or arithmetic sign by turning the card. The cards are placed together into a spread to great a number sentence that equals the target number.

Visit website for more information www.rayzorsharpent.com

name: Blackhole
description:
In Blackhole players travel around the board collecting vowels, consonants and combination letters (for example sh, ar, ing). The tension builds as players near the black holes and risk losing all their letters. The first player to travel from the Earth, around our Solar System and back again on the Scoring-Wheel is the winner.

Key features:

For 2, 3, or 4 players or more in pairs.
A game for all ages: fun for families and challenging for adults.
The rules are coded to the symbols on the board and can be learnt in minutes.
Blackhole's new approach to word games using combination letters helps players make longer words more easily.
Adults and students will enjoy the embedded tactics of Blackhole.
The consonants, vowels and combination letters are colour coded. The combinations have a phonic nature [sh ... st ... er ...] and the letter cards can be moved around in front of the player. These features makes the game ideally suitable for dyslexics and those people with learning difficulties. For the first time a word game is accessible to all abilities.
Educational. Blackhole helps children learn new words and improve their spelling.
The winner always emerges in less than an hour.
Players travel around our solar system and Blackhole encourages the development of an interest in the universe.

name: Master Europa 104: Southern Front
description: Master Europa is a complete set of rules and charts replacing those in the games of the Europa series. This module covers the game "War in the Desert" (or the older "Torch", "Western Desert", and "Near East" games). It contains 122 new counters for use with the logistics system.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Master Europa 109: Partisan!
description: Master Europa is a complete set of rules and charts replacing those in the games of the Europa series. This module provides the player with a complete set of rules, Orders of Appearances, and counters to allow the player to simulate the underground war in the West and Balkans from 1940-1945. It contains 570 counters for use with the system.

name: Swimming with Sharks
description:
Swimming with Sharks is a strategy game where players are controlling either Swimmer pieces or Shark pieces. Each player has 5 movement points to spend each turn, divided up among their pieces. The Swimmer side also has a Boat piece. Each piece has a movement cost.

When pieces move, they must go in two directions (like a Knight in Chess). If a piece can move 4 spaces, it can move 1 in one direction and 3 in another, or 2 and 2.

The object for the Swimmers is to have at least one Swimmer make it to shore on the opposite side of the board. The Sharks must prevent all Swimmers from making it.

The Boat is a protector, and as long as a Swimmer is in an adjacent space, a Shark can not take the piece.

There are 3 spaces marked with a Star. When a player moves their piece onto the Star space, they may draw a card.

Cards typically consist of value amounts you can add to your movement for a turn. There are a number of special cards that can affect either or both teams. Players may hold as many cards as they like. Movement cards have no penalty to play, but special cards require the use of some movement points in order to be played.

name: Drop-Xianqi
description:
In this game, one uses Shogi pieces to represent Xiangqi [or in a variant Changgi] pieces or a Xiangqi board. One then incorporates the drop-mechanism of Shogi into the game, with all the restrictions of that game. This makes the games quite different.

Drop Xiangqi is a pure abstract game, basically a variant of Xiangqi played with the same equipment as the standard game and easily different enough to be considered a different game. Basically the pieces in Xiangqi just have the name of the piece written on it in Chinese. So there's a definitely up and down to the piece's orientation.

Ownership of pieces is then marked by whoever has the writing "right-side up" from his point of view. In lieu of moving a piece on the board, a captured piece may be placed on the board instead with the restriction that the piece must have a legal move from its position when placed and that no two pawns owned by the same player can be on the same file.

How this differs from the parent game:
Both are of the chess family of games an they share the game goal. Like the original, it's a pure abstract where the object is to capture the opponent's jade general. The key difference is that the complexity of the board situation does not get reduced during play. All pieces are always in play throughout the game, and so one will never have an end-game with only a few pieces involved. Exchanges don't remove pieces but rather potentially hand of vital material to one's opponent to use against you. Thus, what will be a good move in xiangqi can often be disastrous in drop-xiangqi and vice-versa. (The inspiration here is drawn from shogi.)

Capture the leader abstracts typically reduce to a simple end-game with the exception of shogi family of games. This game offers a complex end-game in a situation so that aplayer can't simply force exchanges to make a simple tactical game.

name: Who, What, Where?
description: This is a game for two teams. Each team takes turns to pick a who card and a what card and has two minutes to describe as many pairs as possible for their team mates to guess. Similar to charades but the player is allowed to talk, so long as they don't use any of the words on the cards. Examples of possible combinations are Hitler getting hit by bird poo and Sean Connery playing a didgeridoo.
categories: Deduction, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Large Hnefatafl
description: This is a traditional Norse tafl game similar to Hnefatafl, of which it may be considered a large variant, but played on a 13x13 grid.

name: World Gauntlet Federation
description: In World Gauntlet Federation you will play one of the 4 races; Elves, Dwarves, Littleings and Humans to be challenged by a series of obstacles that you must overcome with the most style possible. Remember winning isn't everything but pleasing the crown is. You will be able to build you upon your character increasing his or her abilities in-between matches and even get sponsorships to give you special bonuses. To become a WGF champion you'll have to press your luck, show off and steal the glory from your competitors. Can you win on skill alone or will you need the favor of the Queen?
mechanics: Hand Management, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Atelier of Marie
description: Home made card game based on the Japanese game "Atelier of Marie". Each turn, a certain object is supposed to be made, and all players must play 1 card each. If the correct amount of materials is assembled, points are divided up according to who played what materials.

name: Le Tour
description: Belgian cycling game published in the 1960's. The board is formed by several parts, it contains in total 4 straights and 2 corners, it also comes with 13 cyclists (4 teams of 3 cyclists and 1 yellow cyclist for the overall leader). The game is played over 3 stages. Apart from the overall classifying there also is a mountain and team competition.

name: Santa Barbopoly
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

This is NOT typical fundraising Monopoly clone.

This game involves placing different properties in locations around the board. Properties can be bought, sold and traded at different values.

Businesses can be placed in prime real estate 'State Street' or the outer streets.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Normandia: desde o Dia D até Paris
description: Wargame on the Normandy invasion in June 1944 and the breakthrough battles, until the liberation of Paris.

name: Bettsportquartett
description:
25 couples and a "panel of experts" were asked for giving their opinions about 32 sex positions.

Each of those positions have been categorized in five classes:
- Fun factor She
- Fun factor He
- Injury risk
- Back seat suitability
- Porn factor

The game is played according to the standard Quartett rules: A player plays out a card and chooses a specific category. He names the number on his card. If he has a higher number than the opponent, he wins the card, otherwise the opponent will get the card (except for back seat suitability, where the lowest entry wins).

The player who manages to get all 32 cards this way, wins the game.

name: The Flight To Paris
description:
Published right after Charles Lindbergh's flight, the object is to get your "AEROPLANE" from New York to Paris.
Game #4010

name: Pond
description:
This is a two player trick taking game by Michael Schoessow (who also designed the award-winning piecepack/Ice House game Alien City) that can also be played with four players by adding an additional deck of cards and playing in partners.

First each player draws for a poison suit, cards are dealt and then each player secretly selects their profit ranks. Game play consists of two phases, (1) cards are played into the pond, and (2) the trick taking phase. Players attempt to win tricks containing their profit ranks while avoiding cards in their poison suit.

name: MotorChamp Team Set: Cars 18 & 19
description: MotorChamp Team Set (Cars 18 & 19) contains a set of White Formula cars with Red trim (and matching dice). When combined with Team Set (Cars 20 & 21) it allows 5 players to compete (each with a set of 4 cars).

name: MotorChamp Team Set (Cars 20 & 21)
description: MotorChamp Team Set (Cars 20 & 21) contains a set of Green Formula cars with Red trim (and matching dice). When combined with Team Set (Cars 18 & 19) it allows 5 players to compete (each with a set of 4 cars).

name: Frog Pond: Lily Pads of Doom
description:
Frog Pond is an abstract, 2-player game with the theme of frogs on lily pads. The lily pad tiles are arranged in a grid, and each player has a frog token. On your turn, you may move your frog on space orthogonally, and you must slide one row or column of lily pads one space. (You may perform these actions in either order.) When two or more groups of lily pads are formed, such that they are not touching, or only touching by a single corner, the smaller group "sinks" and is removed from the board.

The goal is to sink the opposing frog, while keeping yours afloat.

The game was designed by 9-year-old Sean Allen and self-published at www.frog-pond.com. It was packaged with the expansion: Lily Pads of Doom, in which special powers are printed on the lily pad tiles, which occur when the pad is sunk. (With one exception: the Tar Pit, which takes effect when landed on.) To play without the expansion, you simply ignore the text on the tiles.
mechanics: Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement

name: Canvas & Shot
description:
Canvas & Shot is a simple Napoleonic Naval Miniatures print and play simulation. The accent is on large scale fleet actions and to this end the rules are designed for simplicity & playability without sacrificing authenticity . Each player selects a command chit for individual or groups of ships each turn. There is little book-keeping (only damage) and the action is semi-simultaneous. Ships lists for all major navies are included together with rules for setting up scenarios & a campaign game.

Version 2.3 is now available (March 2018).

2.3 Changelog:
Boarding and melee updated and simplified
2.2 Changelog:
Option for simultaneous movement when no combat is possible.
Alteration to damage rules.

name: Ambush Alley: Motor Pool
description:
Ambush Alley: Motor Pool contains the game statistics for the vehicles of twenty nations, providing players with all the info on nearly any APC, IFV, or AFV likely to be encountered on the world’s modern battlefields. Motor Pool also contains a section that updates and clarifies the core vehicle rules and includes guidelines for writing up vehicles not included in the supplement.

Expands:

Ambush Alley! A Game of Modern Urban Combat
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: The Face of Battle: VC – Commonwealth Expansion Pack
description:
VC is the first The Face of Battle expansion pack. This Commonwealth Expansion Pack includes new rules for British, Canadian, New Zealand, Australian and other Allied Commonwealth nations. The pack includes 12 detailed scenarios and 3 mini-campaign games covering Normandy, Dieppe and Crete. All Commonwealth vehicles from every theatre of operation are listed. The expansion includes chapter G Mini-Campaign rules, chapter V Commonwealth, 12 scenarios, 3 mini-campaigns, new smoke templates, new cards, weapon and ordnance data, over 170 Commonwealth vehicles, equipment lists, TO&E, and much more.

Period: WW2, all theatres, 1939 - 1945
Scope: skirmish, squad level
Figure Scale: 15mm to 28mm, 1 to 1 scale
Figure Basing: individually based figures
Ground Scale: 1" = 2 metres

What's Inside:
Chapter G Mini-Campaigns
Chapter V Commonwealth Nations
12 scenarios
3 mini-campaigns (Normandy, Dieppe, Crete)
170 vehicle descriptions
Commonwealth equipment lists
Commonwealth TO&E
new sniper cards
new event cards
6" smoke templates
