3 hole punched for North America Binder
5 hole punched for A4 Binder
and more...
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Barbie in the 12 Dancing Princesses
description:
From the game box:

The King has been poisoned! Help Genevieve enter the enchanted forest to retrieve the magical water, then race back to the castle to save her father!

This is a simple roll-and move children's game for ages 4+ based on the Barbie in the 12 Dancing Princesses movie.
No reading is required, and my little girl likes it.
categories: Children's Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Beware of the Cat!
description:
"Get all your mice to their cheese without being ejected by the cat!"

When the cat naps, the mice play, but at any moment the cat may wake up and swipe a mouse off the board. The first player to get all four of his mice onto his cheese wins the game.

This is a cat-and-mouse themed Pachisi variation for children with shortened track and electronic cat that randomly "wakes up", spins around then swings his paw at a space on the track, knocking off any mouse on that spot (sending them back to start). Two outer loops are available that are safe from the cat but add several spaces to the trip.

name: God's Acre
description:
Rules for wargames in the Early Medieval Period, 100 -1300 A.D. These rules borrow many of their mechanisms from the Wargames Research Ancients rules. The scale is 1 figure equals 20 men, one inch equals ten yards, and one turn equals approximately 30 seconds of elapsed time.

Troop types are classified by armor protection, formation, social order and experience, and weapons. For example, an 11th century Norman knight would be classified as HC (heavy cavalry), Order (slightly loose formation), K (knights, very high on the social/experience scale), and light lance (used overarm, not couched).

One interesting aspect of the rules is that it includes a section of guidelines for modifying troop performance based on campaign factors. For example, if troops have force marched, been previously defeated by their opponent, are out of supply, they will suffer minus factors to their die rolls for testing morale, missile fire, and melee resolution.

The rules include four pages of army lists that provide sample ratings for troop types by nationality.

Despite being almost 40 years old, God's Acre is still a good game system based on solid "Old School" mechanics for miniature gaming.

name: Moon Dragon: Birds of Prey
description:
Expansion kit for Moon Dragon.

Includes:

New factions - Alpha Colony, Lunar Freedom Alliance
New weapons for fighters
Ground Defenses
Pilot Characteristics
Mission Builder rules
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Big Big Battles: Crawly Combat
description:
An all-ages miniatures game. The game is played using coloring book style paper craft miniatures that are assembled and colored by the players. Crawly Combat is the first series of Big Big Battles miniatures and focuses on the imaginary battles between teams insects and other small animals.

Unique to Big Big Battles - Crawly Combat is that players chose a “base” at the start of the game. The base determines how a player can build a team, what a player can do on their turn, and establishes a victory condition/scenario for that player.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: The Rock Cycle
description:
RULES (for 3 or 4 players)

AIM: To collect and arrange five cards in "rock cycle" order. Cards represent
rocks and geological processes, these must be collected and displayed in the
right order depending on the Rock Cycle (see below). Each single card tells
what are the preceding and the following cards.

The "Burial: heat-pressure" card is very important as it allows the transformation
of a sedimentary/igneous rock into a metamorphic one. It is essential that the
preceding card and the following card are logically ordered. The exact sequence
is described in the "Burial: heat-pressure" card. That means that if you have
"Granite", you have to link it to "Gneiss" and nothing else.
N.B. Chalk should be treated as Limestone (i.e. changes into "Marble").

1- Shuffle cards and deal 5 each. Place the remaining deck, face-down, at the
centre of the table; reveal the first card and place it "face up" next to the deck.
2- Players have to arrange the five cards in "rock cycle" order: each player
have to decide, according to the cards in his/her hand, which "section" of
the Rock Cycle would be more convenient to build upon. Players should not
reveal their cards.
3- In turn, clockwise, each player pick either the top card from the deck or the
face-up card next to it. Then he/she has to discard one card; this will be placed
face-up next to the deck. Once the card has been discarded, the next player can
pick a card and so on.
4- When a player has put all five cards in order he/she will reveal them all and,
if the other players acknowledge the right order, he/she is the winner.

name: Beruchte Casino Spel
description:
Beruchte Casino Spel is a simple roll-and-move game in which players try to win all the money on the table and get his/her opponents broke.

The game is played on a roulette board, using a spinner. Players move on the board, where some numbers require special actions.

Contents: 1 board, 1 die, 6 pawns, 140 money bills, rules.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Environment
description:
The Environment Game

Overview:

Goal: To collect and arrange 2 triplets of cards, both in the following order:
"Environmental Problem" - "Consequence" - "Solution".

The above are also the three card suits. Each single card tells what are the cards it should be associated with. A few cards can be used as wild cards. Some cards contain a "Fact" information. These rules refer to a full round (game). If time allows, more rounds can be played and a tournament could be set up. Points can be collected at the end of each round.

name: Decay
description:
A changing landscapes game for the piecepack. Attack other players and make it harder for them to move, or slowly destroy the board.

The players create a game board from the piecepack tiles. They pay coins to move their pawn, and tiles around to attack other players. Attacks can steal coins from other players, or chop off sections of the board, making the game board smaller. If your pawn is on a board section that is removed, or you cannot move your pawn during your turn, then you are killed and removed from play. Last player remaining on the board wins!

http://www.piecepack.org/rules/Decay.pdf

name: Delegate Dash
description:
Delegate Dash, a game for 2-4 players, uses all the parts of a standard piecepack. Players are candidates of the Piecepack Party, seeking its nomination for President of the Republic. They campaign state-by-state over five rounds of votes, trying to win at least 305 out of 608 delegates. Sometimes the game-ending convention brings a surprise!

Senator North (blue), Governor East (red), Representative South (green), and General West (black) compete against each other in 5 campaign rounds to gain delegates, which will be sent to the Piecepack Party Convention (fyi -- all of these candidates compete, regardless of the number of players.) Whichever candidate has 305 delegates by the end of the convention wins -- which may even be a non-player candidate!

Available at:
http://www.piecepack.org/rules/DelegateDash.pdf

name: Moneycents
description:
Players race around the board, collecting and paying money as they go. Along the way, they will undertake basic money transactions, such as making change or summing combinations of coins. Trivia questions along the way ask players to solve money math problems in order to earn more cash.

The player with the most money at the end of the game wins.

name: Begird
description:
Begird is played on a hexagonally tessellated board surrounded by an odd multiple of three perimeter islands. The object is to form a group of your own stones such that:
1. Your group connects to at least three islands.
2. The shortest possible sequence of islands that contains your three islands essentially surrounds more than half of the board.

The game of Y is a special case of Begird. When the number of islands is the minimum allowable, three, Begird is Y.

name: Very Civile Actions!
description:
A variant of The Perfect Captain's Spanish Fury, Actions! game system of warfare in 16th century Europe, adapted for recreating battles of the English Civil War, 1639-1651.

The variant adds units for the Parliamentarians, Royalists, and Scots. Also added, and common to both armies, are seasoned troops, trained bands, dragoons, firelocks, and clubmen.

name: Sakkara
description:
"A strategic adventure game. You have to reach the center of the pyramid 3 times - for this adventure you have 3 different pieces with different features. On your way you find bridges helping you to get closer to your aim, because only over a bridge you get to the next level. Each time you reach the center, the gods give you more power. But be careful: the other players can send you back to the entrance, take away bridges to another place or reach the Ankh before you..."

Components: gameboard, 12 pieces in 4 colors, 4 Horus cards, 4 ankh cards, 7 bridges.

name: World War I
description:
WORLD WAR I
ww.educationalcards.net
ULES (for 3 or 4 players)
AIM: To collect and arrange six Nation-related card events in chronological order.
Each player represents a Nation and must collect cards whose events are relevant
to their Nation. The timeline must contain the following suits:
One "Pre-War Event" card (Purple cards) - Four "War Event" cards (Orange cards) -
One "Post-War Event" card (Green cards).
Each single card displays the points per Nation. These can be zero to three, where
zero indicates that the event is not very relevant to that Nation and three indicates
that the event is very relevant or decisive. Points are found below the original flags.
Dates are found below the card title. These are usually "month-year" (e.g. March 1915)
but some dates are more 'flexible' and embrace a larger period of time (e.g. April-May 1915,
1915-1917, etc.). All cards contain a "Fact" information.
These rules refer to a full round (game). If time allows, more rounds can be played
and a tournament could be set up. Points are collected at the end of each round

name: Tinker Fox
description:
A miniatures rules system designed to recreate garrison warfare in the English Midlands during the English Civil War.

"What we wanted to do in Tinker Fox was to drop you into the boots of a Governor of a district in the English Civil War. A Governor does more than fight battles. He must first and foremost follow his masters’ orders. They are usually vague, and it is up to him to come up with a plan to implement them. He must then try to get his subordinates to carry out his detailed instructions. Unfortunately they often have their own agendas and personalities that he must deal with. He must also run an extensive civil government, which is not directly simulated, but is represented by delays and obstructions they naturally cause to military matters."

"Tinker Fox will generate numerous and varied types of battles with whatever troops are present in the campaign. These can be replayed using our new Very Civile Actions! cards now available as a variant for Spanish Fury, Actions! Let the games begin!"

The components consist of a rulebook, quick reference data sheet, unit control sheet, mapsheet and a set of counters.
categories: Civil War, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: AirWar: C21 (2nd Edition)
description:
From the publisher's website:

AirWar C21 (2nd edition)makes the complex subject of modern air combat so disgustingly simple that it is ideal for beginners and experienced gamers alike. After a couple of games reference to the rule book will become occassional with players concentrating on shooting down their opponents rather than ploughing through the sub-minutiae of clauses and appendices.

Includes:
Rules for aircraft characteristics movement, special manoeuvres, dog fighting and air-to-air missiles.
Optional rules for ground attack, surface-to-air fire, spotting, ejection and crashing.
ratings for 114 modern aircraft from the Chengdu Jianjiji-7A to the F-35B JSF, plus 92 AAM's, 59 SAM's, 5 gunpods, 72 anti-ground weapons and 26 AAA weapons.

A re-implemintation of AirWar: C21 Lite

Expanded by


AirWar: C21 Data Annex
AirWar: C21 Max Edition

name: AirWar: C21 Data Annex
description:
From the publisher's website:

The AirWar: C21 Data Annex is a downloadable PDF supplement for AirWar: C21 (2nd edition) available exclusively from Wargaming Online. The supplement repalces the statistical tables in the standard rulebook with more aircraft, AAMs, bombs etc.

Includes:
Statistics for 358 aircraft from the IA58 Pucara to F-117A Nighthawk.
Statistics for 112 AAMs, 10 gunpods, 120 AGWs, 81 SAMs and 44 AAA weapons.

Not a stand-alone game, it expands AirWar: C21 (2nd Edition)
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Hau ruck!
description: The 24 lovely picture cards of this game are telling 8 depicted mini-stories (each within a sequence of 3 cards). You play with as many sequences as players are taking part (4-8). At the beginning of a game the redundant cards are sorted out and the rest is shuffled well. Each player gets 3 cards on hand. By shifting simultaneously one card to the left neighbor the players try to get first a complete sequence. When this happens to you, grab quickly and secretly a chip from the table. The other players immediately also catch a chip. Only the last and slowest player gets nothing, and a new game begins. After some turns (at least as many as playing members) the player with most chips wins.

name: Obstsalat
description:
48 cards are shuffled, and each player gets 6 cards. One card is put face-up on the table. The cards contain up to 6 different fruit. The turn player has to put down one card onto the open file.
When the open card shows: 3 bananas, 3 strawberries and 3 pineapples, the player must have a card with at least 4 bananas or 3 strawberries or 3 pineapples.
The winner is the player who gets rid of his/her cards first.

name: Hopsi
description: Many rabbits hide themselves in the colorful flower meadow. Also foxes are hidden there though ... and secret subsurface ways. You must try to find the 4 rabbits of your own color and bring them home into their stable. The player who has rummaged up his 4 rabbits first wins the game.

name: Tornado Alley
description:
Several storm cells bear down on the town of Doomsville, Oklahoma (population 213). Each contains an F1 tornado that will grow in strength and carve its own path of destruction. Do what you have always wanted to...take control of one of nature's most dangerous forces: the tornado! Using your twister, destroy as much of the town of Doomsville and the surrounding countryside as you can - do a better job than the other players and win the game!

To win, you will need to properly control the path of the tornado and manage its strength so that destroy high value buildings. Some buildings can only be destroyed by extremely strong F5 tornadoes, while others can be wiped out with only an F2. You will manage the strength and path using a pool of "storm points". Each player starts with the same amount, but as you use them to plan your actions, the pools for each tornado will change accordingly.

Doomsville rebuilds itself for each game; meaning that for each game there is a method for randomly building the town and the surrounding countryside. This makes each game play distinctly different and puts the tornadoes into a fight to get the higher value buildings before their opponents.

So what are you waiting for...? Get to wiping Doomsville off the map!

NOTE: This game was inspired a couple of months after a small twister (F0 probably) tore up some trees in my yard in July 2006 and discussing it with my son. Tornadoes are very dangerous and interesting facts and safety information about tornadoes will be included in the game.
mechanics: Action Points, Modular Board, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Pip
description:
PIP- The Ultimate Domino Game. A Distinctively different domino game. Challenging fun for the entire family!

There's a challenge with every play! By using our unique Wild Tiles designs and Directional Tiles, we have combined traditional dominoes with a different theme to provide an exciting change of pace. Strategy and luck are also in play with each round as players compete to be the first to play their last remaining tile.

Double 9 domino game plus 11 wild Pips, and four directional tiles which cause skip, reverse, play again, and draw action. 70 Standard Size (1" x 2" x 3/8") tiles in vinyl, snap case, with wooden centerpiece. 2-6 players.

name: Gold Hat Card Game
description: This game is a parody of the Fleet Captain’s Gold Hat Championship at Origins. The game reflects the final four rounds, although players could agree ahead of time to play all seven rounds (or any number of rounds). Each player draws opponents and plays various cards on themselves or the other players in an attempt to reach the gold hat before anyone else. The game is intended for 4-6 players and is extremely tongue-in-cheek, concentrating more on the humorous aspects of the game instead of the serious. It is not the intent of the designers or publishers to insult anyone but only to provide an entertaining distraction between four hour long tournament games.

name: Sherlock Holmes: The Fenian Murders
description:
SHERLOCK HOLMES AND THE FENIAN MURDERS

Terrorism was nothing new in 19th century England. Irish Fenian rebels plotted violence in England and abroad. Now Sherlock Holmes has been called in to investigate the death of two women at a country estate. It has all the markings of the Fenians. Players make up the clues that Holmes finds. Truth must be revealed.

This is an Engle Matrix Game so each player champions one of the characters of the story. Each turn they buy the right to make up the next clue discovered. This is not automatic though. The player picks another player to decide what their "to happen" roll is. Other players may jump in with counter-arguments forcing a big dice rolling contest. Players try to pin the murder on one another. It never plays the same way twice because people make up different clues each time.

The Fenian Murders uses the same rules as The Case of the Dead Duke. If you like murder mystery then you’ll love this game.

This is an intermediate level Matrix Game. It comes in a box with a 20x15 inch hard board map, character sheet book, rules book, scenario book, wooden counters, plastic gold coins and 2 dice.

TYPE: Intermediate Engle Matrix Game
PLAYERS: 2 to 10
AGE: 12 to adult
DURATION: 2 hours
COMPLEXITY: Moderate
REPLAYABILITY: High
COST: $40.00
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Phase Order

name: Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde
description:
DR JEKYLL AND MR HYDE

Jekyll and Hyde are locked in a never ending struggle for control. It is not only the control of a real monster – Hyde – but also the hidden monster – Jekyll’s addiction to his drug. The players work to uncover Hyde’s wickedness while also exploring Jekyll’s irresistible urge to let Hyde out. It cannot end well.

This is an Engle Matrix Game so players champion one of the characters of Stevenson's original story. Each turn they pick a question from the game board and answer it. This advances the story but no action is automatic! Players pick another player to be their referee. The ref sets the "to happen" roll. Other players may jump in with counter-arguments forcing a dice rolling contest. Bit by bit events add up to a unique story every time.

Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde is a boxed boardgame. It includes a 20x15 inch game map, a rules book and example of play, and action tokens and a die.

TYPE: Beginner Engle Matrix Game
PLAYERS: 2 to 8
AGE: 12 to adult
DURATION: ½ hour
COMPLEXITY: Moderate
REPLAYABILITY: High
COST: $20.00
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Phase Order

name: Evil Wizard School: The Final Lesson
description:
EVIL WIZARD SCHOOL

The old wizard is near death. Before he dies he will teach his final lesson, the lesson that shows his deepest magic. Whoever receives this lesson will be the next master. The player’s represent the students and faculty of the school. They will scheme and back stab to be the one who gets that lesson. Everyone wants it. This allows you to find out how far they will go to gain power.

Evil Wizard School is built on the idea that wizards are extremely jealous and treat their students like dung. They don’t teach them so they remain weak longer. It is loosely based on what it is like to be in graduate school.

This is an intermediate level Matrix Game. It comes in a box with a 21x16 inch hard board map, character cards, laminated rules, wooden counters and plastic gold coins. It does not include dice.

TYPE: Intermediate Engle Matrix Game
PLAYERS: 2 to 10
AGE: 12 to adult
DURATION: 2 hours
COMPLEXITY: Moderate
REPLAYABILITY: High
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Phase Order

name: Froschkönig
description: The player, who finds the most jewels, becomes new Frog King. Whoever watches well and can memorize much, has a good chance finish the game sitting on the kings' throne.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Dice, Fantasy, Memory

name: U.Dub.Opoly
description:
From the manufacturer:

Real Dawgs Wear Purple!
Go Huskies! Woof! Woof! Frosh Pond, Harry, Suzzallo Library, and By George are up for sale in this game designed for alumni, students and fans of the University of Washington. Husky Stadium is a mere $270! Bargains like this won’t last long. Choose your token and advance to Register and Proceed. Who knows? You may soon be marching in the Husky Marching Band…or you may be sent home on Academic Probation!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: NC-Backgammon
description:
This unique variation on Backgammon called Zarsiz Tavla in Turkish has no luck to it. It uses a unique system of players alternating turns picking one die facing, and their opponent picking the second, in order to determine moves. The end result is a player is left with a die facing they picked, and the other their opponent picked. Players are allowed to use the die they picked twice, as a roll, several times during the game to act as a rolling doubles.

Full Information on the game can be obtained here:
http://zarsiztavla.gop.edu.tr/index-e.htm

The rules are under how to play.

name: Geomancy
description:
Geomancy is the practice of divination through tossing dirt. Perhaps in the same fashion, we can learn more about the world around us by tossing plastic pyramids. Through playing, the subject learns to communicate with the plastic pyramids within.

Geomancy is an Icehouse game played with one stash per player and a chessboard.

Geomancy is played in three rounds. In the first round, players take turns casting all of their small stones. The second round is all about casting medium stones. Finally, the game is concluded by casting out the large stones. While some players are recasting, other players are reorienting their pyramids. The goal is to cast and orient in a way that you can capture the other players stones. Points are awarded for your stones on the field at the end of the game along with the stones you have captured.

Complete rules can be found at the Icehouse Games Wiki.

Game System

Icehouse Pieces

name: Breakthrough
description:
Breakthrough is an icehouse game designed to be played on a chess board with 2 players, each needing 1 stash. The objective is to be the first player to move one of his pieces to the opposite end of the board.

Each player sets up his pyramids as desired on their back 2 rows of squares.

On a player's turn, he may move one pyramid one space.

i. Small pyramids may move and capture diagonally forward.

ii. Medium pyramids may move straight forward or diagonally forward, and they capture diagonally forward.

iii. Large pyramids may move straight forward, straight backward or diagonally forward, and they capture diagonally forward.

c. Captured pyramids are removed from play

name: Mercenary Air Squadron World War II: Mediterranean Theater of Operations
description:
In 1936, as the Spanish Civil War heated up, representatives of Spanish Republicans began hiring American pilots to fight in the war. The Yankee Squadron, led by Bert Acosta, fought Franco’s White planes. Each pilot was paid $1,500 a month and a bonus of $1,000 for each enemy plane shot down.

In MAS-WWII:MTO, we take that idea and run with it. You can form a squadron at anytime from just before the start of World War II to the end of 1943 and see if you can prosper from the chaos.

We begin by focusing on the Mediterranean Theater of Operations. With access to Commonwealth, French, German, and Italian aircraft, players can get their MAS up and running by fighting in one of the most turbulent theaters of action.


MAS-WWII:MTO is the first product in a series that takes the fun and excitement of Mercenary Air Squadron and transplants into the era of World War II. Ownership of Mercenary Air Squadron is required to fully utilize MAS-WWII:MTO

Expands:

Mercenary Air Squadron
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Castillo
description: The aim of the game is to bring as many of your own round stones as possible on to the topmost platform of the pyramid. The game is over as soon as 5 stones are on this platform. The player with the most pawns on top wins the game.

name: Puppy Surprise!
description:
From the publisher:

"Find Puppy's Friends before the party ends!

Players take turns rolling the die and matching cards to "find" all the party guests. If you roll puppy's party, you cannot make a match and the party begins. The winner is the first to player to make 5 matches before the party ends! No reading skill required. Contents: 26 cards, die, game rules in English and French."
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Dice

name: Spider-Man and Friends Hide 'n Seek Card Game
description: This is a memory and matching game for preschool/early elementary age children with the theme of Spider-Man and his friends (including friendly looking Hulk and Wolverine). Memory/matching utilizes the characters, shapes, colors, and numbers. Different rule sets for basic and advanced versions, including the use of "clue" cards.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Memory

name: A Batalha do Passo do Rosário
description:
Free print and play wargame in Strategos #3. It can be downloaded from the Riachuelo website. This small game a battle between Brazilian imperial troops against Argentinian/Orientales (former Uruguay's inhabitants), in Rio Grande do Sul (state of south of the Brazil).

Features a 8.5" x 11" map of mainly very uneven terrain, 50 counters, and concise rules, terrain and combat tables in Portuguese.

Victory Conditions are determined by accumulation of Victory Points for eliminating cavalry, leaders, and artillery scored at the end of 7 turns.
A player is awarded a Tactical Victory if by the last turn, he has scored 7 more VPs than his opponent. He wins a Decisive Victory if by the last turn, he has scored 15 more VPs than his opponent.
Any other result is a tie.

name: Pinguin Cup
description:
Content:
board, 8 wooden penguins, 5 dice

Each player tries to run through a water landscape with ice floes as fast as possible and to reach the finish fields first. 2 dice give the approximate direction. The last penguin in the round may set back other further in front sitting penguins by using the ice bear. Drifting ice can change the whole game. When a player reaches one of the three finish fields with his penguin, he wins the Penguin Cup.

name: Zahlenluchs
description: Players place numbered tiles on the table. If they recognize certain mathematical patterns in the tiles on the table, they can put tokens on them. The player who can get rid of his or her tokens first, wins the game.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Silly Expressions
description:
It's fun with grins and frowns as the whole family gets into this nutty game. Match your face with your game cards for miles of smiles.

A children's game that has a player drawing a card with a funny expression on it. The player then has to match their expression with the one on the card (optionally using the provided mirror to make sure they have it right). The other players must look at the players face and try to find the expression on the game board.

name: Piraten-Joe
description:
Don't be the last to perform the action indicated by the die roll (such as clapping when the cannon icon is rolled), or you have to draw a scar on your face. Make a mistake and you get a scar, too! Five scars and you're out!

Contents: 4 eye patches, 4 gold coins, 1 pirate die, 1 make-up pencil.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Dice, Pirates

name: Home Golf
description:
From the Publisher's site:

The world’s most realistic golf game for the whole family.

Home Golf is a board game where you play golf like you do on a real course.
A 9-hole golf course with activity and fun for the whole family.
You choose direction and target for your ball using one of the 4 different golfers.

Nothing is accidental. It is all up to you and you don’t need golf experience.

name: Dumbass! expansion #1
description:
A ten-card supplement for Dumbass!. Or a thousand cards. Your choice. Using an Infinite Armies-like interface, you can enter any text, icon or border combination you want to each of the ten cards (including Secrets), and when you print them they will be indistinguishable from those in the main game.

It's billed as the only Dumbass! supplement you'll ever need...

Expands:

Dumbass!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Word Game

name: Corps d'Armée
description: Corps d'Armée is a Tactical level Napoleonic miniatures rules-system designed for larger scale battles using minimum division sized, preferably corps/larger forces. Figure scale of 1 casting representing 50/60 men; 1 artillery model represents 2 guns; ground scale 1 mm = 2 yds.

name: Playoff Hockey
description:
A simple game that has a small wooden block with a painted surface that resembles an ice hockey rink as the playing surface, and contains holes for a peg that represents the puck. Players roll three special dice, one for passing, one for shooting and another face-offs. Each die has different outcomes displayed on each side.

Players can choose the length of game themselves.

Comes in a clear 4x3 box, and so is good for travel.

Ages 7 and up

name: Speiderpatruljene
description:
A cardgame for 3-5 players somewhat similair to Elfer Raus, but you have only cards from 1 to 10 in five suits (you use one suit pr. player) and that you can only play max. one card from your hand each turn.

Together with Cachons (and maybe Stopp), Speiderpatruljen is one of the classic card games from Damm.

name: Night of the Blood Suckers
description:
In the dead of night he wanders the streets of Hope County, searching for helpless prey. He is a ruthless, blood-sucking vampire looking for fresh blood and he has until dawn to suck Hope County dry…

In this Print and Play Card Game for 2 to 5 players, you will take the role of one of 5 possible victims as you attempt to survive until dawn, without being bitten and becoming a bloodsucker yourself.

When the deck has been exhausted, any players who have not been turned to vampires win the game, but just maybe you could kill the head Vampire before the night is over.

The game rules and all of the cards you need to play can be purchased from the website below, however you will need to supply 20 six sided dice (4 per player).

http://www.wargamedownloads.com/item.php?item=661

name: Professor Noggin's History of Canada
description:
Travel back in time and learn about Canada's colourful history. From the First Peoples of North America to Pierre Trudeau, from the CPR to the Great Depression, this game is a snapshot of Canadian history.

Card.topics.include:
The_Battle_for_Quebec
The Building of Canada
Canada is Discovered
Canada's First Prime Minister
Canadian Firsts
Canadian Pacific Railway
Confederation
Disaster
Early Conflicts
Early Explorers
Early Settlements
Explorations in Space
Exploring the West Coast
Famous Canadians
Famous Inventions
Famous Politicians
First Peoples of Canada
(Card A)
First Peoples of Canada
(Card B)
Fur Trade
Gold Fever
Great Depression
History of Canadian Sports (Card A)
History of Canadian Sports (Card B)
Life Before Confederation
Place in Order
Royal Canadian Mounted Police
Settling the West
Women in History
World War One
World War Two
publishers: Éditions Gladius International, Inc., Outset Media

name: American Battlelines
description:
American Battlelines is a set of miniatures rules for the time period of 1775 through 1865. The mechanics are based around stands, so any figures from 2mm up can be used. The scale is 1"=25 yds., and 1 stand = 60-80 men.

During each turn, both sides roll for initiative. The player winning initiative must then activate one unit. Players then alternate activating units until all units have been activated. Activating a unit allows the unit to take one Double Action, or to take one Movement Action and one Standard Action (in either order).

Movement Actions: Move, Recover, Reform, Retire, Retreat
Standard Actions: Fire, Rally, Reload, Search for Ammo
Double Actions: Careful Fire, Charge, Tactical Move, Withdraw
categories: American Civil War, American Indian Wars, American Revolutionary War, American West, Miniatures, Wargame

name: PANIC!
description:
'DO YOU HAVE THE NERVE TO PLAY?'

The game board consists of a continuous track with either a number or a stop sign printed on most squares. The center is dominated by the plastic PANIC BOX, a Russian Roulette type contraption with six levers, one of which opens the lid at any given time. The lid has a slot to accept TROUBLE DISCS and there is a wheel on the side of the box which changes the active lever when rotated. The six SOLUTION CARDS are placed face down on the board.

Players are given a PANIC CARD and 20 TROUBLE DISCS at the start of the game. These discs must be disposed of, either into the PANIC BOX or to opponents during game play, to view a face-down SOLUTION CARD. Movement is by the throw of 2 standard dice. If a '1' is thrown a lever on the PANIC BOX must be pressed. If the lid opens the player must take all the TROUBLE DISCS inside to a maximum of 20. The PANIC BOX is reset, closed and play recommences.

The first player to match a SOLUTION CARD to the PANIC CARD they hold is the winner of the game.

name: Lavellum
description:
Lavellum is a deep word game for two players, which can be played with paper-and-pencil and in which chance plays no role. A brief summary of the game:

2 players take turns forming words on an initially empty grid. On your turn, first you think of a set of letters, and then you repeatedly add this same set of letters to the board to form words, Scrabble-style, until you run out of ways to add them (There can never be duplicates of the same word on the board.) Your score for the turn is the number letters in your set times the number of words you formed with them. On your next turn you think of another set of letters and do it all over again. The game ends when both players pass and the player with the most points wins. There’s some other stuff, like challenge rules for made up words, a limit on the number of times you can use the letter S, and a pie-rule for the first turn of the game, but that’s the gist of it.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Print & Play, Word Game

name: Wonder Number
description: This is both a set of 10 games and a math learning system. The games use a color coded number board which illustrates many mathematical concepts such as place value, primes, factoring, square numbers, multiples and more. Chips are placed bingo-style on the color-coded 10x10 board numbered 1-100. The games vary in difficulty and can be played Ages 4 and up.

name: F-Cartes
description:
F-Cartes is a game for 2 to 10 people that simulates Formula On races with cards.

There are four type of cards: Events, spaces, cars, and teams

The game may by played in 6, 12 or 24 rounds.

name: Proletarians, To Horse!
description:
Army lists and rules amendments for Square Bashing 1914-1918 miniature rules to include battles of the Russian Civil War. A total of 26 different army lists is included. Additional rules include things like propaganda offensives and gunboats.

Expands:

Square Bashing 1914-1918
categories: Civil War, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I

name: War Between the States
description:
The War Between the States is a basic rendition of the conflict in the United States between 1861 and 1865.

The 22" x 34" board covers the area of conflict.
Using a simple combat system of highest die roll, this game offers a twist: cards are gained by successful combat between players and the cards gained offer players advantages or create disadvantages for the opponent.

Two to six people may play allowing for inter side conflict as to offensives, reinforcements, etc.

Victory is determined by occupying the 5 major cities of the South by April 1865.

name: Alpha Centauri
description:
A card game based on the Sid Meier computer game of the same name.

The game is played with a custom card deck composed of the following types of cards: Events, Technologies, Structures, Special Projects, Landmarks, Proposals, and Social Engineering. Tokens and markers are used to keep track of Bases (cities), Units (military forces), and Credits (income).

Six social factors, also referred to as scores, are tracked for each player’s Faction: Population, Economics, Research, Military, Ecology, and Espionage. These factors are used to determine victory.

There are four types of victory defined in the game: Diplomatic, Economic, Conquest, and Transcendence. The first player to achieve any one of these victory conditions wins the game.

name: Asterix: The Hunt
description: The game is played on an 8x8 grid or chess board. The center four spaces represent a Gaul Village where the players start. The remaining sixty spaces are randomly filled with map tiles representing terrain and objects. The players earn Victory Points by bringing Mistletoe, Menhir, and Boar Tiles back to the Village. Landing on a Roman Cohort also scores Victory Points.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Carriers
description:
“Board & card game for 2 players. World War Naval/Air II theme. Abstract Fleet & Squadron level combat. Each figure represents a group of Ships or Planes. Victory: You win if you destroy your opponent’s carriers.”

The game is played on a chessboard or any other 8x8 grid. Miniatures or counters are used to represent the units, which come in four types: Carriers, Warships, Subs, and Planes. A custom deck of cards is central to the play of the game. The players draw a hand of cards from a common deck. Card play determines when units may move, attack, or defend.
categories: Card Game, Nautical, World War II

name: Endless Patrol
description:
“Solo card game. WWII Western Front. Player controls a squad of American GI’s on patrol. Fight German units.”

“The Decks: There are 2 separate decks: The GI Deck and the Patrol Deck. They have separate discard piles.”

“The Squad: Your squad has 15 soldiers. Use tokens to keep track of soldiers.”

“Victory: Get completely through the Patrol Deck. You lose if all of your squad members become casualties.”
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Fokker
description:
“WWI Biplane dog fighting. Get in your Sopwith Camel and take out some Albatrosses. 1 plane per player.” Statistics are provided for four aircraft: Sopwith Camel, Bristol F2b, Fokker D-VII, and Albatros C-V.

The game is played on a hex map. A custom deck of 52 cards is used to regulate combat and maneuvers. The Move Cards provide for left and right turns, hard turns, “slides”, and an Immelman loop.

Aircraft can shoot at any time during their movement by playing a Shoot Card. Aircraft with forward firing guns attack aircraft that are straight ahead, while those with a rearward firing observer can shoot at aircraft in a 60 degree arc of hexes to the rear of the plane. Damage is determined by a die roll modified based on range, which may result in 0 or less damage (indicating a miss).

A Critical Hits occurs when a 1 is rolled on the six-sided die rolled to determine damage. Critical Hits include the death of the observer or pilot, engine damage, critical structural or control damage, and fuel leakage.

The game also includes simple rules for altitude, ammunition, clouds, balloons, and ground fire (infantry, machine gunners, and flak.)
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid

name: Green Plastic Massacre
description:
“Combat rules for plastic Army men."

"Armies start at opposite ends of the room. Turn Sequence: Each figure gets to move once and attack once per turn. Mortars, machine guns & artillery can either move or attack during a turn.”

Several different combat resolution mechanisms are included in the rules. The mechanism to be used depends on the nature of the attacking unit. For instance, a submachinegun attack is resolved as follows: “Standing 15 feet away from the target throw 3 marbles simultaneously.” On the other hand, for a flamethrower: “Stand over the attacker. Drop a tennis ball from the tip of your nose.”

In addition, a six-sided die is rolled to determine what means is used to resolve hand-to-hand attacks between infantry units within two inches of each other. The die roll may call for these conflicts to be resolved by means such as arm wrestling, a staring contest, or rock-paper-scissors.

The “Safety Rules” note that players should wear goggles at all times.

name: Gangs of New York Skirmish
description:
“Dead Rabbits vs Bowery Boys. Simulation of an all out Street Melee between two rival NY urban gangs circa 1864. Victory: Kill your opponents Leader.”

The game is played on a 6x8 grid (it may be convenient to use a portion of a chess board). Miniatures or counters are used to represent the combatants. Each player starts with sixteen units: one Leader, seven Axers, and eight Knifers.

Each turn both players roll five six-sided dice. Each die result corresponds to one of six possible moves listed on the Result chart (such as “1 - One knifer may kill an opponent in an orthogonally adjacent space” or “5 - Move one of your men two spaces in any direction.”) The players alternate using one die result to make a move. After both players have used their five dice, the next turn begins and the process is repeated.

name: Freebooter
description:
“Adventure on the High Seas in the Golden Age of Piracy.”

The players are pirates seeking to be the first to retrieve the treasure at the center of the board and return it to the start space. The board is a 7x7 grid made into a path which spirals toward the center. The route is filled with plenty of hardships and hostile warships. In addition, the pirates are constantly pursued by Bounty Hunter ships, privateers under the service of the King.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Five Armies
description:
“Board & card game for 2 players. Battle between the Free Peoples & the Goblinfolk for control of Smaug’s treasure at the end of the Hobbit (by JRR Tolkein). Each figure represents a warband of many troops. Victory: You win if you kill off 10+ of your opponents units.”

The game is played on a chessboard or any other 8x8 grid. Miniatures or counters are used to represent the combat units – Dwarves, Elves, Men and Eagles for the Free Peoples, and Trolls, Orcs, Goblins and Wargs for the Goblinfolk. Each player starts with a set force of sixteen units. A custom deck of cards is central to the play of the game. The players draw a hand of cards from this shared deck. Card play determines when units may move, attack, or defend.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Novel-based, Print & Play

name: Daimyo
description:
“Medieval Japanese Warfare theme. Each figure represents a company or unit of men. Victory: You win if you kill your opponents Daiyamo.”

The game is played on a chessboard or any other 8x8 grid. Miniatures or counters are used to represent the units, which come in ten types: Daimyo, Ashigaru Spearmen, Bushi Gunners, Bushi Spear Cavalry, Warrior Monks, Samurai Swordsmen, Samurai Horse Archers, Samurai Archers, Samurai Heavy Cavalry and Samurai Naginata. Both players start with an identical assortment of sixteen units which may set up as they desire on their back two rows of the board.

A custom deck of cards is central to the play of the game. The players draw a hand of cards from a common deck. Card play determines when units may move, attack, or defend.

name: Empires
description:
“Short rules for a quick play civilization like boardgame.”

Two or more players begin the game with one city and ten counters representing the population and military force. A standard deck of cards is used. A certain type of card, or combination of cards, must be played to perform certain actions in the game. The descriptions of the combinations include: Migration, Merchant, Combat, Apostle, Abundance, Exploration, War, Exodus, Colonization, Crusade, and Foundation.

The object of the game is to control more than half of the provinces on the map. A player who is eliminated may return as a foreign invader, starting with one city and six counters on the outer ring of provinces.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Ancient, Civilization, Print & Play

name: Courtroom Clash
description:
Devil’s Playground‘s first board game release, Courtroom Clash; which is based off of the Open Gaming License; is a game of attorneys and trials for two players: the prosecution and the defense (solitaire is also possible). It covers both criminal and civil trials; for simplicity, the terms “prosecution” and “defense” are used here for both, though “plaintiff” and “defendant” are the correct civil case terms. Courtroom Clash comes with all the materials needed to play the game in this single PDF which can be used for hours and hours of fun.

One six-sided die is required for play.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Moria Skirmish
description:
"Board & card game for 2 players. Battle between the Fellowship of the Ring and the Orcs of Moria. Abstract Skirmish level combat. Each figure represents a single man (unit). Victory: You win if you kill all the opposing figures."

The game is played on a chessboard or any other 8x8 grid. Miniatures or counters are used to represent the fighters. The Fellowship player has nine units and the Orc player has sixteen. A custom deck of cards is central to the play of the game. The players draw hands of cards from the shared deck. Card play determines when units may move, attack, and defend.

name: Starship Troopers
description:
"Board & card game for 2 players. Battle between Human Troopers and the Arachnoid Threat. Each figure represents a Trooper or Insect(s). Victory: Kill the opposing Leader."

The game is played on a chessboard or any other 8x8 grid. Miniatures or counters are used to represent the units. The Arachnoid player has sixteen units: eight Worker Swarms, seven Warrior Bugs, and a Queen. The Trooper player has seven Troopers and a Commander. A custom deck of cards is central to the play of the game. The players draw a hand of cards from a common deck. Card play determines when units may move, attack, or defend.
categories: Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Science Fiction

name: Orbital Escalation
description:
"Board & card game for 2 players. Battle between Satellites in Earth Orbit. Each figure represents a satellite, shuttle, space station or space marine squad. Victory: Destroy or capture the opposing Battle Station."

The game is played on a chessboard or any other 8x8 grid. Miniatures or counters are used to represent the satellites. Each player has sixteen units, composed of one Battle Station, two Attack Shuttles, three Hunter Killer Satellites, three Orbital Weapons Platforms, three Zero-G Space Marines, and four Orbital Mines.

A custom deck of cards is central to the play of the game. The players draw hands of cards from the shared deck. Card play determines when units may move, attack, and defend.

name: Starfight: Expansion Pack VI – Battleships
description:
This is the Expansion pack VI for the popular Beer & Pretzel’s Game Starfight. The expansion features a new kind of ship: the battleship. This is a heavily armed and mighty kind of ship capable to fire in more than one direction and featuring batteries and damage control. In this expansion you will find four battleships and the new rules covering them.
This is not a game itself, you need the Starfight base rules and the expansion pack III, in order to use this expansion.

This PDF contains
• A rule sheet
•Four ship sheets
•Four ship screens
•Four ship counters

Expands:

Starfight
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Protecting the Skies
description:
"Solo Dice Game. Simulation of an Air War between USA and an imaginary Middle Eastern Nation."

The game is played with paper, pencil, a ten-sided die, and one or two six-sided dice.

"The player plays the commander of Anti-Aircraft troops of an imaginary Middle Eastern Nation. The goal is to bring down ten American war planes to create anti-war sentiment in the USA and halt the American assault."
categories: Aviation / Flight, Modern Warfare, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Ikkozendo
description:
"Ikko" - one, a fragment, single

"Zendo" - the way of Zen, a mind-expanding game

"Ikkozendo" - a whole game of Zendo in one pocket!

Ikkozendo is a variant of Zendo that is played with a limited number of people who all are present at the game start. All must be present at game start because Ikkozendo is a single stash game and, as such, there will not be enough pyramids for the Students to build koans to seek the secret rule or for the Master to build koans to disprove a rule guess. Because no more than two koans are made during a game, the players' memory of previous configurations of the koans is critical to finishing the game. Thus, if players come and go, as is allowed in Zendo, then the game can get stuck in "cycles," as the same configurations are reused over and over again to disprove already-attempted guesses.

name: Pipsqueak
description: Each player is given six dice. All players roll one of their dice and hide it with their hand. Players make successively higher declarations regarding the results of all pips on the dice rolled, e.g. "seven pips". However, someone can always contest the bid, calling the bidder a pipsqueak. When that happens, all the dice are revealed, the pips are counted, and either the bidder or the caller loses their die, depending on who was correct. The last player with dice is the winner.

name: Hong Kong Phooey
description:
"Trump taking Card game for 2 or 4 players. Based on the Hanna Barbara Cartoon Hong Kong Phooey. Winning: The player with the lowest score after 4 Rounds wins the game."

The game uses a custom deck of forty cards. There are four suits in the deck: Hong Kong Phooey, Friends, Villains, and Extras. There are ten cards in each suit, numbered 1 through 10.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play

name: Miami Beach
description:
A card game of city building. The game uses a custom deck of cards. Each card represents one building. Each building has five traits: color, type, size, class, and age.

The players score points by constructing complimentary buildings next to one another. The number of points scored for placing (constructing) a building depends on how many traits it has in common with the immediate neighbor. This ranges from -5 points for zero common traits to 16 points for four traits in common.

"The game ends when there are no cards left in the deck and all possible cards have been played. Winning: The player with the most points at the end of the game wins."
categories: Card Game, City Building, Print & Play

name: Neolithic Traders
description:
"Players are Stone Age Tribes. Players create and trade objects of value. Victory: The first player with 50 Victory Points is the winner."

The game is played with a custom deck of cards made up of six suits: Weapons, Tools, Food & Textiles, Containers, Jewelry, and Statuettes.

The players score points by playing melds. There are two types of melds, Kits and Hoards. A Kit is a meld of six cards with one card from each suit. A Hoard is a meld of five cards from one suit.

name: Burmese Monopoly
description:
This is a very primitive copy of Monopoly from Burma (Myanmar).
It was purchased at a Burmese market in about 1990. As in all monopoly sets, the streets are named differently, but the play is the same. In Burmese Monopoly, all of the streets are named after cities and towns in the country of Burma.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Jaws
description:
"Card Game for 2 players. One player gets the Shark Deck. The other player gets the Shark Hunter Deck. The Hunters have a fishing boat. The boat has 5 Hull points. There are 5 people in the boat. The shark has 10 life points."

"Winning: A game of survival - if all five people are eaten, the Shark player wins. If the Shark is reduced to zero life points the Hunter player wins."
categories: Animals, Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Trioker
description:
The Trioker pieces are similar to the 24 mac-mahon triangles, except that the values are set at the corners instead of the sides. There is also a 25th special triangle, called Joker

There are two boards allowing two different kind of games : a pure abstract game for 2 players, and a bidding game for 2 to 3 players. Also included a set of puzzles to be solved for a single player.

At first sight, Trioker looks very much like Tri-Ominos, but in fact it is a much more complex game, with lots of logic involved.

name: Trugo
description:
Trugo is a board-less tile-laying game with Go-like capture. It has a "Waxing" phase, in which tiles and chips are added, and a "Waning" phase, in which chips are moved or tiles are removed to capture the chips they touch.

Trugo can be played with 36 Mambo tiles (plus 2 colors of chips, 25 each) by treating red and blue segments as equivalent.

name: Spe-Lingo
description: Spe-Lingo is a game of words. Each player competes for high score by composing words from letters dealt him. The system of play is similar to the card game Rummy.

name: Hitchhiker's Quest for the Galaxy
description:
"Card game for 2-4+ players. Hitch-Hiker’s Guide to the Galaxy Theme. Victory: The First player to complete the requirements on a Quest card he controls wins the game."
The game is played using a custom deck of approximately 80 cards. There are eighteen different types of cards in the deck. These include Quest, Main Character, Character, Planet, Robot, Fish, Ship, Thing, Location, Advice, and Condition cards. Except for the Quest cards, each card has one of six types of powers: Reveal Power, Continuous Power, Event Power, Discard Power, Sacrifice Power, and Alignment Power. The powers are used to try to meet the conditions on the Quest card that the player has in play.

Per the rules, the "most Depressed player goes first."
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: Unbreakable
description:
Unbreakable is a game of futuristic ground combat for 2 players. Each player assembles a platoon of crawlers, walkers, and powered armor squads and equips them with nukes, stasis rays, lasers, and more. Then the platoons meet in combat where they unleash terrible powers of overwhelming destruction.

The game can be downloaded for free from the following website:
http://interformic.com/un/

Game Components:
1 17" x 22" map
48 hex tiles
102 cards
24 counters
121 markers
2 player aids

You will also need at least 3 six-sided dice and about 50 coins or bingo chips.
publishers: (Web published), Interformic Games, Print & Play Productions

name: Army of Lappland
description:
Few shipping routes connected the Soviet Union to its western allies. One ran through Murmansk in the far north, kept ice-free by the Gulf Stream and built during the First World War for the express purpose of receiving military supplies from Britain and the United States. In June 1941, two German mountain divisions crossed the border from Finland, intent on capturing the port and sealing off this vital access. After fierce fighting along the Litsa River, the offensive finally failed in the face of fierce resistance by the Red Army and Navy and workers’ militia units.

In 1944, the Red Army returned the favor, with a lightning offensive spearheaded by elite light infantry and aimed at capturing Finland’s ice-free port of Petsamo and occupying northern Norway. The Soviets rolled back the Germans into Norway, crushing the Army of Lappland and closing the war's Arctic front.

Army of Lappland covers both of these campaigns, both the 1941 and 1942 battles in front of Murmansk and the 1944 counter-offensive. The game system is the same as that used in Tiger of Malaya, and in our long out-of-print Blood on the Snow. Units are mostly battalions, with the maps covering the area along the coast of the Arctic Ocean from Kirkenes in Norway to Murmansk at a scale of two kilometers per hex.

Components:

1,120 1/2-inch playing pieces
Two maps


(from Avalanche Press website)

name: Cuéntame cómo pasó, Trivia
description:
´Cuéntame, cómo pasó´, is a game similar to Trivial Pursuit where players must to ask the correct answer about the things what happened in Spain in 60´s and 70´s years. The game is based in a popular TV show with the same name.

The questions are based in typical things of those years, sports, celebrities, curiosities..

The game is in Spanish and the components are:
- 1 game board
- 400 cards question-answers
- 5 counters
- 1 dice,
- 1 rulebook

name: Chicky Memo
description:
In a small town, the farmers have to collect as many eggs as possible to feed their families. But in order to get the eggs, they must have a good memory. The have to memorize both the location of the nest and the colour underneath each look-alike hen. Playable in two levels of difficulty for both beginner and advanced players.

Unlike the classic memory card game, players are not looking for matching pairs. In this game, hens occupy nests but must always be returned to a different nest once their colour has been checked. Hence, the eight hens are always moving around the nine nest positions.

Also unlike traditional memory, the hens are not collected as the game progresses so there is not a simple endgame. Instead players collect the coloured eggs as a record of hens correctly found.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Educational, Farming, Memory

name: Die kleinen Regentropfen
description:
Rain clouds appear over the meadow (game board)... and from a previous rain shower, rain drops (small wooden chips) are on the slide, sand box and climbing tree. In turn, the children roll a color dice to determine which area they attempt to dry out. Then a card is drawn that determines which finger & which hand they will use to shift the drops. The children may cooperate and give each other hints. The difficulty is increased as players are forced to change fingers and/or hands by the game board.

This game helps young kids have a great time while learning their "right" & "left" as well as developing fine motor skills & hand/eye coordination.

-- paraphrased from a Babel-lation of the Spiel des Jahres entry

http://spieldesjahres.kiratec.eu/cms/front_content.php?idcat...;id=533

name: Yours or Mine!: A Game of Either Ore
description:
Yours or Mine! is played with a standard deck of cards for each player, plus pawns and markers.

The players each have a hand of seven cards. On a turn a player draws a card, plays a card, and moves their pawn one space.

The "spaces" are on cards: cards valued 6-10 are placed to extend tunnels, aces and face cards are the mother lodes which players claim, and the 2-5 are used for additional movement (with the 5s having special powers). All the cards are played to a common "board" which both players move on.

The first player to claim 21 points of mother lodes wins the game.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Killer Nobles
description:
This card game can be player with a standard deck of cards and was inspired by the hilarious game "Killer Bunnies". If your a fan of the Killer Bunnies game then you will recognize some of the game play mechanics given here. However you will also not fail to notice that it plays significantly differently.

Background Story
In ancient times Noble families fought each other over the diamond mines. They collected diamonds and tried constantly to kill the Nobles of other families. With their competition removed the name and reputation of their own family would rise.

(copied from website)

Game Link: http://www.bookranger.co.uk/CardGames/KillerNobles.htm

name: Domination
description: Domination is an abstract strategy game for 2. You will need a chessboard, some checkers and dominoes to play. You pick up the dominoes, place them on the board to restrict movement and then move your piece. If a player is unable to move, that player loses.

name: Take2
description: Take2 "The fast thinking word game" comes with instructions and 120 letter tiles. Each player starts with 8 tiles and uses them to make words in crossword/scrabble style in front of themselves. When one player has used all their tiles they call "Take2" and all players draw 2 more tiles to add to their stock. Words can be rearranged at any time and play continues until all tiles are in the players hands and one has used all their tiles. At that time points on tiles not in use count against those players. Several rounds can be played, adding the scores and the lowest scoring player winning after the agreed number of rounds.

name: Firaapeli
description: A Scrabble-like word game designed and published by an advertising agency for using as a gift to their customers. You are using nine letters, there are no tripling options, doubling options are scarce and there are some extra bonuses available. The rules are constantly making fun of the advertisement world.

name: The Ancient Pirates of Pernia
description:
Ancient Pirates of Pernia is a fantasy / strategy board game for ages 8 to adult that will provide hours of enjoyment! It involves ancient weaponry prior to widespread gunpowder use. Pirates will attack with ancient siege type weapons and swords to take cargo and plunder.

Game comes in a large "bag" and contains 8 sided Dice, and Directional Pirate Dice, Ship & Game Boards, Marker Clips for 1 to 4 players, & 50 Cards of; Action, Crew, Weapon and Cargo.
categories: Adventure, Ancient, Exploration, Fighting, Nautical, Pirates
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Auction/Bidding, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Boers
description:
What would have happened if the Boers had won the war VS the British? How would it have changed history and the globe? In this game you can find out. This game expands into the future space exploration realm.
This game assumes they would have been similar to Nazi Germany, and maybe even helped them for awhile but would break off in the end as Germany won Europe, and Japan then would have won Asia and the Pacific and America would just hold them off so that they retained N. and S. America, but barely.
categories: Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Stacks
description: Stacks is a card game for 2 to 4 players, played using a special deck of cards prepared from three other decks. Each player tries to build up stacks of cards of their own, like in solitaire. Whoever has the highest total wins.

name: The Great Chlén Race
description:
"Chlén! The six-legged beast of burden. Beloved of Avánthe, cursed by foot traffic, plodding steadily on, transporting an empire. Complain not of the chlén to those of the High Tower, who raise them and work their hide, or to Turning Wheel, who guide the ponderous chlén carts along the Sákbe Road. And when these clans challenge each other to a race on the Sákbe Road, let the by-stander beware! It's a contest of wits, endurance and cunning. Of course, it's also strictly illegal, so keep inducements at hand and the betting under the table."

This board game is set in M. A. R. Barker's World of Tékumel. Ms. Donnelly seems to have based it loosely on her RPG scenario of the same name that appeared in Issue Seven (04/22/04) of the Book of Visitations of Glory.

name: Wealth
description:
Object of the Game: To amass the Biggest Amount of Money possible.

Parts:
Dealer card
Money = $50, $100, $500 and $1,000
Square wooden colored tokens
Share Certificates for Aircraft, Auto, Chemical, Coal, Copper, Foods, Gold, Motion Pictures, Oil, Radio, Railroad, Rubber, Shipping, Silverm Steel and Telephone & Telegraph
80 playing cards with the same above-mentioned products.

name: Olli Osterhase
description:
Easter is approaching and Benny Bunny has his paws full. He is pleased with his job as the Easter Bunny, but he also needs a sharp mind. According to article IV of the Regulations stipulating the distribution of Easter eggs, there can never be two identical eggs is one basket. Can you help the Easter Bunny distribute the eggs properly?

The first player to get all four of their eggs into Easter baskets first wins, but placement of the eggs is not random! Using a die, plays can move the bunny, distribute an egg, or gain a carrot which has special other uses.

name: Beaver
description: This card game from the 1920s has a picture of a beaver named "Bonzo" on the box, but this character is not one of the animals in the game! The 52 cards of the game include 13 sets of 4. There is a 53rd card used for scoring purposes only. All of the artwork is by G E Studdy, who's most famous creation was "Bonzo."

name: Triangles
description:
TRIANGLES :

Players buy 3 and 4 spaces triangles from the 36 spaces triangle of the board. In that order, they bid simultaneously and secretly for a pair of triangles on the board. When the bids are revealed, the winner of the auction marks the two acquired spaces with triangles of his colour, and gets points of reward. He then elects two new spaces on the board for sale.
Every three rounds, all players receive 100 extra points for bidding.
The Board has special areas showing the capital and scores of each player.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Simultaneous Action Selection, Tile Placement

name: OP∙Position
description:
The goal is to capture 4 Checkers of one color or 6 checkers total. Each player takes a turn moving one of the checkers on the outside ring of the board, and then moving the die which is in the center of the board.

Full Game: http://www.pyromythgames.com/offerings/freegames/opposition/...

name: Dead Even
description:
To start the game place the dominoes face down and mix them well. Each player draws 5 tiles keeping the values hidden from the others. The youngest player should get to go first; play will continue clockwise. On a players turn they will take the following actions in order.

1. Draw a tile

2. Score a set of tiles if possible

3. Bring hand to 5 tiles

You score a set of tiles: Tiles are scored by matching a set of three or more so that the top row value is equal to the value of the bottom row.

Rules: http://www.pyromythgames.com/offerings/freegames/deadeven/de...

name: Unbridled Fury: Core
description:
"Unbridled Fury is a set of miniatures rules for the fantasy genre which is designed from the ground up for skirmish battles. These small engagements and affrays are set in worlds as diverse as the players themselves (as well as the history of our very own Earth). It has no ‘official’ setting or miniatures line and allows the players to use whatever they want, in whatever setting they desire."

"Game-play is fast and brutal. The game is a departure from the regular approach to fantasy skirmish games - combat feels more like an all-out brawl rather than organized groups of fighters rolling dice at each other. You can almost feel the pain of the fighters as they hurl themselves into battle. Once the players get a grip on the rules games are usually over in under an hour, which is crucial to those who have to squeeze real life in between them. Physical space required is also
small - most 4’ x 4’ terrain boards are ideal; kitchen tables will suffice, though, and may even produce a tighter battle."

The rules were designed to be used with 28mm figures. "[O]ne figure represents one warrior, beast or frothing lunatic, so the effect of a single figure on the game is of great importance."

"Every figure has a profile, a set of equipment (weapons, armour, etc.) and possibly some 'special abilities.'" The profile for a figure consists of nine categories plus any special abilities. Special abilities include Berserker, Camouflage, Creature of Darkness, Fanatic, Flier, Giantslayer, Invisible, Musician, Night Vision, Teleporter, Undead, and Were-Creature.

The game includes rules on creating characters, companies, and setting up games using scenario creation tables. The game play covers areas such as command, morale, visibility, ambushes, cowardice, and fires.

name: Mummbly
description:
from the box front:
Mummbly
General Knowledge
A Game of Chance & Trivia

from the box back:
Roll the Dice,
Knock Down the Numbers,
Answer the Questions
& Score

from the manufacturer's website (www.mummbly.ca)
Mummbly Chance - This is a low score dice game that involves concealing a number or any one combination of numbers in the series according to the sum of the dice toss.
Mummbly Trivia - This is a high score trivia dice game that involves concealing a number or any one combination of numbers in the series according to the sum of the dice toss, and collecting valued trivia cards.

This game is very similar to Double Shutter. The game box starts with the numbers 1-9 flipped up. You roll two d6 and add them together. You then flip down enough numbers to add up to the total you rolled. Once you roll a number that can't be summed up by numbers still showing, you score by counting and summing these remaining numbers. This is the Mumbly Chance game. Mumbly Trivia adds Trivial Pursuit-like cards to the gameplay.

name: Artist: The Game
description:
"For anyone who has ever dreamed of being among the collectors and the collected... Of organizing the openings and celebrating the sales... Of starving artists in a garret for the sake of the muse... But be warned: in the game, as in life, it takes more than talent to win. Anyone can play Artist - but, it's only the right combination of cash, canvases, contacts, and conniving that will make you a success!"

The first edition states that it was limited to 2000 copies.

Components include a game board styled after an artist's palette, instructions, a pad of Resume Score Sheets, cards, play money, and plastic discs.

name: Century of Glory
description:
"A Simulation Study of Operational Warfare from 1840-1900."

A set of rules for wargaming miniature battles from the second half of the nineteenth century. The rulebook includes army lists for many wars from the last half of the nineteenth century, making the rules suitable for a variety of situations ranging from Colonial Conflicts to the American Civil War to the Franco Austrian War of 1859. Each figure represents 40 men, so the rules are suitable for use with 5-25mm scale miniatures.

Publication date is approximate.

name: Spritz-Duell
description:
Spritz Duell is water game to be played in a bathtub or a swimming pool, though it could be played in a sink as well. The "board" is a round plastic ring with a net attached. This is placed in the water and four flowers each of red and yellow are placed inside the ring floating. On "go", two players fill up their squirting animals (purple and green hippo-dino looking things) and squirt water into the opposing player's flowers, trying to sink them. The first player to sink the other's flowers wins.

There is another game on BGG called Spritz Toor, and based on the description it sounds like this one but with a Football theme.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Nautical

name: Paw Pals: The Dancing Ewok Card Game
description:
In 1984, Parker Brothers released 3 card games in the Star Wars "Ewok Card Game Assortment" series: Favorite Five, Say "Cheese!", and Paw Pals.

This game is a spin-off of the Star Wars: Return of the Jedi movie with the Ewoks. This game was aimed at children Ages 4 - 8.

The players are trying to place all their cards in the "Friendship chain".

From the rules: "Like everything else they do, EWOKS have a special way of dancing. They hold up their arms and link their paws in a never-ending chain of friendship. EWOKS claim that the more they dance, the livelier they seem to feel. No doubt that's true. And you'll soon find out for yourself as you play this charming game."

The game plays by placing cards that fits the place where the paws of the other EWOKS' paws are located on the cards. Each cards placed next to another card must align the paws of the ewoks to be next to each other so that they "hold their paws". The winner is the first player to place all his cards.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Puzzle, Science Fiction

name: LOST The Answers
description:
You will play as one of the survivors of the ill-fated Oceanic flight 815 which crash-landed on an island somewhere in the Pacific Ocean. You must go exploring with other survivors, visiting certain locations in order to discover answers to the many questions which surround the mysterious island.
Each time a player gains Answers Counters, the Story track will advance. When this track reaches the end, the game is over and the player with the highest value of Answers counters is the winner.

LOST The Answers is a fun, Print and Play, Card Game (which uses a board) for 2 – 5 players. You can get all the files needed to produce the game for FREE from http://mmboardgames.page.tl/MM-Board-Games.htm

This is a revamp (using several brand new elements) of our old LOST Card Game, and brings things right up to date including events from Season 4 of the show.

LOST is a copyrighted property. This is an unauthorized, unofficial game produced merely for the entertainment of fans and is non-profit making. This game is completely FREE for you to download, print and play.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play
mechanics: Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Title Triumph
description:
Title Triumph is sold by the American Land Title Association as a training aid for land title professionals. The base game includes 200 question cards on the topics of closing & escrow, search & exam, commitments & policies, and general industry.

A 190-card 'Level Two' expansion adds questions on these additional topics: Basic Principles of Title Insurance Underwriting, Encumbrances, Water Rights and Related Issues, Policies, Subdivisions, Uniform Commercial Code, Endorsements, Reinsurance and Coinsurance, Claims, and Legal Descriptions.

name: The Game of '49
description:
Game board has 49 rectangular card size spaces. Each space has a theme, i.e. "The pathfinder", "prairie beef" and "Read em and weep."

Game has 49 cards that match each space on the board. Also has "claim jumper" cards. Lots of paper money which is called "Nuggets"

name: Superman
description:
Roll-and-Move game where each player controls a superman pawn.

Object of the Game: Be the first player to bring your Villain to Jail and disarm his Secret Weapon at the Crime Lab.

Each player moves around the board uncovering question mark tokens in the hopes of finding the appropriate villain. Once found, they put the villain into the holder on their pawn and take him to jail.

After depositing the villains in jail, each player must find and disarm their secret weapon. The first player to disarm their secret weapon (by spinning an even number while the weapon is in their possession) wins.
mechanics: Memory, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: TV Mania
description:
From The Website

TV Mania is the first totally television-based board game complete with interactive DVD, and the ultimate television history information.

It covers the most popular and best loved TV shows and TV stars we invited into our lounges every day and made part of our lives.

TV Mania is a celebration of television, incorporating celebrity bios, celebrity births and deaths, photos, the highest paid TV personalities, information, news & trivia from the Lone Ranger in 1949 and Superman in 1951, through to today with Desperate Housewives, Rove Live, Friends, Frasier, Home & Away, The Simpsons, Neighbours and 24.

So, take a trip down memory lane to the American, British, and Australian TV shows and stars you loved, and hated, over the years.

Designer: Glen Charles Rowell (https://a4jp.com/services-list-en/gallery-product-design-en/)

name: Skirmish
description:
"Skirmish is a game of warriors on the battleground fighting in the midst of chaos. Bodies lie everywhere, and there are enough of the armies remaining that none can retreat. Each warrior is without a side to aid them. All other players in the game are their enemy. The last warrior standing is the winner."

"Inspired by Atlas Games' Lunch Money."

The game is available on the author's website here-
http://www.curufea.com/games/skirmish/

name: Hexway
description: Hexway The New Game from the AHOY Series of games produced by Robert Ross and Co. LTD is advertised as a game that is simple enough for children and subtle enough for grownups. The game appears to be a tile laying game where a road and houses are constructed from hexes. No other information is available at this time but the game is presently being researched.

name: Da Vinci Code: Het Bordspel – 5 Nieuwe Mysteries
description: This is an expansion to The Da Vinci Code Board Game: The Quest for the Truth, adding cards for five new mysteries.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Memory, Murder/Mystery, Novel-based

name: Polemos: Franco-Prussian War
description:
POLEMOS - FRANCO PRUSSIAN WAR

When Emperor Louis Napoleon declared war on Prussia in Summer 1870 he was at the head of an army that most contemporaries regarded as the leading military force in Europe. No doubt he had plans of recreating the Glory of his illustrious namesake Uncle.
